Text

The Gambler

by [Fyodor Dostoyevsky]43-fyodor dostoyevsky

Translated by [C. J. Hogarth]44-c. j. hogarth

[I]0-edgeways

At length [I]0-edgeways returned from two weeks leave of absence to find that [[my]0-edgeways patrons]149-my patrons had arrived three days ago in [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg . [I]0-edgeways received from [them]149-my patrons a welcome quite different to that which [I]0-edgeways had expected . [The General]150-the general eyed [me]0-edgeways coldly , greeted [me]0-edgeways in rather haughty fashion , and dismissed [me]0-edgeways to pay [my]0-edgeways respects to [[his]150-the general sister]151-his sister . It was clear that from _ somewhere _ money had been acquired . [I]0-edgeways thought [I]0-edgeways could even detect a certain shamefacedness in [the General]150-the general s glance . [Maria Philipovna]45-maria philipovna , too , seemed distraught , and conversed with [me]0-edgeways with an air of detachment . Nevertheless , [she]151-his sister took the money which [I]0-edgeways handed to [her]151-his sister , counted it , and listened to what [I]0-edgeways had to tell . To luncheon there were expected that day a [Monsieur Mezentsov]46-monsieur mezentsov , [a French lady]153-a french lady , and [an Englishman]154-an englishman ; for , whenever money was in hand , a banquet in Muscovite style was always given . [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina , on seeing [me]0-edgeways , inquired why [I]0-edgeways had been so long away . Then , without waiting for an answer , [she]47-polina departed . Evidently this was not mere accident , and [I]0-edgeways felt that [I]0-edgeways must throw some light upon matters . It was high time that [I]0-edgeways did so .

[I]0-edgeways was assigned [a small room on [the fourth floor of [the hotel]157-the hotel]156-the fourth floor of the hotel]155-a small room on the fourth floor of the hotel ( for [you]158-you must know that [I]0-edgeways belonged to [[the General]150-the general s suite]160-the general s suite ) . So far as [I]0-edgeways could see , the party had already gained some notoriety in [the place]161-the place , which had come to look upon [the General]150-the general as [a Russian nobleman of great wealth]163-a russian nobleman of great wealth . Indeed , even before luncheon [he]150-the general charged [me]0-edgeways , among other things , to get two thousand - franc notes changed for [him]150-the general at [the hotel counter]164-the hotel counter , which put [us]165-us in a position to be [thought millionaires]166-thought millionaires at all events for a week ! Later , [I]0-edgeways was about to take [Mischa]48-mischa and [Nadia]49-nadia for a walk when a summons reached [me]0-edgeways from the staircase that [I]0-edgeways must attend [the General]150-the general . [He]150-the general began by deigning to inquire of [me]0-edgeways where [I]0-edgeways was going to take [the children]168-the children ; and as [he]150-the general did so , [I]0-edgeways could see that [he]150-the general failed to look [me]0-edgeways in the eyes . [He]150-the general _ wanted _ to do so , but each time was met by [me]0-edgeways with such a fixed , disrespectful stare that [he]150-the general desisted in confusion . In pompous language , however , which jumbled one sentence into another , and at length grew disconnected , [he]150-the general gave [me]0-edgeways to understand that [I]0-edgeways was to lead [the children]168-the children altogether away from [the Casino]170-the casino , and out into [the park]171-the park . Finally [his]150-the general anger exploded , and [he]150-the general added sharply :

" [I]150-the general suppose [you]0-edgeways would like to take [them]168-the children to [the Casino]170-the casino to play roulette ? Well , excuse [my]150-the general speaking so plainly , but [I]150-the general know how addicted [you]0-edgeways are to gambling . Though [I]150-the general am not [[your]0-edgeways mentor]1727-your mentor , nor wish to be , at least [I]150-the general have a right to require that [you]0-edgeways shall not actually _ compromise _ [me]150-the general . "[150-the general]

" [I]0-edgeways have no money for gambling , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways quietly replied .

" But [you]0-edgeways will soon be in receipt of some , "[150-the general] retorted [the General]150-the general , reddening a little as [he]150-the general dived into [his]150-the general writing desk and applied [himself]150-the general to a memorandum book . From it [he]150-the general saw that [he]150-the general had 120 roubles of mine in [his]150-the general keeping .

" Let [us]1728-us calculate , "[150-the general] [he]150-the general went on . " [We]1728-us must translate these roubles into thalers . Here take 100 thalers , as a round sum . The rest will be safe in [my]150-the general hands . "[150-the general]

In silence [I]0-edgeways took the money .

" [You]0-edgeways must not be offended at what [I]150-the general say , "[150-the general] [he]150-the general continued . " [You]0-edgeways are too touchy about these things . What [I]150-the general have said [I]150-the general have said merely as a warning . To do so is no more than [my]150-the general right . "[150-the general]

When returning [home]173-home with [the children]168-the children before luncheon , [I]0-edgeways met [a cavalcade of [[our]176-our party]177-our party riding to view [some ruins]178-some ruins]175-a cavalcade of our party riding to view some ruins . [Two splendid carriages , magnificently horsed , with [Mlle]50-mlle]179-two splendid carriages , magnificently horsed , with mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle , [Maria Philipovna]45-maria philipovna , and [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina in one of [them]179-two splendid carriages , magnificently horsed , with mlle , and [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman , [the Englishman]181-the englishman , and [the General in attendance on horseback]182-the general in attendance on horseback ! [The passers - by]183-the passers - by stopped to stare at [them]179-two splendid carriages , magnificently horsed , with mlle , for the effect was splendid [the General]150-the general could not have improved upon it . [I]0-edgeways calculated that , with the 4000 francs which [I]0-edgeways had brought with [me]0-edgeways , added to what [[my]0-edgeways patrons]149-my patrons seemed already to have acquired , [the party]186-the party must be in possession of at least 7000 or 8000 francs though that would be none too much for [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle , who , with [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother and [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman , was also lodging in [[our]189-our hotel]190-our hotel . [The latter gentleman]191-the latter gentleman was called by [the lacqueys]192-the lacqueys " [Monsieur le Comte]51-monsieur le comte , "[50-mlle] and [Mlle]50-mlle . [[Blanche]50-mlle s mother]193-blanche s mother was dubbed " [Madame la Comtesse]52-madame la comtesse . "[193-blanche s mother] Perhaps in very truth [they]194-they _ were _ " [Comte et Comtesse]53-comte et comtesse . "[193-blanche s mother]

[I]0-edgeways knew that " [Monsieur le Comte]51-monsieur le comte "[0-edgeways] would take no notice of [me]0-edgeways when [we]189-our met at dinner , as also that [the General]150-the general would not dream of introducing [us]189-our , nor of recommending [me]0-edgeways to [the " Comte]1729-the " comte . "[196-the latter] However , [the latter]196-the latter had lived awhile in [Russia]2-russia , and knew that [the person referred to as an " uchitel "]1730-the person referred to as an " uchitel "[1730-the person referred to as an " uchitel "] is never looked upon as a bird of fine feather . Of course , strictly speaking , [he]150-the general _ knew _ [me]0-edgeways ; but [I]0-edgeways was [an uninvited guest at the luncheon]197-an uninvited guest at the luncheon [the General]150-the general had forgotten to arrange otherwise , or [I]0-edgeways should have been dispatched to dine at the table d h te . Nevertheless , [I]0-edgeways presented [myself]0-edgeways in such guise that [the General]150-the general looked at [me]0-edgeways with a touch of approval ; and , though [the good Maria Philipovna]45-maria philipovna was for showing [me]0-edgeways [my]0-edgeways place , the fact of [my]0-edgeways having previously met [the Englishman]181-the englishman , [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , saved [me]0-edgeways , and thenceforward [I]0-edgeways figured as one of [the company]201-the company .

This strange Englishman [I]0-edgeways had met first in [Prussia]3-prussia , where [we]202-our had happened to sit _ vis- -vis _ in [a railway train]203-a railway train in which [I]0-edgeways was travelling to overtake [[our]202-our party]177-our party ; while , later , [I]0-edgeways had run across [him]181-the englishman in [France]4-france , and again in [Switzerland]5-switzerland twice within the space of two weeks ! To think , therefore , that [I]0-edgeways should suddenly encounter [him]181-the englishman again here , in [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg ! Never in [my]0-edgeways life had [I]0-edgeways known [a more retiring man]205-a more retiring man , for [he]181-the englishman was shy to the pitch of imbecility , yet well aware of the fact ( for [he]181-the englishman was [no fool]206-no fool ) . At the same time , [he]181-the englishman was [a gentle , amiable sort of an individual]207-a gentle , amiable sort of an individual , and , even on [our]202-our first encounter in [Prussia]3-prussia [I]0-edgeways had contrived to draw [him]181-the englishman out , and [he]181-the englishman had told [me]0-edgeways that [he]181-the englishman had just been to [the North Cape]6-the north cape , and was now anxious to visit [the fair at [Nizhni Novgorod]7-nizhni novgorod]208-the fair at nizhni novgorod . How [he]181-the englishman had come to make [the General]150-the general s acquaintance [I]0-edgeways do not know , but , apparently , [he]181-the englishman was much struck with [Polina]47-polina . Also , [he]181-the englishman was delighted that [I]0-edgeways should sit next [him]181-the englishman at table , for [he]181-the englishman appeared to look upon [me]0-edgeways as [[his]181-the englishman bosom friend]210-his bosom friend .

During the meal [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman was in great feather : [he]180-the frenchman was discursive and pompous to [every one]212-every one . In [Moscow]8-moscow too , [I]0-edgeways remembered , [he]180-the frenchman had blown a great many bubbles . Interminably [he]180-the frenchman discoursed on finance and Russian politics , and though , at times , [the General]150-the general made feints to contradict [him]180-the frenchman , [he]180-the frenchman did so humbly , and as though wishing not wholly to lose sight of [his]180-the frenchman own dignity .

For [myself]0-edgeways , [I]0-edgeways was in a curious frame of mind . Even before luncheon was half finished [I]0-edgeways had asked [myself]0-edgeways the old , eternal question : " _ Why _ do [I]0-edgeways continue to dance attendance upon [the General]150-the general , instead of having left [him]150-the general and [[his]150-the general family]1732-his family long ago ? "[0-edgeways] Every now and then [I]0-edgeways would glance at [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina , but [she]47-polina paid [me]0-edgeways no attention ; until eventually [I]0-edgeways became so irritated that [I]0-edgeways decided to play [the boor]214-the boor .

First of all [I]0-edgeways suddenly , and for no reason whatever , plunged loudly and gratuitously into the general conversation . Above everything [I]0-edgeways wanted to pick a quarrel with [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman ; and , with that end in view [I]0-edgeways turned to [the General]150-the general , and exclaimed in an overbearing sort of way indeed , [I]0-edgeways think that [I]0-edgeways actually interrupted [him]150-the general that that summer it had been almost impossible for [a Russian]217-a russian to dine anywhere at tables d h te . [The General]150-the general bent upon [me]0-edgeways a glance of astonishment .

" If [one]1733-one is [a man of self - respect]1734-a man of self - respect , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways went on , " [one]1733-one risks abuse by so doing , and is forced to put up with insults of every kind . Both at [Paris]9-paris and on [the Rhine]10-the rhine , and even in [Switzerland]5-switzerland there are so many [Poles]55-the poles , with [[their]55-the poles sympathisers]1736-their sympathisers , [the French]1737-the french , at these tables d h te that [one]1733-one can not get a word in [edgeways]0-edgeways if [one]1733-one happens only to be [a Russian]56-a russian . "[0-edgeways]

This [I]0-edgeways said in French . [The General]150-the general eyed [me]0-edgeways doubtfully , for [he]150-the general did not know whether to be angry or merely to feel surprised that [I]0-edgeways should so far forget [myself]0-edgeways .

" Of course , [one]1733-one always learns _ something everywhere _ , "[180-the frenchman] said [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman in a careless , contemptuous sort of tone .

" In [Paris]9-paris , too , [I]0-edgeways had a dispute with [a Pole]1741-a pole , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways continued , " and then with [a French officer who supported [him]1741-a pole]1742-a french officer who supported him . After that [a section of [the Frenchmen present]1744-the frenchmen present]1743-a section of the frenchmen present took [my]0-edgeways part . [They]1743-a section of the frenchmen present did so as soon as [I]0-edgeways told [them]1743-a section of the frenchmen present the story of how once [I]0-edgeways threatened to spit into [Monsignor]57-monsignor s coffee . "[0-edgeways]

" To spit into it ? "[150-the general] [the General]150-the general inquired with grave disapproval in [his]150-the general tone , and a stare , of astonishment , while [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman looked at [me]0-edgeways unbelievingly .

" Just so , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied . " [You]150-the general must know that , on one occasion , when , for two days , [I]150-the general had felt certain that at any moment [I]150-the general might have to depart for [Rome]12-rome on business , [I]150-the general repaired to [the Embassy of [the Holy See in [Paris]9-paris]13-the holy see in paris]1745-the embassy of the holy see in paris , to have [my]150-the general passport visaed . There [I]150-the general encountered [a sacristan of about fifty]1746-a sacristan of about fifty , and [a man dry and cold of mien]1747-a man dry and cold of mien . After listening politely , but with great reserve , to [my]150-the general account of [myself]150-the general , [this sacristan]1748-this sacristan asked [me]150-the general to wait a little . [I]150-the general was in a great hurry to depart , but of course [I]150-the general sat down , pulled out a copy of _ L Opinion Nationale _ , and fell to reading an extraordinary piece of invective against [Russia]2-russia which it happened to contain . As [I]150-the general was thus engaged [I]150-the general heard [some one]1749-some one enter [an adjoining room]1750-an adjoining room and ask for [Monsignor]57-monsignor ; after which [I]150-the general saw [the sacristan]1751-the sacristan make a low bow to [the visitor]1752-the visitor , and then another bow as [the visitor]1752-the visitor took [his]1752-the visitor leave . [I]150-the general ventured to remind [the good man]1754-the good man of [my]150-the general own business also ; whereupon , with an expression of , if anything , increased dryness , [he]1754-the good man again asked [me]150-the general to wait . Soon [a third visitor]1755-a third visitor arrived who , like [myself]150-the general , had come on business ( [he]1755-a third visitor was [an Austrian of some sort]1756-an austrian of some sort ) ; and as soon as ever [he]1755-a third visitor had stated [his]1755-a third visitor errand [he]1755-a third visitor was conducted [upstairs]1757-upstairs ! This made [me]150-the general very angry . [I]150-the general rose , approached [the sacristan]1751-the sacristan , and told [him]1751-the sacristan that , since [Monsignor]57-monsignor was receiving [callers]1759-callers , [[his]57-monsignor lordship]1760-his lordship might just as well finish off [my]150-the general affair as well . Upon this [the sacristan]1751-the sacristan shrunk back in astonishment . It simply passed [his]1751-the sacristan understanding that [any insignificant Russian]1762-any insignificant russian should dare to compare [himself]1762-any insignificant russian with [other visitors of [Monsignor]57-monsignor s]1763-other visitors of monsignor s ! In a tone of the utmost effrontery , as though [he]1751-the sacristan were delighted to have a chance of insulting [me]150-the general , [he]1751-the sacristan looked [me]150-the general up and down , and then said : "[150-the general] Do [you]223-you suppose that [Monsignor]57-monsignor is going to put aside [his]57-monsignor coffee for _ [you]223-you ? _ " But [I]0-edgeways only cried the louder : "[0-edgeways] Let [me]0-edgeways tell [you]224-you that [I]0-edgeways am going to _ spit _ into that coffee ! Yes , and if [you]224-you do not get [me]0-edgeways [my]0-edgeways passport visaed this very minute , [I]0-edgeways shall take it to [Monsignor]57-monsignor [myself]0-edgeways . " "[0-edgeways]

" What ? While [he]57-monsignor is engaged with [a Cardinal]1764-a cardinal ? "[1751-the sacristan] screeched [the sacristan]1751-the sacristan , again shrinking back in horror . Then , rushing to the door , [he]1751-the sacristan spread out [his]1751-the sacristan arms as though [he]1751-the sacristan would rather die than let [me]0-edgeways enter .

Thereupon [I]0-edgeways declared that [I]0-edgeways was [a heretic]226-a heretic and [a barbarian]227-a barbarian " Je suis h r tique et barbare , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said , " and that [these archbishops]1765-these archbishops and [cardinals]1766-cardinals and [monsignors]1767-monsignors , and the rest of [them]1765-these archbishops , meant nothing at all to [me]0-edgeways . In a word , [I]0-edgeways showed [him]1751-the sacristan that [I]0-edgeways was not going to give way . [He]1751-the sacristan looked at [me]0-edgeways with an air of infinite resentment . Then [he]1751-the sacristan snatched up [my]0-edgeways passport , and departed with it [upstairs]1757-upstairs . A minute later the passport had been visaed ! Here it is now , if [you]1751-the sacristan care to see it , "[0-edgeways] and [I]0-edgeways pulled out the document , and exhibited the Roman visa .

" But "[150-the general] [the General]150-the general began .

" What really saved [you]0-edgeways was the fact that [you]0-edgeways proclaimed [yourself]0-edgeways [a heretic]226-a heretic and [a barbarian]227-a barbarian , "[180-the frenchman] remarked [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman with a smile . " Cela n tait pas si b te . "[180-the frenchman]

" But is _ that _ how [Russian subjects]1771-russian subjects ought to be treated ? Why , when [they]1771-russian subjects settle [here]1772-here [they]1771-russian subjects dare not utter even a word [they]1771-russian subjects are ready even to deny the fact that [they]1771-russian subjects are [Russians]58-russians ! At all events , at [[my]150-the general hotel in [Paris]9-paris]1773-my hotel in paris [I]150-the general received far more attention from [the company]201-the company after [I]150-the general had told [them]201-the company about the fracas with [the sacristan]1751-the sacristan . [A fat Polish nobleman]1776-a fat polish nobleman , who had been the most offensive of [all who were present at the table d h te]1777-all who were present at the table d h te , at once went [upstairs]1757-upstairs , while [some of [the Frenchmen]1780-the frenchmen]1779-some of the frenchmen were simply disgusted when [I]150-the general told [them]1779-some of the frenchmen that two years ago [I]150-the general had encountered [a man at whom , in 1812 , [a French hero]1782-a french hero fired for the mere fun of discharging [his]1782-a french hero musket]1781-a man at whom , in 1812 , a french hero fired for the mere fun of discharging his musket . [That man]1783-that man was then [a boy of ten]1784-a boy of ten and [[his]1783-that man family]1732-his family are still residing in [Moscow]8-moscow . "[150-the general]

" Impossible ! "[180-the frenchman] [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman spluttered . " [No French soldier]1786-no french soldier would fire at [a child]1787-a child ! "[180-the frenchman]

" Nevertheless the incident was as [I]0-edgeways say , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied . " [A very respected ex - captain]1788-a very respected ex - captain told [me]0-edgeways the story , and [I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways could see the scar left on [his]180-the frenchman cheek . "[0-edgeways]

[The Frenchman]180-the frenchman then began chattering volubly , and [the General]150-the general supported [him]180-the frenchman ; but [I]0-edgeways recommended [the former]233-the former to read , for example , extracts from the memoirs of [General Perovski]59-general perovski , who , in 1812 , was [a prisoner in the hands of [the French]60-the french]234-a prisoner in the hands of the french . Finally [Maria Philipovna]45-maria philipovna said something to interrupt the conversation . [The General]150-the general was furious with [me]0-edgeways for having started the altercation with [the Frenchman]61-the frenchman . On the other hand , [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley seemed to take great pleasure in [my]0-edgeways brush with [Monsieur]236-monsieur , and , rising from the table , proposed that [we]237-we should go and have a drink together . The same afternoon , at four o clock , [I]0-edgeways went to have [my]0-edgeways customary talk with [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina ; and , the talk soon extended to a stroll . [We]237-we entered [the Park]171-the park , and approached [the Casino]170-the casino , where [Polina]47-polina seated [herself]47-polina upon a bench near [the fountain]240-the fountain , and sent [Nadia]49-nadia away to a little distance to play with [some other children]241-some other children . [Mischa]48-mischa also [I]0-edgeways dispatched to play by [the fountain]240-the fountain , and in this fashion [we]237-we that is to say , [Polina]47-polina and [myself]0-edgeways contrived to find [ourselves]237-we alone .

Of course , [we]237-we began by talking on business matters . [Polina]47-polina seemed furious when [I]0-edgeways handed [her]47-polina only 700 g lden , for [she]47-polina had thought to receive from [Paris]9-paris , as the proceeds of the pledging of [her]47-polina diamonds , at least 2000 g lden , or even more .

" Come what may , [I]47-polina _ must _ have money , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina said . " And get it somehow [I]47-polina will otherwise [I]47-polina shall be ruined . "[47-polina]

[I]0-edgeways asked [her]47-polina what had happened during [my]0-edgeways absence .

" Nothing ; except that two pieces of news have reached [us]237-we from [St. Petersburg]14-st. petersburg . In the first place , [[my]47-polina grandmother]1789-my grandmother is very ill , and unlikely to last another couple of days . [We]237-we had this from [Timothy Petrovitch]62-timothy petrovitch [himself]62-timothy petrovitch , and [he]62-timothy petrovitch is [a reliable person]1790-a reliable person . Every moment [we]237-we are expecting to receive news of the end . "[47-polina]

" All of [you]47-polina are on the tiptoe of expectation ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways queried .

" Of course all of [us]237-we , and every minute of the day . For a year - and - a - half now [we]237-we have been looking for this . "[47-polina]

" Looking for it ? "[47-polina]

" Yes , looking for it . [I]47-polina am not [[her]1789-my grandmother blood relation]1791-her blood relation , [you]47-polina know [I]47-polina am merely [[the General]150-the general s step - daughter]1793-the general s step - daughter . Yet [I]47-polina am certain that [the old lady]1794-the old lady has remembered [me]47-polina in [her]1794-the old lady will . "[47-polina]

" Yes , [I]0-edgeways believe that [you]47-polina _ will _ come in for a good deal , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said with some assurance .

" Yes , for [she]1794-the old lady is fond of [me]243-me . But how come [you]47-polina to think so ? "[243-me]

[I]0-edgeways answered this question with another one . " [That Marquis of [yours]47-polina]1795-that marquis of yours , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said , " is _ [he]1795-that marquis of yours _ also familiar with [your]47-polina family secrets ? "[0-edgeways]

" And why are [you]0-edgeways [yourself]0-edgeways so interested in them ? "[243-me] was [her]243-me retort as [she]243-me eyed [me]0-edgeways with dry grimness .

" Never mind . If [I]243-me am not mistaken , [the General]150-the general has succeeded in borrowing money of [the Marquis]1797-the marquis . "[243-me]

" It may be so . "[243-me]

" Is it likely that [the Marquis]1797-the marquis would have lent the money if [he]1797-the marquis had not known something or other about [[your]0-edgeways grandmother]1799-your grandmother ? Did [you]0-edgeways notice , too , that three times during luncheon , when speaking of [her]1799-your grandmother , [he]1797-the marquis called [her]1799-your grandmother [La Baboulenka]63-la baboulenka ? [ 1 ] . What loving , friendly behaviour , to be sure ! "[243-me]

[ 1 ] [Dear little Grandmother]64-the grandmother .

" Yes , that is true . As soon as ever [he]1797-the marquis learnt that [I]0-edgeways was likely to inherit something from [her]1799-your grandmother [he]1797-the marquis began to pay [me]0-edgeways [his]1797-the marquis addresses . [I]0-edgeways thought [you]0-edgeways ought to know that . "[0-edgeways]

" Then [he]1797-the marquis has only just begun [his]1797-the marquis courting ? Why , [I]0-edgeways thought [he]1797-the marquis had been doing so a long while ! "[0-edgeways]

" [You]47-polina _ know _ [he]1797-the marquis has not , "[47-polina] retorted [Polina]47-polina angrily . " But where on earth did [you]0-edgeways pick up [this Englishman]1800-this englishman ? "[47-polina] [She]47-polina said this after a pause .

" [I]47-polina _ knew _ [you]47-polina would ask about [him]1800-this englishman ! "[47-polina] Whereupon [I]0-edgeways told [her]47-polina of [my]0-edgeways previous encounters with [Astley]54-mr. astley while travelling .

" [He]1800-this englishman is very shy , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said , " and susceptible . Also , [he]1800-this englishman is in love with [you]47-polina . "[0-edgeways]

" Yes , [he]1800-this englishman _ is _ in love with [me]47-polina , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina replied .

" And [he]1800-this englishman is ten times richer than [the Frenchman]61-the frenchman . In fact , what does [the Frenchman]61-the frenchman possess ? To [me]47-polina it seems at least doubtful that [he]1800-this englishman possesses anything at all . "[47-polina]

" Oh , no , there is no doubt about it . [He]1800-this englishman does possess some ch teau or other . Last night [the General]150-the general told [me]0-edgeways that for certain . _ Now _ are [you]47-polina satisfied ? "[0-edgeways]

" Nevertheless , in [your]47-polina place [I]47-polina should marry [the Englishman]65-the englishman . "[47-polina]

" And why ? "[47-polina] asked [Polina]47-polina .

" Because , though [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman is the handsomer of [the two]1803-the two , [he]180-the frenchman is also the baser ; whereas [the Englishman]181-the englishman is not only [a man of honour]1805-a man of honour , but ten times the wealthier of [the pair]1806-the pair . "[47-polina]

" Yes ? But then [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman is [a marquis]1808-a marquis , and [the cleverer of [the two]1803-the two]1809-the cleverer of the two , "[47-polina] remarked [Polina]47-polina imperturbably .

" Is that so ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways repeated .

" Yes ; absolutely . "[47-polina]

[Polina]47-polina was not at all pleased at [my]0-edgeways questions ; [I]0-edgeways could see that [she]47-polina was doing [her]47-polina best to irritate [me]0-edgeways with the brusquerie of [her]47-polina answers . But [I]0-edgeways took no notice of this .

" It amuses [me]47-polina to see [you]0-edgeways grow angry , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina continued . " However , inasmuch as [I]47-polina allow [you]0-edgeways to indulge in these questions and conjectures , [you]0-edgeways ought to pay [me]47-polina something for the privilege . "[47-polina]

" [I]0-edgeways consider that [I]0-edgeways have a perfect right to put these questions to [you]47-polina , "[0-edgeways] was [my]0-edgeways calm retort ; " for the reason that [I]0-edgeways am ready to pay for them , and also care little what becomes of [me]0-edgeways . "[0-edgeways]

[Polina]47-polina giggled .

" Last time [you]0-edgeways told [me]0-edgeways when on the Shlangenberg that at a word from [me]0-edgeways [you]0-edgeways would be ready to jump down a thousand feet into [the abyss]1811-the abyss . Some day [I]0-edgeways may remind [you]0-edgeways of that saying , in order to see if [you]0-edgeways will be as good as [your]0-edgeways word . Yes , [you]0-edgeways may depend upon it that [I]0-edgeways shall do so . [I]0-edgeways hate [you]0-edgeways because [I]0-edgeways have allowed [you]0-edgeways to go to such lengths , and [I]0-edgeways also hate [you]0-edgeways and still more because [you]0-edgeways are so necessary to [me]0-edgeways . For the time being [I]0-edgeways want [you]0-edgeways , so [I]0-edgeways must keep [you]0-edgeways . "[0-edgeways]

Then [she]244-her made a movement to rise . [Her]244-her tone had sounded very angry . Indeed , of late [her]244-her talks with [me]0-edgeways had invariably ended on a note of temper and irritation yes , of real temper .

" May [I]0-edgeways ask [you]244-her who is this [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways inquired ( since [I]0-edgeways did not wish [Polina]47-polina to depart without an explanation ) .

" [You]244-her _ know _ who [she]50-mlle is just [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle . Nothing further has transpired . Probably [she]50-mlle will soon be [Madame General]1812-madame general that is to say , if the rumours that [Grandmamma]66-grandmamma is nearing [her]66-grandmamma end should prove true . [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle , with [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother and [[her]50-mlle cousin]1814-her cousin , [the Marquis]1797-the marquis , know very well that , as things now stand , [we]1816-we are ruined . "[245-her]

" And is [the General]150-the general at last in love ? "[245-her]

" That has nothing to do with it . Listen to [me]245-her . Take these 700 florins , and go and play roulette with [them]1818-them . Win as much for [me]245-her as [you]1819-you can , for [I]245-her am badly in need of money . "[245-her]

So saying , [she]245-her called [Nadia]49-nadia back to [her]245-her side , and entered [the Casino]170-the casino , where [she]245-her joined [the rest of [our]248-our party]247-the rest of our party . For [myself]0-edgeways , [I]0-edgeways took , in musing astonishment , the first path to the left . Something had seemed to strike [my]0-edgeways brain when [she]245-her told [me]0-edgeways to go and play roulette . Strangely enough , that something had also seemed to make [me]0-edgeways hesitate , and to set [me]0-edgeways analysing [my]0-edgeways feelings with regard to [her]245-her . In fact , during the two weeks of [my]0-edgeways absence [I]0-edgeways had felt far more at [my]0-edgeways ease than [I]0-edgeways did now , on the day of [my]0-edgeways return ; although , while travelling , [I]0-edgeways had moped like [an imbecile]249-an imbecile , rushed about like [a man in a fever]250-a man in a fever , and actually beheld [her]245-her in [my]0-edgeways dreams . Indeed , on one occasion ( this happened in [Switzerland]5-switzerland , when [I]0-edgeways was asleep in [the train]251-the train ) [I]0-edgeways had spoken aloud to [her]245-her , and set all [[my]0-edgeways fellow - travellers]252-my fellow - travellers laughing . Again , therefore , [I]0-edgeways put to [myself]0-edgeways the question : " Do [I]0-edgeways , or do [I]0-edgeways not love [her]245-her ? "[0-edgeways] and again [I]0-edgeways could return [myself]0-edgeways no answer or , rather , for the hundredth time [I]0-edgeways told [myself]0-edgeways that [I]0-edgeways detested [her]245-her . Yes , [I]0-edgeways detested [her]245-her ; there were moments ( more especially at the close of [our]253-our talks together ) when [I]0-edgeways would gladly have given half [my]0-edgeways life to have strangled [her]245-her ! [I]0-edgeways swear that , had there , at such moments , been a sharp knife ready to [my]0-edgeways hand , [I]0-edgeways would have seized that knife with pleasure , and plunged it into [her]245-her breast . Yet [I]0-edgeways also swear that if , on the Shlangenberg , [she]245-her had _ really _ said to [me]0-edgeways , " Leap into [that abyss]1820-that abyss , "[245-her] [I]0-edgeways should have leapt into it , and with equal pleasure . Yes , this [I]0-edgeways knew well . One way or the other , the thing must soon be ended . [She]245-her , too , knew it in some curious way ; the thought that [I]0-edgeways was fully conscious of [her]245-her inaccessibility , and of the impossibility of [my]0-edgeways ever realising [my]0-edgeways dreams , afforded [her]245-her , [I]0-edgeways am certain , the keenest possible pleasure . Otherwise , is it likely that [she]245-her , [the cautious and clever woman that [she]245-her was]254-the cautious and clever woman that she was , would have indulged in this familiarity and openness with [me]0-edgeways ? Hitherto ( [I]0-edgeways concluded ) [she]245-her had looked upon [me]0-edgeways in the same light that [the old Empress]255-the old empress did upon [her]255-the old empress servant [the Empress who hesitated not to unrobe [herself]256-the empress who hesitated not to unrobe herself before her slave , since she did not account a slave a man before [[her]256-the empress who hesitated not to unrobe herself before her slave , since she did not account a slave a man slave]257-her slave , since [she]256-the empress who hesitated not to unrobe herself before her slave , since she did not account a slave a man did not account [a slave]258-a slave [a man]259-a man]256-the empress who hesitated not to unrobe herself before her slave , since she did not account a slave a man . Yes , often [Polina]47-polina must have taken [me]0-edgeways for something less than [a man]259-a man !

Still , [she]245-her had charged [me]0-edgeways with a commission to win what [I]0-edgeways could at roulette . Yet all the time [I]0-edgeways could not help wondering _ why _ it was so necessary for [her]245-her to win something , and what new schemes could have sprung to birth in [her]245-her ever - fertile brain . A host of new and unknown factors seemed to have arisen during the last two weeks . Well , it behoved [me]0-edgeways to divine them , and to probe them , and that as soon as possible . Yet not now : at the present moment [I]0-edgeways must repair to the roulette - table .

II

[I]0-edgeways confess [I]0-edgeways did not like it . Although [I]0-edgeways had made up [my]0-edgeways mind to play , [I]0-edgeways felt averse to doing so on behalf of [some one else]261-some one else . In fact , it almost upset [my]0-edgeways balance , and [I]0-edgeways entered [the gaming rooms]262-the gaming rooms with an angry feeling at [my]0-edgeways heart . At first glance the scene irritated [me]0-edgeways . Never at any time have [I]0-edgeways been able to bear the flunkeyishness which one meets in the Press of [the world]263-the world at large , but more especially in that of [Russia]2-russia , where , almost every evening , [journalists]264-journalists write on two subjects in particular namely , on the splendour and luxury of the casinos to be found in [the Rhenish towns]265-the rhenish towns , and on the heaps of gold which are daily to be seen lying on [their]264-journalists tables . [Those journalists]266-those journalists are not paid for doing so : [they]266-those journalists write thus merely out of a spirit of disinterested complaisance . For there is nothing splendid about [the establishments in question]267-the establishments in question ; and , not only are there no heaps of gold to be seen lying on [their]264-journalists tables , but also there is very little money to be seen at all . Of course , during the season , _ [some _ madman or another]268-some _ madman or another may make [his]268-some _ madman or another appearance generally [an Englishman]154-an englishman , or [an Asiatic]270-an asiatic , or [a Turk]271-a turk and ( as had happened during the summer of which [I]0-edgeways write ) win or lose a great deal ; but , as regards [the rest of the crowd]272-the rest of the crowd , it plays only for petty g lden , and seldom does much wealth figure on the board .

When , on the present occasion , [I]0-edgeways entered [the gaming - rooms]273-the gaming - rooms ( for the first time in [my]0-edgeways life ) , it was several moments before [I]0-edgeways could even make up [my]0-edgeways mind to play . For one thing , [the crowd]274-the crowd oppressed [me]0-edgeways . Had [I]0-edgeways been playing for [myself]0-edgeways , [I]0-edgeways think [I]0-edgeways should have left at once , and never have embarked upon gambling at all , for [I]0-edgeways could feel [my]0-edgeways heart beginning to beat , and [my]0-edgeways heart was anything but cold - blooded . Also , [I]0-edgeways knew , [I]0-edgeways had long ago made up [my]0-edgeways mind , that never should [I]0-edgeways depart from [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg until some radical , some final , change had taken place in [my]0-edgeways fortunes . Thus , it must and would be . However ridiculous it may seem to [you]275-you that [I]0-edgeways was expecting to win at roulette , [I]0-edgeways look upon the generally accepted opinion concerning the folly and the grossness of hoping to win at gambling as a thing even more absurd . For why is gambling a whit worse than any other method of acquiring money ? How , for instance , is it worse than trade ? True , out of [a hundred persons]276-a hundred persons , [only one]277-only one can win ; yet what business is that of [yours]275-you or of [mine]0-edgeways ?

At all events , [I]0-edgeways confined [myself]0-edgeways at first simply to looking on , and decided to attempt nothing serious . Indeed , [I]0-edgeways felt that , if [I]0-edgeways began to do anything at all , [I]0-edgeways should do it in an absent - minded , haphazard sort of way of that [I]0-edgeways felt certain . Also , it behoved [me]0-edgeways to learn the game itself ; since , despite a thousand descriptions of roulette which [I]0-edgeways had read with ceaseless avidity , [I]0-edgeways knew nothing of its rules , and had never even seen it played .

In the first place , everything about it seemed to [me]0-edgeways so foul so morally mean and foul . Yet [I]0-edgeways am not speaking of [the hungry , restless folk who , by scores nay , even by hundreds]278-the hungry , restless folk who , by scores nay , even by hundreds could be seen crowded around the gaming - tables . For in a desire to win quickly and to win much [I]0-edgeways can see nothing sordid ; [I]0-edgeways have always applauded the opinion of [a certain dead and gone]279-a certain dead and gone , but cocksure , moralist who replied to the excuse that " one may always gamble moderately "[279-a certain dead and gone] , by saying that to do so makes things worse , since , in that case , the profits too will always be moderate .

Insignificant profits and sumptuous profits do not stand on the same footing . No , it is all a matter of proportion . What may seem a small sum to [a Rothschild]280-a rothschild may seem a large sum to [me]0-edgeways , and it is not the fault of stakes or of winnings that everywhere [men]281-men can be found winning , can be found depriving [[their]281-men fellows]282-their fellows of something , just as [they]281-men do at roulette . As to the question whether stakes and winnings are , in themselves , immoral is another question altogether , and [I]0-edgeways wish to express no opinion upon it . Yet the very fact that [I]0-edgeways was full of a strong desire to win caused this gambling for gain , in spite of its attendant squalor , to contain , if [you]283-you will , something intimate , something sympathetic , to [my]0-edgeways eyes : for it is always pleasant to see [men]281-men dispensing with ceremony , and acting naturally , and in an unbuttoned mood ....

Yet why should [I]0-edgeways so deceive [myself]0-edgeways ? [I]0-edgeways could see that the whole thing was a vain and unreasoning pursuit ; and what , at the first glance , seemed to [me]0-edgeways the ugliest feature in [this mob of [roulette players]286-roulette players]285-this mob of roulette players was [their]286-roulette players respect for [their]286-roulette players occupation the seriousness , and even the humility , with which [they]286-roulette players stood around the gaming tables . Moreover , [I]0-edgeways had always drawn sharp distinctions between a game which is _ de mauvais genre _ and a game which is permissible to [a decent man]287-a decent man . In fact , there are two sorts of gaming namely , the game of [the gentleman]288-the gentleman and the game of [the plebs the game for gain]289-the plebs the game for gain , and the game of the herd . Herein , as said , [I]0-edgeways draw sharp distinctions . Yet how essentially base are the distinctions ! For instance , [a gentleman]290-a gentleman may stake , say , five or ten louis d or seldom more , unless [he]290-a gentleman is [a very rich man]291-a very rich man , when [he]290-a gentleman may stake , say , a thousand francs ; but , [he]290-a gentleman must do this simply for the love of the game itself simply for sport , simply in order to observe the process of winning or of losing , and , above all things , as [a man who remains quite uninterested in the possibility of [his]290-a gentleman issuing a winner]292-a man who remains quite uninterested in the possibility of his issuing a winner . If [he]290-a gentleman wins , [he]290-a gentleman will be at liberty , perhaps , to give vent to a laugh , or to pass a remark on the circumstance to [a bystander]293-a bystander , or to stake again , or to double [his]290-a gentleman stake ; but , even this [he]290-a gentleman must do solely out of curiosity , and for the pleasure of watching the play of chances and of calculations , and not because of any vulgar desire to win . In a word , [he]290-a gentleman must look upon the gaming - table , upon roulette , and upon trente et quarante , as mere relaxations which have been arranged solely for [his]290-a gentleman amusement . Of the existence of the lures and gains upon which [the bank]294-the bank is founded and maintained [he]290-a gentleman must profess to have not an inkling . Best of all , [he]290-a gentleman ought to imagine [[his]290-a gentleman fellow - gamblers]295-his fellow - gamblers and [the rest of the mob which stands trembling over a coin to be equally rich and gentlemanly with [himself]290-a gentleman]296-the rest of the mob which stands trembling over a coin to be equally rich and gentlemanly with himself , and playing solely for recreation and pleasure . This complete ignorance of the realities , this innocent view of [mankind]297-mankind , is what , in [my]0-edgeways opinion , constitutes the truly aristocratic . For instance , [I]0-edgeways have seen even [fond mothers]298-fond mothers so far indulge [[their]298-fond mothers guileless , elegant daughters]299-their guileless , elegant daughters misses of fifteen or sixteen as to give [them]299-their guileless , elegant daughters a few gold coins and teach [them]299-their guileless , elegant daughters how to play ; and though [the young ladies]300-the young ladies may have won or have lost , [they]300-the young ladies have invariably laughed , and departed as though [they]300-the young ladies were well pleased . In the same way , [I]0-edgeways saw [[our]301-our General]302-our general once approach the table in a stolid , important manner . A lacquey darted to offer [him]302-our general a chair , but [the General]150-the general did not even notice [him]302-our general . Slowly [he]150-the general took out [his]150-the general money bags , and slowly extracted 300 francs in gold , which [he]150-the general staked on the black , and won . Yet [he]150-the general did not take up [his]150-the general winnings [he]150-the general left them there on the table . Again the black turned up , and again [he]150-the general did not gather in what [he]150-the general had won ; and when , in the third round , the _ red _ turned up [he]150-the general lost , at a stroke , 1200 francs . Yet even then [he]150-the general rose with a smile , and thus preserved [his]150-the general reputation ; yet [I]0-edgeways knew that [his]150-the general money bags must be chafing [his]150-the general heart , as well as that , had the stake been twice or thrice as much again , [he]150-the general would still have restrained [himself]150-the general from venting [his]150-the general disappointment .

On the other hand , [I]0-edgeways saw [a Frenchman]304-a frenchman first win , and then lose , 30,000 francs cheerfully , and without a murmur . Yes ; even if [a gentleman]290-a gentleman should lose [his]290-a gentleman whole substance , [he]290-a gentleman must never give way to annoyance . Money must be so subservient to gentility as never to be worth a thought . Of course , [the _ supremely _ aristocratic thing]306-the _ supremely _ aristocratic thing is to be entirely oblivious of the mire of rabble , with its setting ; but sometimes a reverse course may be aristocratic to remark , to scan , and even to gape at , [the mob]307-the mob ( for preference , through a lorgnette ) , even as though one were taking [the crowd]274-the crowd and its squalor for a sort of raree show which had been organised specially for [a gentleman]290-a gentleman s diversion . Though one may be squeezed by [the crowd]274-the crowd , [one]1733-one must look as though [one]1733-one were fully assured of being [the observer of having neither part nor lot with the observed]313-the observer of having neither part nor lot with the observed . At the same time , to stare fixedly about [one]1733-one is unbecoming ; for that , again , is ungentlemanly , seeing that no spectacle is worth an open stare are no spectacles in [the world]263-the world which merit from [a gentleman too pronounced an inspection]316-a gentleman too pronounced an inspection .

However , to [me]0-edgeways personally the scene _ did _ seem to be worth undisguised contemplation more especially in view of the fact that [I]0-edgeways had come [there]317-there not only to look at , but also to number [myself]0-edgeways sincerely and wholeheartedly with , [the mob]307-the mob . As for [my]0-edgeways secret moral views , [I]0-edgeways had no room for them amongst [my]0-edgeways actual , practical opinions . Let that stand as written : [I]0-edgeways am writing only to relieve [my]0-edgeways conscience . Yet let [me]0-edgeways say also this : that from the first [I]0-edgeways have been consistent in having an intense aversion to any trial of [my]0-edgeways acts and thoughts by a moral standard . Another standard altogether has directed [my]0-edgeways life ....

As a matter of fact , [the mob]307-the mob was playing in exceedingly foul fashion . Indeed , [I]0-edgeways have an idea that sheer robbery was going on around that gaming - table . [The croupiers who sat at the two ends of it]320-the croupiers who sat at the two ends of it had not only to watch the stakes , but also to calculate the game an immense amount of work for [two men]321-two men ! As for [the crowd]274-the crowd itself well , it consisted mostly of [Frenchmen]67-frenchmen . Yet [I]0-edgeways was not then taking notes merely in order to be able to give [you]323-you a description of roulette , but in order to get [my]0-edgeways bearings as to [my]0-edgeways behaviour when [I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways should begin to play . For example , [I]0-edgeways noticed that nothing was more common than for another s hand to stretch out and grab one s winnings whenever [one]1733-one had won . Then there would arise a dispute , and frequently an uproar ; and it would be a case of " [I]0-edgeways beg of [you]323-you to prove , and to produce witnesses to the fact , that the stake is [yours]323-you . "[0-edgeways]

At first the proceedings were pure Greek to [me]0-edgeways . [I]0-edgeways could only divine and distinguish that stakes were hazarded on numbers , on " odd "[0-edgeways] or " even , "[0-edgeways] and on colours . [Polina]47-polina s money [I]0-edgeways decided to risk , that evening , only to the amount of 100 g lden . The thought that [I]0-edgeways was not going to play for [myself]0-edgeways quite unnerved [me]0-edgeways . It was an unpleasant sensation , and [I]0-edgeways tried hard to banish it . [I]0-edgeways had a feeling that , once [I]0-edgeways had begun to play for [Polina]47-polina , [I]0-edgeways should wreck [my]0-edgeways own fortunes . Also , [I]0-edgeways wonder if [any one]325-any one has _ ever _ approached a gaming - table without falling an immediate prey to superstition ? [I]0-edgeways began by pulling out fifty g lden , and staking them on " even . "[0-edgeways] The wheel spun and stopped at 13 . [I]0-edgeways had lost ! With a feeling like a sick qualm , as though [I]0-edgeways would like to make [my]0-edgeways way out of [the crowd]274-the crowd and go [home]173-home , [I]0-edgeways staked another fifty g lden this time on the red . The red turned up . Next time [I]0-edgeways staked the 100 g lden just where [they]328-they lay and again the red turned up . Again [I]0-edgeways staked the whole sum , and again the red turned up . Clutching [my]0-edgeways 400 g lden , [I]0-edgeways placed 200 of them on twelve figures , to see what would come of it . The result was that [the croupier]329-the croupier paid [me]0-edgeways out three times [my]0-edgeways total stake ! Thus from 100 g lden [[my]0-edgeways store]330-my store had grown to 800 ! Upon that such a curious , such an inexplicable , unwonted feeling overcame [me]0-edgeways that [I]0-edgeways decided to depart . Always the thought kept recurring to [me]0-edgeways that if [I]0-edgeways had been playing for [myself]0-edgeways alone [I]0-edgeways should never have had such luck . Once more [I]0-edgeways staked the whole 800 g lden on the " even . "[0-edgeways] The wheel stopped at 4 . [I]0-edgeways was paid out another 800 g lden , and , snatching up [my]0-edgeways pile of 1600 , departed in search of [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina .

[I]0-edgeways found [the whole party]331-the whole party walking in [the park]171-the park , and was able to get an interview with [her]47-polina only after supper . This time [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman was absent from the meal , and [the General]150-the general seemed to be in a more expansive vein . Among other things , [he]150-the general thought it necessary to remind [me]0-edgeways that [he]150-the general would be sorry to see [me]0-edgeways playing at the gaming - tables . In [his]150-the general opinion , such conduct would greatly compromise [him]150-the general especially if [I]0-edgeways were to lose much . " And even if [you]0-edgeways were to _ win _ much [I]150-the general should be compromised , "[150-the general] [he]150-the general added in a meaning sort of way . " Of course [I]150-the general have no _ right _ to order [your]0-edgeways actions , but [you]0-edgeways [yourself]0-edgeways will agree that ... "[150-the general] As usual , [he]150-the general did not finish [his]150-the general sentence . [I]0-edgeways answered drily that [I]0-edgeways had very little money in [my]0-edgeways possession , and that , consequently , [I]0-edgeways was hardly in a position to indulge in any conspicuous play , even if [I]0-edgeways did gamble . At last , when ascending to [[my]0-edgeways own room]335-my own room , [I]0-edgeways succeeded in handing [Polina]47-polina [her]47-polina winnings , and told [her]47-polina that , next time , [I]0-edgeways should not play for [her]47-polina .

" Why not ? "[47-polina] [she]47-polina asked excitedly .

" Because [I]0-edgeways wish to play _ for [myself]0-edgeways _ , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied with a feigned glance of astonishment . " That is [my]0-edgeways sole reason . "[0-edgeways]

" Then are [you]0-edgeways so certain that [your]0-edgeways roulette - playing will get [us]1821-us out of [our]1821-us difficulties ? "[47-polina] [she]47-polina inquired with a quizzical smile .

[I]0-edgeways said very seriously , " Yes , "[0-edgeways] and then added : " Possibly [my]0-edgeways certainty about winning may seem to [you]47-polina ridiculous ; yet , pray leave [me]0-edgeways in peace . "[0-edgeways]

Nonetheless [she]47-polina insisted that [I]0-edgeways ought to go halves with [her]47-polina in the day s winnings , and offered [me]0-edgeways 800 g lden on condition that henceforth , [I]0-edgeways gambled only on those terms ; but [I]0-edgeways refused to do so , once and for all stating , as [my]0-edgeways reason , that [I]0-edgeways found [myself]0-edgeways unable to play on behalf of [any one else]336-any one else , " [I]0-edgeways am not unwilling so to do , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways added , " but in all probability [I]0-edgeways should lose . "[0-edgeways]

" Well , absurd though it be , [I]47-polina place great hopes on [your]0-edgeways playing of roulette , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina remarked musingly ; " wherefore , [you]0-edgeways ought to play as [[my]47-polina partner]1822-my partner and on equal shares ; wherefore , of course , [you]0-edgeways will do as [I]47-polina wish . "[47-polina]

Then [she]47-polina left [me]0-edgeways without listening to any further protests on [my]0-edgeways part .

III

On the morrow [she]47-polina said not a word to [me]0-edgeways about gambling . In fact , [she]47-polina purposely avoided [me]0-edgeways , although [her]47-polina old manner to [me]0-edgeways had not changed : the same serene coolness was [hers]47-polina on meeting [me]0-edgeways a coolness that was mingled even with a spice of contempt and dislike . In short , [she]47-polina was at no pains to conceal [her]47-polina aversion to [me]0-edgeways . That [I]0-edgeways could see plainly . Also , [she]47-polina did not trouble to conceal from [me]0-edgeways the fact that [I]0-edgeways was necessary to [her]47-polina , and that [she]47-polina was keeping [me]0-edgeways for some end which [she]47-polina had in view . Consequently there became established between [us]337-us relations which , to a large extent , were incomprehensible to [me]0-edgeways , considering [her]47-polina general pride and aloofness . For example , although [she]47-polina knew that [I]0-edgeways was madly in love with [her]47-polina , [she]47-polina allowed [me]0-edgeways to speak to [her]47-polina of [my]0-edgeways passion ( though [she]47-polina could not well have showed [her]47-polina contempt for [me]0-edgeways more than by permitting [me]0-edgeways , unhindered and unrebuked , to mention to [her]47-polina [my]0-edgeways love ) .

" [You]0-edgeways see , "[47-polina] [her]47-polina attitude expressed , " how little [I]47-polina regard [your]0-edgeways feelings , as well as how little [I]47-polina care for what [you]0-edgeways say to [me]47-polina , or for what [you]0-edgeways feel for [me]47-polina . "[47-polina] Likewise , though [she]47-polina spoke as before concerning [her]47-polina affairs , it was never with complete frankness . In [her]47-polina contempt for [me]0-edgeways there were refinements . Although [she]47-polina knew well that [I]0-edgeways was aware of a certain circumstance in [her]47-polina life of something which might one day cause [her]47-polina trouble , [she]47-polina would speak to [me]0-edgeways about [her]47-polina affairs ( whenever [she]47-polina had need of [me]0-edgeways for a given end ) as though [I]0-edgeways were [a slave]258-a slave or [a passing acquaintance]339-a passing acquaintance yet tell [them]340-them [me]0-edgeways only in so far as [one]1733-one would need to know [them]340-them if [one]1733-one were going to be made temporary use of . Had [I]0-edgeways not known the whole chain of events , or had [she]47-polina not seen how much [I]0-edgeways was pained and disturbed by [her]47-polina teasing insistency , [she]47-polina would never have thought it worthwhile to soothe [me]0-edgeways with this frankness even though , since [she]47-polina not infrequently used [me]0-edgeways to execute commissions that were not only troublesome , but risky , [she]47-polina ought , in [my]0-edgeways opinion , to have been frank in _ any _ case . But , forsooth , it was not worth [her]47-polina while to trouble about _ [my]0-edgeways _ feelings about the fact that _ [I]0-edgeways _ was uneasy , and , perhaps , thrice as put about by [her]47-polina cares and misfortunes as [she]47-polina was [herself]47-polina !

For three weeks [I]0-edgeways had known of [her]47-polina intention to take to roulette . [She]47-polina had even warned [me]0-edgeways that [she]47-polina would like [me]0-edgeways to play on [her]47-polina behalf , since it was unbecoming for [her]47-polina to play in person ; and , from the tone of [her]47-polina words [I]0-edgeways had gathered that there was something on [her]47-polina mind besides a mere desire to win money . As if money could matter to _ [her]47-polina ! _ No , [she]47-polina had some end in view , and there were circumstances at which [I]0-edgeways could guess , but which [I]0-edgeways did not know for certain . True , the slavery and abasement in which [she]47-polina held [me]0-edgeways might have given [me]0-edgeways ( such things often do so ) the power to question [her]47-polina with abrupt directness ( seeing that , inasmuch as [I]0-edgeways figured in [her]47-polina eyes as [a mere slave and nonentity]343-a mere slave and nonentity , [she]47-polina could not very well have taken offence at any rude curiosity ) ; but the fact was that , though [she]47-polina let [me]0-edgeways question [her]47-polina , [she]47-polina never returned [me]0-edgeways a single answer , and at times did not so much as notice [me]0-edgeways . That is how matters stood .

Next day there was a good deal of talk about a telegram which , four days ago , had been sent to [St. Petersburg]14-st. petersburg , but to which there had come no answer . [The General]150-the general was visibly disturbed and moody , for the matter concerned [[his]150-the general mother]345-his mother . [The Frenchman]180-the frenchman , too , was excited , and after dinner [the whole party]331-the whole party talked long and seriously together [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman s tone being extraordinarily presumptuous and offhand to [everybody]349-everybody . It almost reminded one of the proverb , " Invite [a man]259-a man to [your]1824-your table , and soon [he]259-a man will place [his]259-a man feet upon it . "[150-the general] Even to [Polina]47-polina [he]150-the general was brusque almost to the point of rudeness . Yet still [he]150-the general seemed glad to join [us]350-our in [our]350-our walks in [the Casino]170-the casino , or in [our]350-our rides and drives about [the town]352-the town . [I]0-edgeways had long been aware of certain circumstances which bound [the General]150-the general to [him]150-the general ; [I]0-edgeways had long been aware that in [Russia]2-russia [they]354-they had hatched some scheme together although [I]0-edgeways did not know whether the plot had come to anything , or whether it was still only in the stage of being talked of . Likewise [I]0-edgeways was aware , in part , of a family secret namely , that , last year , [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman had bailed [the General]150-the general out of debt , and given [him]150-the general 30,000 roubles wherewith to pay [his]150-the general Treasury dues on retiring from the service . And now , of course , [the General]150-the general was in a vice although the chief part in the affair was being played by [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle . Yes , of this last [I]0-edgeways had no doubt .

But _ who _ was this [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle ? It was said of [her]50-mlle that [she]50-mlle was [a Frenchwoman of good birth]358-a frenchwoman of good birth who , living with [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother , possessed a colossal fortune . It was also said that [she]50-mlle was some relation to [the Marquis]1797-the marquis , but only [a distant one]361-a distant one [a cousin]362-a cousin , or [cousin - german]363-cousin - german , or [something of the sort]364-something of the sort . Likewise [I]0-edgeways knew that , up to the time of [my]0-edgeways journey to [Paris]9-paris , [she]50-mlle and [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman had been more ceremonious towards [[our]366-our party]177-our party [they]177-our party had stood on a much more precise and delicate footing with [them]177-our party ; but that now [their]177-our party acquaintanceship [their]177-our party friendship , [their]177-our party intimacy had taken on a much more off - hand and rough - and - ready air . Perhaps [they]177-our party thought that [our]366-our means were too modest for [them]177-our party , and , therefore , unworthy of politeness or reticence . Also , for the last three days [I]0-edgeways had noticed certain looks which [Astley]54-mr. astley had kept throwing at [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle and [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother ; and it had occurred to [me]0-edgeways that [he]54-mr. astley must have had some previous acquaintance with [the pair]1806-the pair . [I]0-edgeways had even surmised that [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman too must have met [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley before . [Astley]54-mr. astley was a man so shy , reserved , and taciturn in [his]54-mr. astley manner that [one]1733-one might have looked for anything from [him]54-mr. astley . At all events [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman accorded [him]54-mr. astley only the slightest of greetings , and scarcely even looked at [him]54-mr. astley . Certainly [he]180-the frenchman did not seem to be afraid of [him]54-mr. astley ; which was intelligible enough . But why did [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle also never look at [the Englishman]65-the englishman ? particularly since , _ propos _ of something or another , [the Marquis]1797-the marquis had declared [the Englishman]181-the englishman to be immensely and indubitably rich ? Was not that a sufficient reason to make [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle look at [the Englishman]65-the englishman ? Anyway [the General]150-the general seemed extremely uneasy ; and , one could well understand what a telegram to announce the death of [[his]150-the general mother]345-his mother would mean for [him]150-the general !

Although [I]0-edgeways thought it probable that [Polina]47-polina was avoiding [me]0-edgeways for a definite reason , [I]0-edgeways adopted a cold and indifferent air ; for [I]0-edgeways felt pretty certain that it would not be long before [she]47-polina [herself]47-polina approached [me]0-edgeways . For two days , therefore , [I]0-edgeways devoted [my]0-edgeways attention to [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle . [The poor General]377-the poor general was in despair ! To fall in love at fifty - five , and with such vehemence , is indeed a misfortune ! And add to that [[his]377-the poor general widowerhood]378-his widowerhood , [[his]377-the poor general children]379-his children , [his]377-the poor general ruined property , [his]377-the poor general debts , and [the woman with whom [he]377-the poor general had fallen in love]380-the woman with whom he had fallen in love ! Though [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle was extremely good - looking , [I]0-edgeways may or may not be understood when [I]0-edgeways say that [she]50-mlle had one of those faces which [one]1733-one is afraid of . At all events , [I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways have always feared [such women]382-such women . Apparently about twenty - five years of age , [she]50-mlle was tall and broad - shouldered , with shoulders that sloped ; yet though [her]50-mlle neck and bosom were ample in their proportions , [her]50-mlle skin was dull yellow in colour , while [her]50-mlle hair ( which was extremely abundant sufficient to make two coiffures ) was as black as Indian ink . Add to that a pair of black eyes with yellowish whites , a proud glance , gleaming teeth , and lips which were perennially pomaded and redolent of musk . As for [her]50-mlle dress , it was invariably rich , effective , and chic , yet in good taste . Lastly , [her]50-mlle feet and hands were astonishing , and [her]50-mlle voice a deep contralto . Sometimes , when [she]50-mlle laughed , [she]50-mlle displayed [her]50-mlle teeth , but at ordinary times [her]50-mlle air was taciturn and haughty especially in the presence of [Polina]47-polina and [Maria Philipovna]45-maria philipovna . Yet [she]50-mlle seemed to [me]0-edgeways almost destitute of education , and even of wits , though cunning and suspicious . This , apparently , was not because [her]50-mlle life had been lacking in incident . Perhaps , if all were known , [the Marquis]1797-the marquis was not [[her]50-mlle kinsman]384-her kinsman at all , nor [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother , [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother ; but there was evidence that , in [Berlin]15-berlin , where [we]387-we had first come across [the pair]1806-the pair , [they]1806-the pair had possessed [acquaintances of good standing]389-acquaintances of good standing . As for [the Marquis]1797-the marquis [himself]1797-the marquis , [I]0-edgeways doubt to this day if [he]1797-the marquis was [a Marquis]1808-a marquis although about the fact that [he]1797-the marquis had formerly belonged to [high society]392-high society ( for instance , in [Moscow]8-moscow and [Germany]16-germany ) there could be no doubt whatever . What [he]1797-the marquis had formerly been in [France]4-france [I]0-edgeways had not a notion . All [I]0-edgeways knew was that [he]1797-the marquis was said to possess a ch teau . During the last two weeks [I]0-edgeways had looked for much to transpire , but am still ignorant whether at that time anything decisive ever passed between [Mademoiselle]68-mademoiselle and [the General]150-the general . Everything seemed to depend upon [our]394-our means upon whether [the General]150-the general would be able to flourish sufficient money in [her]68-mademoiselle face . If ever the news should arrive that [the grandmother]396-the grandmother was not dead , [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle , [I]0-edgeways felt sure , would disappear in a twinkling . Indeed , it surprised and amused [me]0-edgeways to observe what a passion for intrigue [I]0-edgeways was developing . But how [I]0-edgeways loathed it all ! With what pleasure would [I]0-edgeways have given [everybody]349-everybody and everything the go - by ! Only [I]0-edgeways could not leave [Polina]47-polina . How , then , could [I]0-edgeways show contempt for [those who surrounded [her]47-polina]398-those who surrounded her ? Espionage is a base thing , but what have [I]0-edgeways to do with that ?

[Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , too , [I]0-edgeways found [a curious person]399-a curious person . [I]0-edgeways was only sure that [he]54-mr. astley had fallen in love with [Polina]47-polina . A remarkable and diverting circumstance is the amount which may lie in the mien of [a shy and painfully modest man who has been touched with the divine passion]400-a shy and painfully modest man who has been touched with the divine passion especially when [he]54-mr. astley would rather sink into [the earth]401-the earth than betray [himself]54-mr. astley by a single word or look . Though [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley frequently met [us]402-we when [we]402-we were out walking , [he]54-mr. astley would merely take off [his]54-mr. astley hat and pass [us]402-we by , though [I]0-edgeways knew [he]54-mr. astley was dying to join [us]402-we . Even when invited to do so , [he]54-mr. astley would refuse . Again , in places of amusement in [the Casino]170-the casino , at concerts , or near [the fountain]240-the fountain [he]54-mr. astley was never far from the spot where [we]402-we were sitting . In fact , _ wherever _ [we]402-we were in [the Park]171-the park , in [the forest]406-the forest , or on [the Shlangenberg]407-the shlangenberg [one]1733-one needed but to raise one s eyes and glance around to catch sight of at least a _ portion _ of [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley s frame sticking out whether on [an adjacent path]409-an adjacent path or behind a bush . Yet never did [he]54-mr. astley lose any chance of speaking to [myself]0-edgeways ; and , one morning when [we]402-we had met , and exchanged a couple of words , [he]54-mr. astley burst out in [his]54-mr. astley usual abrupt way , without saying " Good - morning . "[54-mr. astley]

" That [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle , "[54-mr. astley] [he]54-mr. astley said . " Well , [I]54-mr. astley have seen [a good many women]1825-a good many women like [her]50-mlle . "[54-mr. astley]

After that [he]54-mr. astley was silent as [he]54-mr. astley looked [me]0-edgeways meaningly in the face . What [he]54-mr. astley meant [I]0-edgeways did not know , but to [my]0-edgeways glance of inquiry [he]54-mr. astley returned only a dry nod , and a reiterated " It is so . "[54-mr. astley] Presently , however , [he]54-mr. astley resumed :

" Does [Mlle]50-mlle . [Polina]47-polina like flowers ? "[54-mr. astley]

" [I]0-edgeways really can not say , "[0-edgeways] was [my]0-edgeways reply .

" What ? [You]0-edgeways can not say ? "[54-mr. astley] [he]54-mr. astley cried in great astonishment .

" No ; [I]0-edgeways have never noticed whether [she]47-polina does so or not , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways repeated with a smile .

" Hm ! Then [I]54-mr. astley have an idea in [my]54-mr. astley mind , "[54-mr. astley] [he]54-mr. astley concluded . Lastly , with a nod , [he]54-mr. astley walked away with a pleased expression on [his]54-mr. astley face . The conversation had been carried on in execrable French .

IV

Today has been a day of folly , stupidity , and ineptness . The time is now eleven o clock in the evening , and [I]0-edgeways am sitting in [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room and thinking . It all began , this morning , with [my]0-edgeways being forced to go and play roulette for [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina . When [she]47-polina handed [me]0-edgeways over [[her]47-polina store]411-her store of six hundred g lden [I]0-edgeways exacted two conditions namely , that [I]0-edgeways should not go halves with [her]47-polina in [her]47-polina winnings , if any ( that is to say , [I]0-edgeways should not take anything for [myself]0-edgeways ) , and that [she]47-polina should explain to [me]0-edgeways , that same evening , why it was so necessary for [her]47-polina to win , and how much was the sum which [she]47-polina needed . For , [I]0-edgeways could not suppose that [she]47-polina was doing all this merely for the sake of money . Yet clearly [she]47-polina _ did _ need some money , and that as soon as possible , and for a special purpose . Well , [she]47-polina promised to explain matters , and [I]0-edgeways departed . There was [a tremendous crowd]412-a tremendous crowd in [the gaming - rooms]273-the gaming - rooms . What [an arrogant , greedy crowd]414-an arrogant , greedy crowd it was ! [I]0-edgeways pressed forward towards the middle of [the room]415-the room until [I]0-edgeways had secured a seat at a croupier s elbow . Then [I]0-edgeways began to play in timid fashion , venturing only twenty or thirty g lden at a time . Meanwhile , [I]0-edgeways observed and took notes . It seemed to [me]0-edgeways that calculation was superfluous , and by no means possessed of the importance which [certain other players]416-certain other players attached to it , even though [they]416-certain other players sat with ruled papers in [their]416-certain other players hands , whereon [they]416-certain other players set down the coups , calculated the chances , reckoned , staked , and lost exactly as [[we]417-we more simple mortals]418-we more simple mortals did [who played without any reckoning at all]419-who played without any reckoning at all .

However , [I]0-edgeways deduced from the scene one conclusion which seemed to [me]0-edgeways reliable namely , that in the flow of fortuitous chances there is , if not a system , at all events a sort of order . This , of course , is a very strange thing . For instance , after a dozen middle figures there would always occur [a dozen or so outer ones]420-a dozen or so outer ones . Suppose the ball stopped twice at a dozen outer figures ; it would then pass to [a dozen of the first ones]421-a dozen of the first ones , and then , again , to [a dozen of the middle ciphers]422-a dozen of the middle ciphers , and fall upon them three or four times , and then revert to a dozen outers ; whence , after another couple of rounds , the ball would again pass to [the first figures]423-the first figures , strike upon [them]423-the first figures once , and then return thrice to the middle series continuing thus for an hour and a half , or two hours . One , three , two : one , three , two . It was all very curious . Again , for the whole of a day or a morning the red would alternate with the black , but almost without any order , and from moment to moment , so that scarcely two consecutive rounds would end upon either the one or the other . Yet , next day , or , perhaps , the next evening , the red alone would turn up , and attain a run of over two score , and continue so for quite a length of time say , for a whole day . Of these circumstances the majority were pointed out to [me]0-edgeways by [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , who stood by the gaming - table the whole morning , yet never once staked in person .

For [myself]0-edgeways , [I]0-edgeways lost all that [I]0-edgeways had on [me]0-edgeways , and with great speed . To begin with , [I]0-edgeways staked two hundred g lden on " even , "[0-edgeways] and won . Then [I]0-edgeways staked the same amount again , and won : and so on some two or three times . At one moment [I]0-edgeways must have had in [my]0-edgeways hands gathered there within a space of five minutes about 4000 g lden . That , of course , was the proper moment for [me]0-edgeways to have departed , but there arose in [me]0-edgeways a strange sensation as of a challenge to [Fate]69-fate as of a wish to deal [her]424-her a blow on the cheek , and to put out [my]0-edgeways tongue at [her]424-her . Accordingly [I]0-edgeways set down the largest stake allowed by the rules namely , 4000 g lden and lost . Fired by this mishap , [I]0-edgeways pulled out all the money left to [me]0-edgeways , staked it all on the same venture , and again lost ! Then [I]0-edgeways rose from the table , feeling as though [I]0-edgeways were stupefied . What had happened to [me]0-edgeways [I]0-edgeways did not know ; but , before luncheon [I]0-edgeways told [Polina]47-polina of [my]0-edgeways losses until which time [I]0-edgeways walked about [the Park]171-the park .

At luncheon [I]0-edgeways was as excited as [I]0-edgeways had been at the meal three days ago . [Mlle . Blanche]50-mlle and [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman were lunching with [us]427-us , and it appeared that [the former]233-the former had been to [the Casino]170-the casino that morning , and had seen [my]0-edgeways exploits there . So now [she]47-polina showed [me]0-edgeways more attention when talking to [me]0-edgeways ; while , for [his]180-the frenchman part , [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman approached [me]0-edgeways , and asked outright if it had been [my]0-edgeways own money that [I]0-edgeways had lost . [He]180-the frenchman appeared to be suspicious as to something being on foot between [Polina]47-polina and [myself]0-edgeways , but [I]0-edgeways merely fired up , and replied that the money had been all [my]0-edgeways own .

At this [the General]150-the general seemed extremely surprised , and asked [me]0-edgeways whence [I]0-edgeways had procured it ; whereupon [I]0-edgeways replied that , though [I]0-edgeways had begun only with 100 g lden , six or seven rounds had increased [my]0-edgeways capital to 5000 or 6000 g lden , and that subsequently [I]0-edgeways had lost the whole in two rounds .

All this , of course , was plausible enough . During [my]0-edgeways recital [I]0-edgeways glanced at [Polina]47-polina , but nothing was to be discerned on [her]47-polina face . However , [she]47-polina had allowed [me]0-edgeways to fire up without correcting [me]0-edgeways , and from that [I]0-edgeways concluded that it was [my]0-edgeways _ cue _ to fire up , and to conceal the fact that [I]0-edgeways had been playing on [her]47-polina behalf . " At all events , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways thought to [myself]0-edgeways , " [she]47-polina , in [her]47-polina turn , has promised to give [me]0-edgeways an explanation to - night , and to reveal to [me]0-edgeways something or another . "[0-edgeways]

Although [the General]150-the general appeared to be taking stock of [me]0-edgeways , [he]150-the general said nothing . Yet [I]0-edgeways could see uneasiness and annoyance in [his]150-the general face . Perhaps [his]150-the general straitened circumstances made it hard for [him]150-the general to have to hear of piles of gold passing through the hands of [an irresponsible fool like [myself]0-edgeways within the space of a quarter of an hour]433-an irresponsible fool like myself within the space of a quarter of an hour . Now , [I]0-edgeways have an idea that , last night , [he]150-the general and [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman had a sharp encounter with [one another]435-one another . At all events [they]436-they closeted [themselves]436-they together , and then had a long and vehement discussion ; after which [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman departed in what appeared to be a passion , but returned , early this morning , to renew the combat . On hearing of [my]0-edgeways losses , however , [he]150-the general only remarked with a sharp , and even a malicious , air that " [a man]259-a man ought to go more carefully . "[150-the general] Next , for some reason or another , [he]150-the general added that , " though [a great many Russians]1827-a great many russians go in for gambling , [they]1827-a great many russians are no good at the game . "[150-the general]

" _ [I]0-edgeways _ think that roulette was devised specially for [Russians]58-russians , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways retorted ; and when [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman smiled contemptuously at [my]0-edgeways reply [I]0-edgeways further remarked that [I]0-edgeways was sure [I]0-edgeways was right ; also that , speaking of [Russians]58-russians in the capacity of [gamblers]439-gamblers , [I]0-edgeways had far more blame for [them]58-russians than praise of that [he]150-the general could be quite sure .

" Upon what do [you]0-edgeways base [your]0-edgeways opinion ? "[150-the general] [he]150-the general inquired .
