" Upon the fact that to the virtues and merits of [the civilised Westerner]1828-the civilised westerner there has become historically added though this is not [his]150-the general chief point a capacity for acquiring capital ; whereas , not only is [the Russian incapable of acquiring capital]1829-the russian incapable of acquiring capital , but also [he]150-the general exhausts it wantonly and of sheer folly . None the less [we]1830-we [Russians]58-russians often need money ; wherefore , [we]1830-we are glad of , and greatly devoted to , a method of acquisition like roulette whereby , in a couple of hours , one may grow rich without doing any work . This method , [I]439-gamblers repeat , has a great attraction for [us]1830-we , but since [we]1830-we play in wanton fashion , and without taking any trouble , [we]1830-we almost invariably lose . "[439-gamblers]

" To a certain extent that is true , "[180-the frenchman] assented [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman with a self - satisfied air .

" Oh no , it is not true , "[150-the general] put in [the General]150-the general sternly . "[150-the general]

" [I]0-edgeways beg pardon , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said . " Yet it would be difficult to say which is the worst of the two Russian ineptitude or the German method of growing rich through honest toil . "[0-edgeways]

" And what a _ Russian _ idea ! "[180-the frenchman] added [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman .

[I]0-edgeways smiled , for [I]0-edgeways was rather glad to have a quarrel with [them]444-them .

" [I]0-edgeways would rather live a wandering life in [tents]1832-tents , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways cried , " than bow the knee to [a German idol]1833-a german idol ! "[0-edgeways]

" To _ what _ idol ? "[150-the general] exclaimed [the General]150-the general , now seriously angry .

" To the German method of heaping up riches . [I]0-edgeways have not been [here]1772-here very long , but [I]0-edgeways can tell [you]150-the general that what [I]0-edgeways have seen and verified makes [my]0-edgeways Tartar blood boil . [Good Lord]1835-good lord ! [I]0-edgeways wish for no virtues of that kind . Yesterday [I]0-edgeways went for a walk of about ten versts ; and , everywhere [I]0-edgeways found that things were even as [we]1836-we read of them in good German picture - books that [every house]1837-every house has [its Vater]1838-its vater , who is horribly beneficent and extraordinarily honourable . So honourable is [he]1838-its vater that it is dreadful to have anything to do with [him]1838-its vater ; and [I]0-edgeways can not bear [people of that sort]1839-people of that sort . [Each such Vater]1840-each such vater has [[his]1838-its vater family]1732-his family , and in the evenings [they]1732-his family read improving books aloud . Over [their]1732-his family roof - trees there murmur elms and chestnuts ; the sun has sunk to [his]1838-its vater rest ; a stork is roosting on the gable ; and all is beautifully poetic and touching . Do not be angry , [General]1842-general . Let [me]0-edgeways tell [you]1842-general something that is even more touching than that . [I]0-edgeways can remember how , of an evening , [[my]0-edgeways own father]1843-my own father , now dead , used to sit under the lime trees in [[his]1843-my own father little garden]1844-his little garden , and to read books aloud to [myself]0-edgeways and [[my]0-edgeways mother]1845-my mother . Yes , [I]0-edgeways know how things ought to be done . Yet [every German family]1846-every german family is bound to slavery and to submission to [its Vater]1838-its vater . [They]1732-his family work like [oxen]1848-oxen , and amass wealth like [Jews]1849-jews . Suppose [the Vater]1850-the vater has put by a certain number of g lden which [he]1850-the vater hands over to [[his]1850-the vater eldest son]1851-his eldest son , in order that [the said son]1852-the said son may acquire a trade or [a small plot of land]1853-a small plot of land . Well , one result is to deprive [the daughter]1854-the daughter of a dowry , and so leave [her]1854-the daughter among [the unwedded]1855-the unwedded . For the same reason , [the parents]1856-the parents will have to sell [the younger son]1857-the younger son into bondage or the ranks of [the army]1858-the army , in order that [he]1857-the younger son may earn more towards the family capital . Yes , such things ARE done , for [I]0-edgeways have been making inquiries on the subject . It is all done out of sheer rectitude out of a rectitude which is magnified to the point of [the younger son]1857-the younger son believing that [he]1857-the younger son has been _ rightly _ sold , and that it is simply idyllic for [the victim]1860-the victim to rejoice when [he]1857-the younger son is made over into pledge . What more have [I]0-edgeways to tell ? Well , this that matters bear just as hardly upon [the eldest son]1861-the eldest son . Perhaps [he]1861-the eldest son has [his]1861-the eldest son Gretchen to whom [his]1861-the eldest son heart is bound ; but [he]1861-the eldest son can not marry [her]1854-the daughter , for the reason that [he]1861-the eldest son has not yet amassed sufficient g lden . So , [the pair]1806-the pair wait on in a mood of sincere and virtuous expectation , and smilingly deposit [themselves]1806-the pair in pawn the while . [Gretchen]70-gretchen s cheeks grow sunken , and [she]70-gretchen begins to wither ; until at last , after some twenty years , [their]1806-the pair substance has multiplied , and sufficient g lden have been honourably and virtuously accumulated . Then [the Vater]1850-the vater blesses [[his]1850-the vater forty - year - old heir]1864-his forty - year - old heir and [the thirty - five - year - old Gretchen]1865-the thirty - five - year - old gretchen with the sunken bosom and the scarlet nose ; after which [he]1850-the vater bursts , into tears , reads [the pair]1806-the pair a lesson on morality , and dies . In turn [the eldest son]1861-the eldest son becomes [a virtuous Vater]1868-a virtuous vater , and the old story begins again . In fifty or sixty years time [the grandson of the original Vater]1869-the grandson of the original vater will have amassed a considerable sum ; and that sum [he]1850-the vater will hand over to , [[his]1850-the vater son]1870-his son , and [the latter]196-the latter to _ [[his]1850-the vater _ son]1872-his _ son , and so on for several generations ; until at length there will issue [a Baron Rothschild]1873-a baron rothschild , or [a Hoppe and Company]1874-a hoppe and company , or the devil knows what ! Is it not a beautiful spectacle the spectacle of a century or two of inherited labour , patience , intellect , rectitude , character , perseverance , and calculation , with a stork sitting on the roof above it all ? What is more ; [they]1806-the pair think there can never be anything better than this ; wherefore , from _ [their]1806-the pair _ point of view [they]1806-the pair begin to judge [the rest of [the world]263-the world]1875-the rest of the world , and to censure [all who are at fault that is to say , who are not exactly like themselves]1877-all who are at fault that is to say , who are not exactly like themselves . Yes , there [you]1878-you have it in a nutshell . For [my]0-edgeways own part , [I]0-edgeways would rather grow fat after the Russian manner , or squander [my]0-edgeways whole substance at roulette . [I]0-edgeways have no wish to be [Hoppe]71-hoppe and [Company]1879-company at the end of five generations . [I]0-edgeways want the money for _ [myself]0-edgeways _ , for in no way do [I]0-edgeways look upon [my]0-edgeways personality as necessary to , or meet to be given over to , capital . "[150-the general]

Yes , [she]47-polina had been extraordinarily meditative . Yet , on leaving the table , [she]47-polina immediately ordered [me]0-edgeways to accompany [her]47-polina for a walk . " By the way , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways interrupted , " [you]0-edgeways say [you]0-edgeways want to pay off a debt . It must be a large one . Is it to [the Frenchman]61-the frenchman ? "[0-edgeways]

" [You]0-edgeways know that [you]0-edgeways and [I]0-edgeways stand on no ceremony , and that sometimes [I]0-edgeways put to [you]0-edgeways very plain questions . " [You]0-edgeways talk like [a child]1787-a child . It is always possible to comport [oneself]1787-a child with dignity . If [one]1733-one has a quarrel it ought to elevate rather than to degrade [one]1733-one . "[47-polina]

" A maxim straight from the copybook ! Suppose [I]0-edgeways _ can not _ comport [myself]0-edgeways with dignity . By that [I]0-edgeways mean that , though [I]0-edgeways am [a man of self - respect]1734-a man of self - respect , [I]0-edgeways am unable to carry off a situation properly . Do [you]0-edgeways know the reason ? It is because [we]1905-us [Russians]58-russians are too richly and multifariously gifted to be able at once to find the proper mode of expression . It is all a question of mode . [Most of [us]1905-us]1906-most of us are [so bounteously endowed with intellect as to require also a spice of genius to choose the right form of behaviour]1907-so bounteously endowed with intellect as to require also a spice of genius to choose the right form of behaviour . And genius is lacking in [us]1905-us for the reason that so little genius at all exists . It belongs only to [the French]60-the french though [a few other Europeans]1908-a few other europeans have elaborated [their]1908-a few other europeans forms so well as to be able to figure with extreme dignity , and yet be wholly undignified persons . That is why , with [us]1905-us , the mode is so all - important . [The Frenchman]180-the frenchman may receive an insult a real , a venomous insult : yet , [he]180-the frenchman will not so much as frown . But a tweaking of the nose [he]180-the frenchman can not bear , for the reason that such an act is an infringement of the accepted , of the time - hallowed order of decorum . That is why [[our]1905-us good ladies]1910-our good ladies are so fond of [Frenchmen]67-frenchmen [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman s manners , [they]1910-our good ladies say , are perfect ! But in [my]0-edgeways opinion there is no such thing as [a Frenchman]304-a frenchman s manners . [The Frenchman]61-the frenchman is only [a bird the _ coq gaulois]1913-a bird the _ coq gaulois _ . At the same time , as [I]0-edgeways am not [a woman]1914-a woman , [I]0-edgeways do not properly understand the question . [Cocks]75-cocks may be excellent birds . If [I]0-edgeways am wrong [you]1915-you must stop [me]0-edgeways . [You]1915-you ought to stop and correct [me]0-edgeways more often when [I]0-edgeways am speaking to [you]1915-you , for [I]0-edgeways am too apt to say everything that is in [my]0-edgeways head .[0-edgeways]

" [You]1915-you see , [I]47-polina have lost [my]47-polina manners . [I]47-polina agree that [I]47-polina have none , nor yet any dignity . [I]47-polina will tell [you]1915-you why . [I]47-polina set no store upon such things . Everything in [me]47-polina has undergone a cheek . [You]1915-you know the reason . [I]47-polina have not a single human thought in [my]47-polina head . [I]47-polina have been to [Dresden]76-dresden , yet am completely in the dark as to what [Dresden]76-dresden is like . [You]1915-you know the cause of [my]47-polina obsession . Something seemed to strike upon [my]0-edgeways brain as [I]0-edgeways heard these words . Of course , at the time [I]0-edgeways took them half in jest and half as a challenge ; yet , [she]458-i had spoken them with great seriousness . [I]0-edgeways felt thunderstruck that [she]458-i should so express [herself]458-i , that [she]458-i should assert such a right over [me]0-edgeways , that [she]458-i should assume such authority and say outright : " Either [you]0-edgeways kill whom [I]458-i bid [you]0-edgeways , or [I]458-i will have nothing more to do with [you]0-edgeways . For how could [she]458-i ever regard [me]0-edgeways as the same after the killing was done ? This was more than slavery and abasement ; it was sufficient to bring [a man]259-a man back to [his]259-a man right senses . [I]0-edgeways turned away , and went silently to do [her]466-i bidding . Of course the thing was folly , but [I]0-edgeways could not get out of it . [VI]79-vi

Two days have passed since that day of lunacy . What a noise and a fuss and a chattering and an uproar there was ! And what a welter of unseemliness and disorder and stupidity and bad manners ! And _ [I]0-edgeways _ the cause of it all ! Yet part of the scene was also ridiculous at all events to [myself]0-edgeways it was so . [I]0-edgeways am not quite sure what was the matter with [me]0-edgeways whether [I]0-edgeways was merely stupefied or whether [I]0-edgeways purposely broke loose and ran amok . At times [my]0-edgeways mind seems all confused ; while at other times [I]0-edgeways seem almost to be back in [my]0-edgeways childhood , at [the school]469-the school desk , and to have done the deed simply out of mischief .

It all came of [Polina]47-polina yes , of [Polina]47-polina . But for [her]47-polina , there might never have been a fracas . Or perhaps [I]0-edgeways did the deed in a fit of despair ( though it may be foolish of [me]0-edgeways to think so ) ? What there is so attractive about [her]47-polina [I]0-edgeways can not think . Yet there _ is _ something attractive about [her]47-polina something passing fair , it would seem . Others besides [myself]0-edgeways [she]47-polina has driven to distraction . [She]47-polina is tall and straight , and very slim . [Her]47-polina body looks as though it could be tied into a knot , or bent double , like a cord . The imprint of [her]47-polina foot is long and narrow . It is , a maddening imprint yes , simply a maddening one ! And [her]47-polina hair has a reddish tint about it , and [her]47-polina eyes are like cat s eyes though able also to glance with [proud , disdainful mien]470-proud , disdainful mien . On the evening of [my]0-edgeways first arrival , four months ago , [I]0-edgeways remember that [she]47-polina was sitting and holding an animated conversation with [De Griers]73-de griers in [the salon]471-the salon . And the way in which [she]47-polina looked at [him]73-de griers was such that later , when [I]0-edgeways retired to [[my]0-edgeways own room]335-my own room [upstairs]1757-upstairs , [I]0-edgeways kept fancying that [she]47-polina had smitten [him]73-de griers in the face that [she]47-polina had smitten [him]73-de griers right on the cheek , so peculiar had been [her]47-polina look as [she]47-polina stood confronting [him]73-de griers . Ever since that evening [I]0-edgeways have loved [her]47-polina .

But to [my]0-edgeways tale .

[I]0-edgeways stepped from the path into the carriage - way , and took [my]0-edgeways stand in the middle of [it]474-it . There [I]0-edgeways awaited [the Baron]1935-the baron and [the Baroness]1933-the baroness . When [they]477-they were but a few paces distant from [me]0-edgeways [I]0-edgeways took off [my]0-edgeways hat , and bowed .

[I]0-edgeways remember that [the Baroness]1933-the baroness was clad in a voluminous silk dress , pale grey in colour , and adorned with flounces and a crinoline and train . Also , [she]1933-the baroness was short and inordinately stout , while [her]1933-the baroness gross , flabby chin completely concealed [her]1933-the baroness neck . [Her]1933-the baroness face was purple , and the little eyes in it had an impudent , malicious expression . Yet [she]1933-the baroness walked as though [she]1933-the baroness were conferring a favour upon [everybody]349-everybody by so doing . As for [the Baron]1935-the baron , [he]1935-the baron was tall , wizened , bony - faced after the German fashion , spectacled , and , apparently , about forty - five years of age . Also , [he]1935-the baron had legs which seemed to begin almost at [his]1935-the baron chest or , rather , at [his]1935-the baron chin ! Yet , for all [his]1935-the baron air of peacock - like conceit , [his]1935-the baron clothes sagged a little , and [his]1935-the baron face wore a sheepish air which might have passed for profundity .

These details [I]0-edgeways noted within a space of a few seconds .

At first [my]0-edgeways bow and the fact that [I]0-edgeways had [my]0-edgeways hat in [my]0-edgeways hand barely caught [their]481-their attention . [The Baron]80-the baron only scowled a little , and [the Baroness]1933-the baroness swept straight on .

" [Madame la Baronne]81-madame la baronne , "[0-edgeways] said [I]0-edgeways , loudly and distinctly embroidering each word , as it were " j ai l honneur d tre votre esclave . "[0-edgeways]

Then [I]0-edgeways bowed again , put on [my]0-edgeways hat , and walked past [the Baron]1935-the baron with a rude smile on [my]0-edgeways face .

[Polina]47-polina had ordered [me]0-edgeways merely to take off [my]0-edgeways hat : the bow and the general effrontery were of [my]0-edgeways own invention . [God]82-god knows what instigated [me]0-edgeways to perpetrate the outrage ! In [my]0-edgeways frenzy [I]0-edgeways felt as though [I]0-edgeways were walking on air .

" Hein ! "[1935-the baron] ejaculated or , rather , growled [the Baron]1935-the baron as [he]1935-the baron turned towards [me]0-edgeways in angry surprise .

[I]0-edgeways too turned round , and stood waiting in pseudo - courteous expectation . Yet still [I]0-edgeways wore on [my]0-edgeways face an impudent smile as [I]0-edgeways gazed at [him]1935-the baron . [He]1935-the baron seemed to hesitate , and [his]1935-the baron brows contracted to their utmost limits . Every moment [his]1935-the baron visage was growing darker . [The Baroness]1933-the baroness also turned in [my]0-edgeways direction , and gazed at [me]0-edgeways in wrathful perplexity , while [some of [the passers - by]183-the passers - by]486-some of the passers - by also began to stare at [us]488-us , and [others of [them]486-some of the passers - by]489-others of them halted outright .

" Hein ! "[1935-the baron] [the Baron]1935-the baron vociferated again , with a redoubled growl and a note of growing wrath in [his]1935-the baron voice .

" Ja wohl ! "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied , still looking [him]1935-the baron in the eyes .

" [Sind Sie rasend]83-sind sie rasend ? "[1935-the baron] [he]1935-the baron exclaimed , brandishing [his]1935-the baron stick , and , apparently , beginning to feel nervous . Perhaps it was [my]0-edgeways costume which intimidated [him]1935-the baron , for [I]0-edgeways was well and fashionably dressed , after the manner of [a man who belongs to indisputably good society]491-a man who belongs to indisputably good society .

" [Ja]1941-ja wo - o - ohl ! "[0-edgeways] cried [I]0-edgeways again with all [my]0-edgeways might with a longdrawn rolling of the " ohl "[0-edgeways] sound after the fashion of [the Berliners]492-the berliners ( who constantly use the phrase " Ja wohl ! "[0-edgeways] in conversation , and more or less prolong the syllable " ohl "[0-edgeways] according as [they]492-the berliners desire to express different shades of meaning or of mood ) .

At this [the Baron]1935-the baron and [the Baroness]1933-the baroness faced sharply about , and almost fled in [their]492-the berliners alarm . [Some of [the bystanders]496-the bystanders]495-some of the bystanders gave vent to excited exclamations , and [others]497-others remained staring at [me]0-edgeways in astonishment . But [I]0-edgeways do not remember the details very well .

[Wheeling]498-wheeling quietly about , [I]0-edgeways returned in the direction of [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina . But , when [I]0-edgeways had got within a hundred paces of [her]47-polina seat , [I]0-edgeways saw [her]47-polina rise and set out with [the children]168-the children towards [the hotel]157-the hotel .

At the portico [I]0-edgeways caught up to [her]47-polina .

" [I]0-edgeways have perpetrated the the piece of idiocy , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said as [I]0-edgeways came level with [her]47-polina .

" Have [you]0-edgeways ? Then [you]0-edgeways can take the consequences , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina replied without so much as looking at [me]0-edgeways . Then [she]47-polina moved towards the staircase .

[I]0-edgeways spent the rest of the evening walking in [the park]171-the park . Thence [I]0-edgeways passed into [the forest]406-the forest , and walked on until [I]0-edgeways found [myself]0-edgeways in [a neighbouring principality]503-a neighbouring principality . At [a wayside restaurant]504-a wayside restaurant [I]0-edgeways partook of an omelette and some wine , and was charged for the idyllic repast a thaler and a half .

Not until eleven o clock did [I]0-edgeways return [home]173-home to find a summons awaiting [me]0-edgeways from [the General]150-the general .

[[Our]507-our party]177-our party occupied [two suites]509-two suites in [the hotel]157-the hotel ; [each of which]511-each of which contained [two rooms]512-two rooms . The first ( [the larger suite]513-the larger suite ) comprised [a salon]514-a salon and [a smoking - room]515-a smoking - room , with , adjoining the latter , [[the General]150-the general s study]517-the general s study . It was here that [he]150-the general was awaiting [me]0-edgeways as [he]150-the general stood posed in a majestic attitude beside [his]150-the general writing - table . Lolling on a divan close by was [De Griers]73-de griers .

" [[My]150-the general good sir]1942-my good sir , "[150-the general] [the General]150-the general began , " may [I]150-the general ask [you]1942-my good sir what this is that [you]1942-my good sir have gone and done ? "[150-the general]

" [I]0-edgeways should be glad , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied , " if [we]1943-we could come straight to the point . Probably [you]150-the general are referring to [my]0-edgeways encounter of today with [a German]1944-a german ? "[0-edgeways]

" With [a German]1944-a german ? Why , [the German]1946-the german was [the Baron Burmergelm]1947-the baron burmergelm [a most important personage]1948-a most important personage ! [I]150-the general hear that [you]1942-my good sir have been rude both to [him]1947-the baron burmergelm and to [the Baroness]1933-the baroness ? "[150-the general]

" No , [I]0-edgeways have not . "[0-edgeways]

" But [I]150-the general understand that [you]1942-my good sir simply terrified [them]1950-them , [[my]150-the general good sir]1942-my good sir ? "[150-the general] shouted [the General]150-the general .

" Not in the least , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied . " [You]150-the general must know that when [I]0-edgeways was in [Berlin]15-berlin [I]0-edgeways frequently used to hear [the Berliners]84-the berliners repeat , and repellently prolong , a certain phrase namely , Ja wohl ! ; and , happening to meet [this couple]1952-this couple in [the carriage - drive]1953-the carriage - drive , [I]0-edgeways found , for some reason or another , that this phrase suddenly recurred to [my]0-edgeways memory , and exercised a rousing effect upon [my]0-edgeways spirits . Moreover , on the three previous occasions that [I]0-edgeways have met [the Baroness]1933-the baroness [she]1933-the baroness has walked towards [me]0-edgeways as though [I]0-edgeways were a worm which could easily be crushed with the foot . Not unnaturally , [I]0-edgeways too possess a measure of self - respect ; wherefore , on _ this _ occasion [I]0-edgeways took off [my]0-edgeways hat , and said politely ( yes , [I]0-edgeways assure [you]1933-the baroness it was said politely ): Madame , j ai l honneur d tre votre esclave . Then [the Baron]1935-the baron turned round , and said Hein ! ; whereupon [I]0-edgeways felt moved to ejaculate in answer Ja wohl ! Twice [I]0-edgeways shouted it at [him]1935-the baron the first time in an ordinary tone , and the second time with the greatest prolonging of the words of which [I]0-edgeways was capable . That is all . "[0-edgeways]

[I]0-edgeways must confess that this puerile explanation gave [me]0-edgeways great pleasure . [I]0-edgeways felt a strong desire to overlay the incident with an even added measure of grossness ; so , the further [I]0-edgeways proceeded , the more did the gusto of [my]0-edgeways proceeding increase .

" [You]150-the general are only making fun of [me]150-the general ! "[150-the general] vociferated [the General]150-the general as , turning to [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman , [he]150-the general declared that [my]0-edgeways bringing about of the incident had been gratuitous . [De Griers]73-de griers smiled contemptuously , and shrugged [his]73-de griers shoulders .

" Do not think _ that _ , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways put in . " It was not so at all . [I]0-edgeways grant [you]150-the general that [my]0-edgeways behaviour was bad [I]0-edgeways fully confess that it was so , and make no secret of the fact . [I]0-edgeways would even go so far as to grant [you]150-the general that [my]0-edgeways behaviour might well be called stupid and indecent tomfoolery ; but , _ more _ than that it was not . Also , let [me]0-edgeways tell [you]150-the general that [I]0-edgeways am very sorry for [my]0-edgeways conduct . Yet there is one circumstance which , in [my]0-edgeways eyes , almost absolves [me]0-edgeways from regret in the matter . Of late that is to say , for the last two or three weeks [I]0-edgeways have been feeling not at all well . That is to say , [I]0-edgeways have been in a sick , nervous , irritable , fanciful condition , so that [I]0-edgeways have periodically lost control over [myself]0-edgeways . For instance , on more than one occasion [I]0-edgeways have tried to pick a quarrel even with [Monsieur le Marquise]85-monsieur le marquise [here]1772-here ; and , under the circumstances , [he]85-monsieur le marquise had no choice but to answer [me]0-edgeways . In short , [I]0-edgeways have recently been showing signs of ill - health . Whether [the Baroness Burmergelm]78-baroness burmergelm will take this circumstance into consideration when [I]0-edgeways come to beg [her]150-the general pardon ( for [I]0-edgeways _ do _ intend to make [her]150-the general amends ) [I]0-edgeways do not know ; but [I]0-edgeways doubt if [she]150-the general will , and the less so since , so far as [I]0-edgeways know , the circumstance is one which , of late , has begun to be abused in the legal world , in that [advocates in criminal cases]1957-advocates in criminal cases have taken to justifying [[their]1957-advocates in criminal cases clients]1958-their clients on the ground that , at the moment of the crime , [they]1958-their clients ( [the clients]1959-the clients ) were unconscious of what [they]1958-their clients were doing that , in short , [they]1958-their clients were out of health . [[My]0-edgeways client]1960-my client committed the murder that is true ; but [he]1960-my client has no recollection of having committed it . And [doctors]1961-doctors actually support [these advocates]1962-these advocates by affirming that there really is such a malady that there really _ can _ arise temporary delusions which make [a man]259-a man remember nothing of a given deed , or only a half or a quarter of it ! But [the Baron]1935-the baron and [Baroness]78-baroness burmergelm are members of [an older generation]1965-an older generation , as well as [Prussian Junkers]86-prussian junkers and [landowners]1966-landowners . To [them]1962-these advocates such a process in the medico - judicial world will be unknown , and therefore , [they]1962-these advocates are the more unlikely to accept any such explanation . What is _ [your]522-you _ opinion about it , [General]1842-general ? "[0-edgeways]

" Enough , [sir]1968-sir ! "[522-you] [he]522-you thundered with barely restrained fury . " Enough , [I]522-you say ! [I]0-edgeways took the money and the account ( which was indicted in pencil ) , and , bowing low to [the General]150-the general , said to [him]150-the general very gravely :

" The matter can not end here . "[524-i]

So struck was [he]524-i with [my]0-edgeways words that , spreading out [his]524-i hands , [he]524-i turned to [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman , and interpreted to [him]180-the frenchman that [I]0-edgeways had challenged [himself]524-i ( [the General]150-the general ) to a duel . " Nor do [I]0-edgeways intend to let [the Baron]1935-the baron off , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways continued calmly , but with not a little discomfiture at [De Griers]73-de griers merriment . "[0-edgeways]

Then there happened what [I]0-edgeways had foreseen . [The General]150-the general on hearing of this further intended outrage , showed the white feather .

" What ? "[150-the general] [he]150-the general cried . " Do [you]150-the general intend to go on with this damned nonsense ? Do [you]150-the general understand what [I]150-the general say ? "[150-the general] [He]529-i was almost breathless with anger , as well as in a terrible fright .

" [General]1842-general , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied with that calmness which [he]529-i never could abide , " [one]1733-one can not arrest [a man]259-a man for brawling until [he]259-a man has brawled . It is vain for [you]150-the general to disturb and alarm [yourself]150-the general . "[529-i]

" For God s sake , [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch , do put an end to this senseless scheme of [yours]150-the general ! "[529-i] [he]529-i muttered , but with a sudden change from a truculent tone to one of entreaty as [he]529-i caught [me]0-edgeways by the hand . " Do [you]0-edgeways know what is likely to come of it ? Merely further unpleasantness . [You]0-edgeways will agree with [me]529-i , [I]529-i am sure , that at present [I]529-i ought to move with especial care yes , with very especial care . "[529-i] With that [he]529-i wound up in a despairing voice : " O [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch , [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch ! "[529-i]

[I]0-edgeways moved towards the door begging [him]529-i to be calm , and promising that everything should be done decently and in order ; whereafter [I]0-edgeways departed .

[Russians]530-russians , when abroad , are over - apt to play the poltroon , to watch all [their]530-russians words , and to wonder what [people]531-people are thinking of [their]530-russians conduct , or whether such and such a thing is _ comme il faut _ . In short , [they]530-russians are over - apt to cosset [themselves]530-russians , and to lay claim to great importance . Always [they]530-russians prefer the form of behaviour which has once and for all become accepted and established . This [they]530-russians will follow slavishly whether in [hotels]532-hotels , on [promenades]533-promenades , at meetings , or when on a journey . But [the General]150-the general had avowed to [me]0-edgeways that , over and above such considerations as these , there were circumstances which compelled [him]150-the general to " move with especial care at present "[150-the general] , and that the fact had actually made [him]150-the general poor - spirited and [a coward]1925-a coward it had made [him]150-the general altogether change [his]150-the general tone towards [me]0-edgeways . This fact [I]0-edgeways took into [my]0-edgeways calculations , and duly noted it , for , of course , [he]150-the general _ might _ apply to [the authorities]536-the authorities tomorrow , and it behoved [me]0-edgeways to go carefully .

Yet it was not [the General]150-the general but [Polina]47-polina that [I]0-edgeways wanted to anger . [She]47-polina had treated [me]0-edgeways with such cruelty , and had got [me]0-edgeways into such a hole , that [I]0-edgeways felt a longing to force [her]47-polina to beseech [me]0-edgeways to stop . Of course , [my]0-edgeways tomfoolery might compromise [her]47-polina ; yet certain other feelings and desires had begun to form themselves in [my]0-edgeways brain . If [I]0-edgeways was never to rank in [her]47-polina eyes as anything but a nonentity , it would not greatly matter if [I]0-edgeways figured as [a draggle - tailed cockerel]538-a draggle - tailed cockerel , and [the Baron]1935-the baron were to give [me]0-edgeways a good thrashing ; but , the fact was that [I]0-edgeways desired to have the laugh of [them]540-them all , and to come out [myself]0-edgeways unscathed . Let [people]531-people see what [they]531-people _ would _ see . Let [Polina]47-polina , for once , have a good fright , and be forced to whistle [me]0-edgeways to heel again . But , however much [she]47-polina might whistle , [she]47-polina should see that [I]0-edgeways was at least [no draggle - tailed cockerel]542-no draggle - tailed cockerel !

[I]0-edgeways have just received a surprising piece of news . [I]0-edgeways have just met [[our]543-our chambermaid]544-our chambermaid on the stairs , and been informed by [her]544-our chambermaid that [Maria Philipovna]45-maria philipovna departed today , by [the night train]545-the night train , to stay with [a cousin at [Carlsbad]20-carlsbad]546-a cousin at carlsbad . What can that mean ? [The maid]547-the maid declares that [Madame]81-madame la baronne packed [her]81-madame la baronne trunks early in the day . Yet how is it that [no one else]548-no one else seems to have been aware of the circumstance ? Or is it that _ [I]0-edgeways _ have been [the only person to be unaware of it]549-the only person to be unaware of it ? Also , [the maid]547-the maid has just told [me]0-edgeways that , three days ago , [Maria Philipovna]45-maria philipovna had some high words with [the General]150-the general . [I]0-edgeways understand , then ! Probably the words were concerning [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle . Certainly something decisive is approaching .

[VII]88-vii

In the morning [I]0-edgeways sent for [the ma tre d h tel]552-the ma tre d h tel , and explained to [him]552-the ma tre d h tel that , in future , [my]0-edgeways bill was to be rendered to [me]0-edgeways personally . As a matter of fact , [my]0-edgeways expenses had never been so large as to alarm [me]0-edgeways , nor to lead [me]0-edgeways to quit [the hotel]157-the hotel ; while , moreover , [I]0-edgeways still had 160 g lden left to [me]0-edgeways , and in them yes , in them , perhaps , riches awaited [me]0-edgeways . It was a curious fact , that , though [I]0-edgeways had not yet won anything at play , [I]0-edgeways nevertheless acted , thought , and felt as though [I]0-edgeways were sure , before long , to become wealthy since [I]0-edgeways could not imagine [myself]0-edgeways otherwise .

Next , [I]0-edgeways bethought [me]0-edgeways , despite the earliness of the hour , of going to see [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , who was staying at [the H tel de l Angleterre]554-the h tel de l angleterre ( [a hostelry at no great distance from [our]556-our own )]555-a hostelry at no great distance from our own ) . But suddenly [De Griers]73-de griers entered [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room . This had never before happened , for of late [that gentleman]558-that gentleman and [I]0-edgeways had stood on the most strained and distant of terms [he]73-de griers attempting no concealment of [his]73-de griers contempt for [me]0-edgeways ( [he]73-de griers even made an express point of showing it ) , and [I]0-edgeways having no reason to desire [his]73-de griers company . In short , [I]0-edgeways detested [him]73-de griers . Consequently , [his]73-de griers entry at the present moment the more astounded [me]0-edgeways . At once [I]0-edgeways divined that something out of the way was on the carpet .

[He]73-de griers entered with marked affability , and began by complimenting [me]0-edgeways on [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room . Then , perceiving that [I]0-edgeways had [my]0-edgeways hat in [my]0-edgeways hands , [he]73-de griers inquired whither [I]0-edgeways was going so early ; and , no sooner did [he]73-de griers hear that [I]0-edgeways was bound for [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley s than [he]73-de griers stopped , looked grave , and seemed plunged in thought .

[He]73-de griers was [a true Frenchman]560-a true frenchman insofar as that , though [he]73-de griers could be lively and engaging when it suited [him]73-de griers , [he]73-de griers became insufferably dull and wearisome as soon as ever the need for being lively and engaging had passed . Seldom is [a Frenchman]304-a frenchman _ naturally _ civil : [he]73-de griers is civil only as though to order and of set purpose . Also , if [he]73-de griers thinks it incumbent upon [him]73-de griers to be fanciful , original , and out of the way , [his]73-de griers fancy always assumes a foolish , unnatural vein , for the reason that it is compounded of trite , hackneyed forms . In short , [the natural Frenchman]562-the natural frenchman is a conglomeration of commonplace , petty , everyday positiveness , so that [he]562-the natural frenchman is [the most tedious person in [the world]263-the world]563-the most tedious person in the world . Indeed , [I]0-edgeways believe that [none but greenhorns and excessively Russian people]565-none but greenhorns and excessively russian people feel an attraction towards [the French]60-the french ; for , to [any man of sensibility , such a compendium of outworn]566-any man of sensibility , such a compendium of outworn forms a compendium which is built up of drawing - room manners , expansiveness , and gaiety becomes at once over - noticeable and unbearable .

" [I]73-de griers have come to see [you]73-de griers on business , "[73-de griers] [De Griers]73-de griers began in a very off - hand , yet polite , tone ; " nor will [I]73-de griers seek to conceal from [you]73-de griers the fact that [I]73-de griers have come in the capacity of [an emissary]2015-an emissary , of [an intermediary]2016-an intermediary , from [the General]150-the general . Having small knowledge of the Russian tongue , [I]73-de griers lost most of what was said last night ; but , [the General]150-the general has now explained matters , and [I]73-de griers must confess that "[73-de griers]

" See here , [Monsieur de Griers]89-monsieur de griers , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways interrupted . " [I]0-edgeways understand that [you]73-de griers have undertaken to act in this affair as [an intermediary]2016-an intermediary . Of course [I]0-edgeways am only [un utchitel]2020-un utchitel , [a tutor]2021-a tutor , and have never claimed to be [an intimate of [this household]2023-this household]2022-an intimate of this household , nor to stand on at all familiar terms with it . Consequently , [I]0-edgeways do not know the whole of its circumstances . Yet pray explain to [me]0-edgeways this : have [you]73-de griers [yourself]73-de griers become [one of [its]2023-this household members]2024-one of its members , seeing that [you]73-de griers are beginning to take such a part in everything , and are now present as [an intermediary]2016-an intermediary ? "[0-edgeways]

[The Frenchman]61-the frenchman seemed not over - pleased at [my]0-edgeways question . It was one which was too outspoken for [his]61-the frenchman taste and [he]61-the frenchman had no mind to be frank with [me]0-edgeways .

" [I]61-the frenchman am connected with [the General]150-the general , "[61-the frenchman] [he]61-the frenchman said drily , " partly through business affairs , and partly through special circumstances . [[My]61-the frenchman principal]2027-my principal has sent [me]61-the frenchman merely to ask [you]73-de griers to forego [your]73-de griers intentions of last evening . What [you]73-de griers contemplate is , [I]61-the frenchman have no doubt , very clever ; yet [he]150-the general has charged [me]61-the frenchman to represent to [you]73-de griers that [you]73-de griers have not the slightest chance of succeeding in [your]73-de griers end , since not only will [the Baron]1935-the baron refuse to receive [you]73-de griers , but also [he]1935-the baron ( [the Baron]1935-the baron ) has at [his]1935-the baron disposal every possible means for obviating further unpleasantness from [you]73-de griers . Surely [you]73-de griers can see that [yourself]73-de griers ? What , then , would be the good of going on with it all ? On the other hand , [the General]150-the general promises that at the first favourable opportunity [he]150-the general will receive [you]73-de griers back into [[his]150-the general household]2031-his household , and , in the meantime , will credit [you]73-de griers with [your]73-de griers salary with vos appointements . Surely that will suit [you]73-de griers , will it not ? "[61-the frenchman]

Very quietly [I]0-edgeways replied that [he]567-he ( [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman ) was labouring under a delusion ; that perhaps , after all , [I]0-edgeways should not be expelled from [the Baron]1935-the baron s presence , but , on the contrary , be listened to ; finally , that [I]0-edgeways should be glad if [Monsieur de Griers]89-monsieur de griers would confess that [he]89-monsieur de griers was now visiting [me]0-edgeways merely in order to see how far [I]0-edgeways intended to go in the affair .

" Good heavens ! "[73-de griers] cried [de Griers]73-de griers . " Seeing that [the General]150-the general takes such an interest in the matter , is there anything very unnatural in [his]150-the general desiring also to know [your]0-edgeways plans ? "[73-de griers]

Again [I]0-edgeways began [my]0-edgeways explanations , but [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman only fidgeted and rolled [his]180-the frenchman head about as [he]180-the frenchman listened with an expression of manifest and unconcealed irony on [his]180-the frenchman face . In short , [he]180-the frenchman adopted a supercilious attitude . For [my]0-edgeways own part , [I]0-edgeways endeavoured to pretend that [I]0-edgeways took the affair very seriously . [I]0-edgeways declared that , since [the Baron]1935-the baron had gone and complained of [me]0-edgeways to [the General]150-the general , as though [I]0-edgeways were [a mere servant of [the General s]574-the general s]573-a mere servant of the general s , [he]150-the general had , in the first place , lost [me]0-edgeways [my]0-edgeways post , and , in the second place , treated [me]0-edgeways like [a person to whom , as to one not qualified to answer for [himself]576-himself]575-a person to whom , as to one not qualified to answer for himself , it was not even worth while to speak . Naturally , [I]0-edgeways said , [I]0-edgeways felt insulted at this . Yet , comprehending as [I]0-edgeways did , differences of years , of social status , and so forth ( here [I]0-edgeways could scarcely help smiling ) , [I]0-edgeways was not anxious to bring about further scenes by going personally to demand or to request satisfaction of [the Baron]1935-the baron . And so forth , and so forth . " In short , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways declared in conclusion , " [my]0-edgeways one desire is that [the Baron]1935-the baron may make it possible for [me]0-edgeways to adopt the latter course . [POLINA]47-polina .

[VIII]94-viii

[Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley sat without moving as [he]54-mr. astley listened to [me]0-edgeways . " No , [I]0-edgeways fear not , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied .

" What do [you]54-mr. astley make of it ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways asked . " When [I]0-edgeways met [you]54-mr. astley [I]0-edgeways was just coming to ask [you]54-mr. astley [your]54-mr. astley opinion . " [I]54-mr. astley feel the same about it , "[54-mr. astley] said [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley . " As for [Mlle]50-mlle . [IX

For]101-ix for on [the topmost tier of [the hotel verandah]628-the hotel verandah]627-the topmost tier of the hotel verandah , after being carried up the steps in an armchair amid a bevy of [footmen]629-footmen , [maid - servants]630-maid - servants , and [other menials of [the hotel]157-the hotel]631-other menials of the hotel , headed by [the landlord]1981-the landlord ( [that functionary]634-that functionary had actually run out to meet [a visitor who arrived with so much stir and din]635-a visitor who arrived with so much stir and din , attended by [[her]635-a visitor who arrived with so much stir and din own retinue]636-her own retinue , and accompanied by [so great a pile of trunks and portmanteaux]637-so great a pile of trunks and portmanteaux ) on the topmost tier of [the verandah]2202-the verandah , [I]0-edgeways say , there was sitting _ [the grandmother]396-the grandmother ! _ Yes , it was _ [she]396-the grandmother _ rich , and imposing , and seventy - five years of age [Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha]102-antonida vassilievna , [landowner]640-landowner and [_ grande dame _ of [Moscow]8-moscow the " [La Baboulenka]63-la baboulenka "[396-the grandmother] who had caused so many telegrams to be sent off and received who had been dying , yet not dying who had , in [[her]635-a visitor who arrived with so much stir and din own person]642-her own person , descended upon [us]643-us even as snow might fall from the clouds]641-_ grande dame _ of moscow the " la baboulenka " who had caused so many telegrams to be sent off and received who had been dying , yet not dying who had , in her own person , descended upon us even as snow might fall from the clouds ! Though unable to walk , [she]635-a visitor who arrived with so much stir and din had arrived borne aloft in an armchair ( [her]635-a visitor who arrived with so much stir and din mode of conveyance for the last five years ) , as brisk , aggressive , self - satisfied , bolt - upright , loudly imperious , and generally abusive as ever . " [She]1794-the old lady interests [me]54-mr. astley tremendously , "[54-mr. astley] whispered [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley as , still smoking , [he]54-mr. astley walked by [my]0-edgeways side . [[Our]675-our party]177-our party was lodging on [the third floor]678-the third floor . Good heavens ! Never shall [I]0-edgeways forget the spectacle which ensued ! Just before [our]695-our entry , [the General]150-the general had been holding forth to [the company]201-the company , with [De Griers]73-de griers in support of [him]150-the general . [I]0-edgeways may also mention that , for the last two or three days , [Mlle]50-mlle . Truly [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s arrival seemed to be a catastrophe for [everybody]349-everybody ! X

At spas and , probably , all over [Europe]26-europe [hotel landlords]763-hotel landlords and [managers]764-managers are guided in [their]763-hotel landlords allotment of [rooms]765-rooms to [visitors]766-visitors , not so much by the wishes and requirements of [those visitors]767-those visitors , as by [their]763-hotel landlords personal estimate of the same . It may also be said that [these landlords]768-these landlords and [managers]764-managers seldom make a mistake . To [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother , however , [[our]771-our landlord]772-our landlord , for some reason or another , allotted such [a sumptuous suite]773-a sumptuous suite that [he]772-our landlord fairly overreached [himself]772-our landlord ; for [he]772-our landlord assigned [her]396-the grandmother [a suite consisting of [four magnificently appointed rooms]775-four magnificently appointed rooms , with [bathroom]776-bathroom , [servants quarters]777-servants quarters]774-a suite consisting of four magnificently appointed rooms , with bathroom , servants quarters , [a separate room for [[her]396-the grandmother maid]779-her maid]778-a separate room for her maid , and so on . In fact , during the previous week [the suite]780-the suite had been occupied by [no less a personage]781-no less a personage than [a Grand Duchess]782-a grand duchess : which circumstance was duly explained to [the new occupant]783-the new occupant , as an excuse for raising the price of [these apartments]784-these apartments . [The Grandmother]396-the grandmother had [herself]396-the grandmother carried or , rather , wheeled through [each room]786-each room in turn , in order that [she]396-the grandmother might subject [the whole]787-the whole to a close and attentive scrutiny ; while [the landlord]1981-the landlord [an elderly , bald - headed man]789-an elderly , bald - headed man walked respectfully by [her]396-the grandmother side .

What [every one]212-every one took [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother to be [I]0-edgeways do not know , but it appeared , at least , that [she]396-the grandmother was accounted [a person not only of great importance , but also , and still more , of great wealth]792-a person not only of great importance , but also , and still more , of great wealth ; and without delay [they]793-they entered [her]396-the grandmother in [the hotel register]794-the hotel register as " [Madame la g n rale]81-madame la baronne , [Princesse de Tarassevitcheva]112-princesse de tarassevitcheva , "[793-they] although [she]396-the grandmother had never been [a princess]795-a princess in [her]396-the grandmother life . [Her]396-the grandmother retinue , [[her]396-the grandmother reserved compartment in [the train]251-the train]796-her reserved compartment in the train , [her]396-the grandmother pile of unnecessary trunks , portmanteaux , and strong - boxes , all helped to increase [her]396-the grandmother prestige ; while [her]396-the grandmother wheeled chair , [her]396-the grandmother sharp tone and voice , [her]396-the grandmother eccentric questions ( put with an air of the most overbearing and unbridled imperiousness ) , [her]396-the grandmother whole figure upright , rugged , and commanding as it was completed the general awe in which [she]396-the grandmother was held . As [she]396-the grandmother inspected [[her]396-the grandmother new abode]798-her new abode [she]396-the grandmother ordered [her]396-the grandmother chair to be stopped at intervals in order that , with finger extended towards some article of furniture , [she]396-the grandmother might ply [the respectfully smiling , yet secretly apprehensive , landlord]799-the respectfully smiling , yet secretly apprehensive , landlord with unexpected questions . [She]396-the grandmother addressed them to [him]799-the respectfully smiling , yet secretly apprehensive , landlord in French , although [her]396-the grandmother pronunciation of the language was so bad that sometimes [I]0-edgeways had to translate them . For the most part , [the landlord]1981-the landlord s answers were unsatisfactory , and failed to please [her]396-the grandmother ; nor were the questions themselves of a practical nature , but related , generally , to God knows what .

For instance , on one occasion [she]396-the grandmother halted before a picture which , a poor copy of a well - known original , had a mythological subject .

" Of whom is this a portrait ? "[396-the grandmother] [she]396-the grandmother inquired .

[The landlord]1981-the landlord explained that it was probably that of [a countess]663-a countess .

" But how know [you]1981-the landlord that ? "[1794-the old lady] [the old lady]1794-the old lady retorted .

" [You]1981-the landlord live [here]1772-here , yet [you]1981-the landlord can not say for certain ! And why is the picture there at all ? And why do its eyes look so crooked ? "[1794-the old lady]

To all these questions [the landlord]1981-the landlord could return no satisfactory reply , despite [his]1981-the landlord floundering endeavours .

" The blockhead ! "[805-the grandmother in] exclaimed [the Grandmother in]805-the grandmother in [Russian]56-a russian .

Then [she]396-the grandmother proceeded on [her]396-the grandmother way only to repeat the same story in front of a Saxon statuette which [she]396-the grandmother had sighted from afar , and had commanded , for some reason or another , to be brought to [her]396-the grandmother . [De Griers]73-de griers strongly insisted that _ every one _ ought to accompany [her]835-her . Indeed , [he]73-de griers launched out into a perfect shower of charming phrases concerning the pleasure of acting as [[her]835-her cicerone]836-her cicerone , and so forth . [Every one]212-every one was touched with [his]73-de griers words .

" Mais elle est tomb e en enfance , "[73-de griers] [he]73-de griers added aside to [the General]150-the general . " Seule , elle fera des b tises . "[73-de griers] More than this [I]0-edgeways could not overhear , but [he]73-de griers seemed to have got some plan in [his]73-de griers mind , or even to be feeling a slight return of [his]73-de griers hopes .

The distance to [the Casino]170-the casino was about half a verst , and [our]840-our route led [us]840-our through [the Chestnut Avenue]29-the chestnut avenue until [we]840-our reached [the square directly fronting [the building]842-the building]841-the square directly fronting the building . [The General]150-the general , [I]0-edgeways could see , was a trifle reassured by the fact that , though [our]840-our progress was distinctly eccentric in its nature , it was , at least , correct and orderly . As a matter of fact , the spectacle of [a person who is unable to walk]844-a person who is unable to walk is not anything to excite surprise at [a spa]845-a spa . Yet it was clear that [the General]150-the general had a great fear of [the Casino itself]847-the casino itself : for why should [a person who had lost the use of [her]848-a person who had lost the use of her limbs more especially an old woman limbs more especially [an old woman]2270-an old woman]848-a person who had lost the use of her limbs more especially an old woman be going to [rooms which were set apart only for roulette]850-rooms which were set apart only for roulette ? On either side of the wheeled chair walked [Polina]47-polina and [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]851-blanche the latter smiling , modestly jesting , and , in short , making [herself]851-blanche so agreeable to [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother that in the end [the old lady]1794-the old lady relented towards [her]851-blanche . On the other side of the chair [Polina]47-polina had to answer an endless flow of petty questions such as " Who was it passed just now ? "[47-polina] " Who is that coming along ? "[1794-the old lady] " Is [the town]352-the town a large one ? "[1794-the old lady] " Are [the public gardens]2368-the public gardens extensive ? "[1794-the old lady] " What sort of trees are those ? "[47-polina] " What is the name of [those hills]2369-those hills ? "[1794-the old lady] " Do [I]1794-the old lady see eagles flying yonder ? "[1794-the old lady] " What is [that absurd - looking building]2370-that absurd - looking building ? "[1794-the old lady] and so forth . Meanwhile [Astley]54-mr. astley whispered to [me]0-edgeways , as [he]54-mr. astley walked by [my]0-edgeways side , that [he]54-mr. astley looked for much to happen that morning . Behind [the old lady]1794-the old lady s chair marched [Potapitch]103-potapitch and [Martha Potapitch]103-potapitch in [his]54-mr. astley frockcoat and white waistcoat , with a cloak over all , and [the forty - year - old and rosy , but slightly grey - headed]855-the forty - year - old and rosy , but slightly grey - headed , [Martha]103-potapitch in a mobcap , cotton dress , and squeaking shoes . Frequently [the old lady]1794-the old lady would twist [herself]1794-the old lady round to converse with [these servants]857-these servants . As for [De Griers]73-de griers , [he]73-de griers spoke as though [he]73-de griers had made up [his]73-de griers mind to do something ( though it is also possible that [he]73-de griers spoke in this manner merely in order to hearten [the General]150-the general , with whom [he]73-de griers appeared to have held a conference ) . But , alas , [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had uttered the fatal words , " [I]396-the grandmother am not going to give [you]150-the general any of [my]396-the grandmother money ; "[396-the grandmother] and though [De Griers]73-de griers might regard these words lightly , [the General]150-the general knew [[his]150-the general mother]345-his mother better . Also , [I]0-edgeways noticed that [De Griers]73-de griers and [Mlle]50-mlle . Into [the Casino]170-the casino [we]866-us marched in triumph . At once , both in the person of [the commissionaire]868-the commissionaire and in [the persons of [the footmen]870-the footmen]869-the persons of the footmen , there sprang to life the same reverence as had arisen in the lacqueys of [the hotel]157-the hotel . Yet it was not without some curiosity that [they]865-they eyed [us]866-us .

Without loss of time , [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother gave orders that [she]396-the grandmother should be wheeled through [every room in [the establishment]874-the establishment]873-every room in the establishment ; of which [apartments]875-apartments [she]396-the grandmother praised a few , while to [others]497-others [she]396-the grandmother remained indifferent . Concerning everything , however , [she]396-the grandmother asked questions . Finally [we]866-us reached [the gaming - salons]877-the gaming - salons , where [a lacquey who was , acting as guard over the doors]878-a lacquey who was , acting as guard over the doors , flung [them]879-them open as though [he]878-a lacquey who was , acting as guard over the doors were [a man possessed]880-a man possessed .

[The Grandmother]396-the grandmother s entry into [the roulette - salon]882-the roulette - salon produced a profound impression upon [the public]883-the public . Around the tables , and at the further end of [the room where the trente - et - quarante table was set out]884-the room where the trente - et - quarante table was set out , there may have been gathered from 150 to [200 gamblers]885-200 gamblers , ranged in several rows . [Those who had succeeded in pushing [their]886-those who had succeeded in pushing their way to the tables way to the tables]886-those who had succeeded in pushing their way to the tables were standing with [their]886-those who had succeeded in pushing their way to the tables feet firmly planted , in order to avoid having to give up [their]886-those who had succeeded in pushing their way to the tables places until [they]886-those who had succeeded in pushing their way to the tables should have finished [their]886-those who had succeeded in pushing their way to the tables game ( since merely to stand looking on thus occupying [a gambler]887-a gambler s place for nothing was not permitted ) . True , chairs were provided around the tables , but [few players]888-few players made use of them more especially if there was a large attendance of [the general public]889-the general public ; since to stand allowed of a closer approach ; and , therefore , of greater facilities for calculation and staking . Behind the foremost row were herded a second and a third row of [people]531-people awaiting [their]531-people turn ; but sometimes [their]531-people impatience led [these people]2318-these people to stretch a hand through the first row , in order to deposit [their]2318-these people stakes . [Even third - row individuals]892-even third - row individuals would dart forward to stake ; whence seldom did more than five or ten minutes pass without a scene over disputed money arising at one or another end of the table . On the other hand , [the police of [the Casino]170-the casino]893-the police of the casino were [an able body of [men]281-men]895-an able body of men ; and though to escape the crush was an impossibility , however much one might wish it , [the eight croupiers apportioned to each table]897-the eight croupiers apportioned to each table kept an eye upon the stakes , performed the necessary reckoning , and decided disputes as [they]897-the eight croupiers apportioned to each table arose .

In the last resort [they]893-the police of the casino always called in [the Casino police]898-the casino police , and the disputes would immediately come to an end . [Policemen]899-policemen were stationed about [the Casino]170-the casino in ordinary costume , and mingled with [the spectators]901-the spectators so as to make it impossible to recognise [them]899-policemen . In particular [they]893-the police of the casino kept a lookout for [pickpockets]902-pickpockets and [swindlers]903-swindlers , who simply swanned in [the roulette salons]904-the roulette salons , and reaped a rich harvest . Indeed , in every direction money was being filched from pockets or purses though , of course , if the attempt miscarried , a great uproar ensued . [One]1733-one had only to approach a roulette table , begin to play , and then openly grab [some one]1749-some one else s winnings , for a din to be raised , and [the thief]907-the thief to start vociferating that the stake was _ [his]907-the thief ; _ and , if the coup had been carried out with sufficient skill , and [the witnesses]908-the witnesses wavered at all in [their]908-the witnesses testimony , [the thief]907-the thief would as likely as not succeed in getting away with the money , provided that the sum was not a large one not large enough to have attracted the attention of [the croupiers]910-the croupiers or [some fellow - player]911-some fellow - player . Moreover , if it were a stake of insignificant size , [its true owner]912-its true owner would sometimes decline to continue the dispute , rather than become involved in a scandal . Conversely , if [the thief]907-the thief was detected , [he]907-the thief was ignominiously expelled [the building]842-the building .

Upon all this [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother gazed with open - eyed curiosity ; and , on [some thieves]916-some thieves happening to be turned out of [the place]161-the place , [she]396-the grandmother was delighted . Trente - et - quarante interested [her]396-the grandmother but little ; [she]396-the grandmother preferred roulette , with [its]918-its ever - revolving wheel . At length [she]396-the grandmother expressed a wish to view the game closer ; whereupon in some mysterious manner , [the lacqueys]192-the lacqueys and [other officious agents]920-other officious agents ( especially [one or two ruined Poles of the kind who keep offering [their]921-one or two ruined poles of the kind who keep offering their services to successful gamblers and foreigners in general services to [successful gamblers]922-successful gamblers and [foreigners in general]923-foreigners in general]921-one or two ruined poles of the kind who keep offering their services to successful gamblers and foreigners in general ) at once found and cleared a space for [the old lady among the crush]924-the old lady among the crush , at the very centre of one of the tables , and next to [the chief croupier]925-the chief croupier ; after which [they]192-the lacqueys wheeled [her]924-the old lady among the crush chair thither . Always [she]952-a young lady staked large coins , and either lost or won one , two , or three thousand francs a day , but not more ; after which [she]952-a young lady would depart . [The Grandmother]396-the grandmother took a long look at [her]952-a young lady .

" _ [That _ woman]2376-that _ woman is not losing , "[396-the grandmother] [she]396-the grandmother said . " To whom does [she]2376-that _ woman belong ? Do [you]0-edgeways know [her]2376-that _ woman ? Who is [she]2376-that _ woman ? "[396-the grandmother]

[The Grandmother]64-the grandmother was vastly pleased .

" But what is zero ? "[396-the grandmother] [she]396-the grandmother inquired . " Just now [I]396-the grandmother heard [the flaxen - haired croupier]2379-the flaxen - haired croupier call out zero ! And why does [he]2379-the flaxen - haired croupier keep raking in all the money that is on the table ? To think that [he]2379-the flaxen - haired croupier should grab the whole pile for [himself]2379-the flaxen - haired croupier ! What does zero mean ? "[396-the grandmother]

" Zero is what [the bank]294-the bank takes for [itself]294-the bank . If the wheel stops at that figure , everything lying on the table becomes the absolute property of [the bank]294-the bank . Also , whenever the wheel has begun to turn , [the bank]294-the bank ceases to pay out anything . "[396-the grandmother]

" Then [I]396-the grandmother should receive nothing if [I]396-the grandmother were staking ? "[396-the grandmother]

" No ; unless by any chance [you]396-the grandmother had _ purposely _ staked on zero ; in which case [you]396-the grandmother would receive thirty - five times the value of [your]396-the grandmother stake . "[396-the grandmother]

" Why thirty - five times , when zero so often turns up ? And if so , why do not more of [these fools]2383-these fools stake upon [it]2384-it ? "[396-the grandmother]

" Because the number of chances against its occurrence is thirty - six . "[396-the grandmother]

" Rubbish ! Potapitch , [Potapitch]103-potapitch ! Come here , and [I]1794-the old lady will give [you]0-edgeways some money . " Go at once , and stake that upon zero . "[1794-the old lady]

" But , [Madame]106-madame , zero has only this moment turned up , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways remonstrated ; " wherefore , it may not do so again for ever so long . Wait a little , and [you]0-edgeways may then have a better chance . "[0-edgeways]

" Rubbish ! Stake , please . "[1794-the old lady]

" Pardon [me]0-edgeways , but zero might not turn up again until , say , tonight , even though [you]0-edgeways had staked thousands upon it . It often happens so . "[0-edgeways]

" Rubbish , rubbish ! Who fears the wolf should never enter [the forest]406-the forest . What ? [We]963-we have lost ? Then stake again . "[1794-the old lady]

A second ten - g lden piece did [we]963-we lose , and then [I]0-edgeways put down a third . [The Grandmother]396-the grandmother could scarcely remain seated in [her]396-the grandmother chair , so intent was [she]396-the grandmother upon the little ball as it leapt through the notches of the ever - revolving wheel . However , the third ten - g lden piece followed the first two . Upon this [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother went perfectly crazy . [She]396-the grandmother could no longer sit still , and actually struck the table with [her]396-the grandmother fist when [the croupier]329-the croupier cried out , " Trente - six , "[329-the croupier] instead of the desiderated zero .

" To listen to [him]329-the croupier ! "[1794-the old lady] fumed [the old lady]1794-the old lady . " When will that accursed zero ever turn up ? " [My]1794-the old lady good Madame "[1794-the old lady]

Accordingly [I]0-edgeways staked two ten - g lden pieces . The ball went hopping round the wheel until it began to settle through the notches . Meanwhile [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother sat as though petrified , with [my]0-edgeways hand convulsively clutched in [hers]64-the grandmother .

" Faites le jeu , [messieurs]2393-messieurs ! Faites le jeu , [messieurs]2393-messieurs ! Rien ne va plus , "[329-the croupier] proclaimed [the croupier]329-the croupier as once more [he]329-the croupier invited [the company]201-the company to stake , and prepared to turn the wheel .

" [We]910-the croupiers shall be too late ! [He]30-potapitch is going to spin again ! Stake , stake ! "[396-the grandmother] [The Grandmother]396-the grandmother was in a perfect fever . " Oui , [Madame]2252-madame , "[329-the croupier] was [the croupier]329-the croupier s polite reply . " No single stake must exceed four thousand florins . That is the regulation . "[329-the croupier]

" Then there is nothing else for it . [We]978-we must risk in [g lden]2400-g lden . "[329-the croupier]

" Le jeu est fait ! "[329-the croupier] [the croupier]329-the croupier called . The wheel revolved , and stopped at thirty . [We]978-we had lost !

" Again , again , again ! Stake again ! "[1794-the old lady] shouted [the old lady]1794-the old lady . Without attempting to oppose [her]1794-the old lady further , but merely shrugging [my]0-edgeways shoulders , [I]0-edgeways placed twelve more ten - g lden pieces upon the table . The wheel whirled around and around , with [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother simply quaking as [she]396-the grandmother watched its revolutions .

" Does [she]396-the grandmother again think that zero is going to be the winning coup ? "[0-edgeways] thought [I]0-edgeways , as [I]0-edgeways stared at [her]396-the grandmother in astonishment . Yet an absolute assurance of winning was shining on [her]396-the grandmother face ; [she]396-the grandmother looked perfectly convinced that zero was about to be called again . At length the ball dropped off into one of the notches .

" [Zero]114-zero ! "[329-the croupier] cried [the croupier]329-the croupier .

" Ah ! ! ! "[1794-the old lady] screamed [the old lady]1794-the old lady as [she]1794-the old lady turned to [me]0-edgeways in a whirl of triumph .

[I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways was at heart [a gambler]887-a gambler . At that moment [I]0-edgeways became acutely conscious both of that fact and of the fact that [my]0-edgeways hands and knees were shaking , and that the blood was beating in [my]0-edgeways brain . Of course this was a rare occasion an occasion on which zero had turned up no less than three times within a dozen rounds ; yet in such an event there was nothing so very surprising , seeing that , only three days ago , [I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways had been a witness to zero turning up _ three times in succession _ , so that one of [the players who was recording the coups on paper]984-the players who was recording the coups on paper was moved to remark that for several days past zero had never turned up at all !

With [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother , as with [any one who has won a very large sum]985-any one who has won a very large sum , [the management]986-the management settled up with great attention and respect , since [she]64-the grandmother was fortunate to have to receive no less than 4200 g lden . Of these g lden the odd 200 were paid [her]64-the grandmother in gold , and the remainder in bank notes .

This time [the old lady]1794-the old lady did not call for [Potapitch]103-potapitch ; for that [she]1794-the old lady was too preoccupied . Though not outwardly shaken by the event ( indeed , [she]1794-the old lady seemed perfectly calm ) , [she]1794-the old lady was trembling inwardly from head to foot . At length , completely absorbed in the game , [she]64-the grandmother burst out :

" [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch , did not the croupier just say that 4000 florins were the most that could be staked at any one time ? Well , take these 4000 , and stake them upon the red . "[64-the grandmother]

To oppose [her]64-the grandmother was useless . Once more the wheel revolved .

" Rouge ! "[329-the croupier] proclaimed [the croupier]329-the croupier .

Again 4000 florins in all 8000 !

" Give [me]396-the grandmother them , "[396-the grandmother] commanded [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother , " and stake the other 4000 upon the red again . "[396-the grandmother]

[I]0-edgeways did so .

" Rouge ! "[329-the croupier] proclaimed [the croupier]329-the croupier .

" Twelve thousand ! "[1794-the old lady] cried [the old lady]1794-the old lady . " Hand [me]1794-the old lady the whole lot . Put the gold into this purse here , and count the bank notes . Enough ! Let [us]994-us go [home]173-home . Wheel [my]1794-the old lady chair away . "[1794-the old lady]

XI

The chair , with [the old lady]1794-the old lady beaming in it , was wheeled away towards the doors at the further end of [the salon]471-the salon , while [[our]994-us party]177-our party hastened to crowd around [her]1794-the old lady , and to offer [her]1794-the old lady [their]177-our party congratulations . In fact , eccentric as was [her]1794-the old lady conduct , it was also overshadowed by [her]1794-the old lady triumph ; with the result that [the General]150-the general no longer feared to be publicly compromised by being seen with [such a strange woman]997-such a strange woman , but , smiling in a condescending , cheerfully familiar way , as though [he]150-the general were soothing [a child]1787-a child , [he]150-the general offered [his]150-the general greetings to [the old lady]1794-the old lady . At the same time , both [he]150-the general and [the rest of [the spectators]901-the spectators]1000-the rest of the spectators were visibly impressed . [Everywhere people]1002-everywhere people kept pointing to [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother , and talking about [her]396-the grandmother . [Many people]824-many people even walked beside [her]396-the grandmother chair , in order to view [her]396-the grandmother the better while , at a little distance , [Astley]54-mr. astley was carrying on a conversation on the subject with [two English acquaintances of [his]54-mr. astley]1005-two english acquaintances of his . [De Griers]73-de griers was simply overflowing with smiles and compliments , and a number of [fine ladies]656-fine ladies were staring at [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother as though [she]64-the grandmother had been something curious .

" Quelle victoire ! "[73-de griers] exclaimed [De Griers]73-de griers .

" Mais , [Madame]2252-madame , c tait du feu ! "[50-mlle] added [Mlle . Blanche]50-mlle with an elusive smile .

" Yes , [I]1794-the old lady have won twelve thousand florins , "[1794-the old lady] replied [the old lady]1794-the old lady . " And then there is all this gold . With it the total ought to come to nearly thirteen thousand . How much is that in Russian money ? Six thousand roubles , [I]1794-the old lady think ? "[1794-the old lady]

However , [I]0-edgeways calculated that the sum would exceed seven thousand roubles or , at the present rate of exchange , even eight thousand .

" Eight thousand roubles ! What a splendid thing ! And to think of [[you]2403-you simpletons]2404-you simpletons sitting there and doing nothing ! [Potapitch]2405-potapitch ! [Martha]103-potapitch ! See what [I]1794-the old lady have won ! "[1794-the old lady]

" [I]103-potapitch was watching [you]0-edgeways all the time , [Madame]2252-madame , "[103-potapitch] quavered [Martha]103-potapitch , " and [I]103-potapitch asked [Potapitch]103-potapitch what [mistress]2427-mistress was trying to do .
