Even yet [I]103-potapitch tremble [I]103-potapitch tremble to think of it all . "[103-potapitch]

" [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch , "[1794-the old lady] said [the old lady]1794-the old lady , " after luncheon , that is to say , about four o clock get ready to go out with [me]1794-the old lady again . But in the meanwhile , good - bye . Do not forget to call [a doctor]2436-a doctor , for [I]1794-the old lady must take the waters . Now go and get rested a little . "[1794-the old lady]

[I]0-edgeways left [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s presence in a state of bewilderment .

Vainly [I]0-edgeways endeavoured to imagine what would become of [[our]1034-our party]177-our party , or what turn the affair would next take . [I]0-edgeways could perceive that [none of [the party]186-the party]1036-none of the party had yet recovered [their]1036-none of the party presence of mind least of all [the General]150-the general . The factor of [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s appearance in place of the hourly expected telegram to announce [her]396-the grandmother death ( with , of course , resultant legacies ) had so upset the whole scheme of intentions and projects that it was with a decided feeling of apprehension and growing paralysis that [the conspirators]1040-the conspirators viewed any future performances of [the old lady]1794-the old lady at roulette . Yet this second factor was not quite so important as the first , since , though [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had twice declared that [she]396-the grandmother did not intend to give [the General]150-the general any money , that declaration was not a complete ground for the abandonment of hope . Certainly [De Griers]73-de griers , who , with [the General]150-the general , was up to the neck in the affair , had not wholly lost courage ; and [I]0-edgeways felt sure that [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle also [Mlle]50-mlle . Blanche who was not only as deeply involved as [the other two]1045-the other two , but also expectant of becoming [Madame General]100-madame general and [an important legatee]1046-an important legatee would not lightly surrender the position , but would use [her]50-mlle every resource of coquetry upon [the old lady]1794-the old lady , in order to afford a contrast to [the impetuous Polina , who was difficult to understand , and lacked the art of pleasing]1048-the impetuous polina , who was difficult to understand , and lacked the art of pleasing .

Yet now , when [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother had just performed an astonishing feat at roulette ; now , when [the old lady]1794-the old lady s personality had been so clearly and typically revealed as that of [a rugged , arrogant woman who was " tomb e en enfance "]2437-a rugged , arrogant woman who was " tomb e en enfance "[2437-a rugged , arrogant woman who was " tomb e en enfance "] ; now , when everything appeared to be lost , why , now [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother was as merry as [a child which plays with thistle - down]1051-a child which plays with thistle - down . " [Good Lord]2438-good lord ! "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways thought with , may [God]82-god forgive [me]0-edgeways , a most malicious smile , " every ten - g lden piece which [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother staked must have raised a blister on [the General]150-the general s heart , and maddened [De Griers]73-de griers , and driven [Mlle]50-mlle . [de Cominges]106-madame almost to frenzy with the sight of this spoon dangling before [her]396-the grandmother lips . "[0-edgeways] Another factor is the circumstance that even when , overjoyed at winning , [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother was distributing alms right and left , and taking every one to be [a beggar]2416-a beggar , [she]396-the grandmother again snapped out to [the General]150-the general that [he]150-the general was not going to be allowed any of [her]396-the grandmother money which meant that [the old lady]1794-the old lady had quite made up [her]1794-the old lady mind on the point , and was sure of it . Yes , danger loomed ahead .

All these thoughts passed through [my]0-edgeways mind during the few moments that , having left [[the old lady]1794-the old lady s rooms]1057-the old lady s rooms , [I]0-edgeways was ascending to [[my]0-edgeways own room]335-my own room on [the top storey]1059-the top storey . What most struck [me]0-edgeways was the fact that , though [I]0-edgeways had divined [the chief]1060-the chief , the stoutest , threads which united the various actors in the drama , [I]0-edgeways had , until now , been ignorant of the methods and secrets of the game . For [Polina]47-polina had never been completely open with [me]0-edgeways . Although , on occasions , it had happened that involuntarily , as it were , [she]47-polina had revealed to [me]0-edgeways something of [her]47-polina heart , [I]0-edgeways had noticed that in most cases in fact , nearly always [she]47-polina had either laughed away these revelations , or grown confused , or purposely imparted to [them]1061-them a false guise . Yes , [she]47-polina must have concealed a great deal from [me]0-edgeways . But , [I]0-edgeways had a presentiment that now the end of this strained and mysterious situation was approaching . Another stroke , and all would be finished and exposed . Of [my]0-edgeways own fortunes , interested though [I]0-edgeways was in the affair , [I]0-edgeways took no account . [I]0-edgeways was in the strange position of possessing but two hundred g lden , of being at a loose end , of lacking both a post , the means of subsistence , a shred of hope , and any plans for the future , yet of caring nothing for these things . Had not [my]0-edgeways mind been so full of [Polina]47-polina , [I]0-edgeways should have given [myself]0-edgeways up to the comical piquancy of the impending denouement , and laughed [my]0-edgeways fill at it . But the thought of [Polina]47-polina was torture to [me]0-edgeways . That [her]47-polina fate was settled [I]0-edgeways already had an inkling ; yet _ that _ was not the thought which was giving [me]0-edgeways so much uneasiness . What [I]0-edgeways really wished for was to penetrate [her]47-polina secrets . [I]0-edgeways wanted [her]47-polina to come to [me]0-edgeways and say , " [I]47-polina love [you]0-edgeways , "[47-polina] and , if [she]47-polina would not so come , or if to hope that [she]47-polina would ever do so was an unthinkable absurdity why , then there was nothing else for [me]0-edgeways to want . Even now [I]0-edgeways do not know what [I]0-edgeways am wanting . [I]0-edgeways feel like [a man who has lost [his]1062-a man who has lost his way way]1062-a man who has lost his way . [I]0-edgeways yearn but to be in [her]47-polina presence , and within the circle of [her]47-polina light and splendour to be there now , and forever , and for the whole of [my]0-edgeways life . More [I]0-edgeways do not know . How can [I]0-edgeways ever bring [myself]0-edgeways to leave [her]47-polina ?

On reaching [the third storey of [the hotel]157-the hotel]1063-the third storey of the hotel [I]0-edgeways experienced a shock . [I]0-edgeways was just passing [[the General]150-the general s suite]160-the general s suite when something caused [me]0-edgeways to look round . Out of a door about twenty paces away there was coming [Polina]47-polina ! [She]47-polina hesitated for a moment on seeing [me]0-edgeways , and then beckoned [me]0-edgeways to [her]47-polina .

" [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina ! "[47-polina]

" Hush ! Not so loud . "[47-polina]

" Something startled [me]0-edgeways just now , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways whispered , " and [I]0-edgeways looked round , and saw [you]47-polina . Some electrical influence seems to emanate from [your]47-polina form . "[0-edgeways]

" Take this letter , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina went on with a frown ( probably [she]47-polina had not even heard [my]0-edgeways words , [she]47-polina was so preoccupied ) , " and hand it personally to [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley . Go as quickly as ever [you]0-edgeways can , please . No answer will be required . [He]54-mr. astley [himself]54-mr. astley "[47-polina] [She]47-polina did not finish [her]47-polina sentence .

" To [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways asked , in some astonishment .

But [she]47-polina had vanished again .

Aha ! So [the two]1803-the two were carrying on a correspondence ! However , [I]0-edgeways set off to search for [Astley]54-mr. astley first at [[his]54-mr. astley hotel]1068-his hotel , and then at [the Casino]170-the casino , where [I]0-edgeways went the round of the salons in vain . At length , vexed , and almost in despair , [I]0-edgeways was on [my]0-edgeways way [home]173-home when [I]0-edgeways ran across [him]54-mr. astley among [a troop of English ladies and [gentlemen who had been out for a ride]1072-gentlemen who had been out for a ride]1071-a troop of english ladies and gentlemen who had been out for a ride . Beckoning to [him]54-mr. astley to stop , [I]0-edgeways handed [him]54-mr. astley the letter . [We]1803-the two had barely time even to look at [one another]435-one another , but [I]0-edgeways suspected that it was of set purpose that [he]54-mr. astley restarted [his]54-mr. astley horse so quickly .

Was jealousy , then , gnawing at [me]0-edgeways ? At all events , [I]0-edgeways felt exceedingly depressed , despite the fact that [I]0-edgeways had no desire to ascertain what the correspondence was about . To think that _ [he]54-mr. astley _ should be [[her]1074-her confidant]1075-her confidant ! " [[My]0-edgeways friend]617-my friend , [[mine]0-edgeways own familiar friend]2442-mine own familiar friend ! "[0-edgeways] passed through [my]0-edgeways mind . Yet _ was _ there any love in the matter ? " Of course not , "[0-edgeways] reason whispered to [me]0-edgeways . But reason goes for little on such occasions . [I]0-edgeways felt that the matter must be cleared up , for it was becoming unpleasantly complex .

[I]0-edgeways had scarcely set foot in [the hotel]157-the hotel when [the commissionaire]868-the commissionaire and [the landlord]1981-the landlord ( the latter issuing from [[his]54-mr. astley room]1079-his room for the purpose ) alike informed [me]0-edgeways that [I]0-edgeways was being searched for high and low that three separate messages to ascertain [my]0-edgeways whereabouts had come down from [the General]150-the general . When [I]0-edgeways entered [[his]150-the general study]1081-his study [I]0-edgeways was feeling anything but kindly disposed . [I]0-edgeways found there [the General]150-the general [himself]150-the general , [De Griers]73-de griers , and [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle , but not [Mlle]50-mlle . [s mother]1083-s mother , who was [a person whom [[her]1083-s mother reputed daughter]1085-her reputed daughter used only for show purposes , since in all matters of business [the daughter]1854-the daughter fended for [herself]1854-the daughter]1084-a person whom her reputed daughter used only for show purposes , since in all matters of business the daughter fended for herself , and it is unlikely that [the mother]1087-the mother knew anything about [them]1088-them .

Some very heated discussion was in progress , and meanwhile the door of [the study]1089-the study was open an unprecedented circumstance . As [I]0-edgeways approached the portals [I]0-edgeways could hear loud voices raised , for mingled with the pert , venomous accents of [De Griers]73-de griers were [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle s excited , impudently abusive tongue and [the General]150-the general s plaintive wail as , apparently , [he]150-the general sought to justify [himself]150-the general in something . But on [my]0-edgeways appearance [every one]212-every one stopped speaking , and tried to put a better face upon matters . [De Griers]73-de griers smoothed [his]73-de griers hair , and twisted [his]73-de griers angry face into a smile into the mean , studiedly polite French smile which [I]0-edgeways so detested ; while [the downcast , perplexed General]1092-the downcast , perplexed general assumed an air of dignity though only in a mechanical way . On the other hand , [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle did not trouble to conceal the wrath that was sparkling in [her]50-mlle countenance , but bent [her]50-mlle gaze upon [me]0-edgeways with an air of impatient expectancy . [I]0-edgeways may remark that hitherto [she]50-mlle had treated [me]0-edgeways with absolute superciliousness , and , so far from answering [my]0-edgeways salutations , had always ignored them .

[XII

The Grandmother]64-the grandmother was in an impatient , irritable frame of mind . Without doubt the roulette had turned [her]106-madame head , for [she]106-madame appeared to be indifferent to everything else , and , in general , seemed much distraught . For instance , [she]106-madame asked [me]0-edgeways no questions about objects _ en route _ , except that , when a sumptuous barouche passed [us]1109-us and raised a cloud of dust , [she]106-madame lifted [her]106-madame hand for a moment , and inquired , " What was that ? "[106-madame] Yet even then [she]106-madame did not appear to hear [my]0-edgeways reply , although at times [her]106-madame abstraction was interrupted by sallies and fits of sharp , impatient fidgeting . Again , when [I]0-edgeways pointed out to [her]106-madame [the Baron]1935-the baron and [Baroness Burmergelm]78-baroness burmergelm walking to [the Casino]170-the casino , [she]106-madame merely looked at [them]1113-you in an absent - minded sort of way , and said with complete indifference , " Ah ! "[106-madame] Then , turning sharply to [Potapitch]103-potapitch and [Martha]103-potapitch , who were walking behind [us]1109-us , [she]106-madame rapped out :

" Why have _ [you]1113-you _ attached [yourselves]1113-you to [the party]186-the party ? [We]1109-us are not going to take [you]1113-you with [us]1109-us every time . Go [home]173-home at once . "[106-madame] Then , when [the servants]1114-the servants had pulled hasty bows and departed , [she]106-madame added to [me]0-edgeways : " [You]0-edgeways are all the escort [I]106-madame need . "[106-madame]

At [the Casino]170-the casino [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother seemed to be expected , for no time was lost in procuring [her]396-the grandmother former place beside the croupier . It is [my]0-edgeways opinion that though croupiers seem [such ordinary , humdrum officials men who care nothing whether [the bank]294-the bank wins or loses [they]1117-such ordinary , humdrum officials men who care nothing whether the bank wins or loses they are , in reality , anything but indifferent to the bank s losing , and are given instructions to attract players , and to keep a watch over the bank s interests are , in reality , anything but indifferent to the bank s losing , and are given instructions to attract [players]1119-players , and to keep a watch over [the bank]294-the bank s interests]1117-such ordinary , humdrum officials men who care nothing whether the bank wins or loses they are , in reality , anything but indifferent to the bank s losing , and are given instructions to attract players , and to keep a watch over the bank s interests ; as also , that for such services , [these officials]1121-these officials are awarded prizes and premiums . At all events , [the croupiers of [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg]1122-the croupiers of roulettenberg seemed to look upon [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother as [their]1122-the croupiers of roulettenberg lawful prey whereafter there befell what [[our]1123-we party]177-our party had foretold .

It happened thus :

As soon as ever [we]1123-we arrived [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother ordered [me]0-edgeways to stake twelve ten - g lden pieces in succession upon zero . Once , twice , and thrice [I]0-edgeways did so , yet zero never turned up .

" Stake again , "[1794-the old lady] said [the old lady]1794-the old lady with an impatient nudge of [my]0-edgeways elbow , and [I]0-edgeways obeyed .

" How many times have [we]1123-we lost ? "[1794-the old lady] [she]1794-the old lady inquired actually grinding [her]1794-the old lady teeth in [her]1794-the old lady excitement .

" [We]1123-we have lost 144 ten - g lden pieces , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways replied . " [I]0-edgeways tell [you]396-the grandmother , [Madame]106-madame , that zero may not turn up until nightfall . "[0-edgeways]

" Never mind , "[1794-the old lady] [she]1794-the old lady interrupted . " Keep on staking upon zero , and also stake a thousand g lden upon rouge . Here is a banknote with which to do so . "[1794-the old lady]

The red turned up , but zero missed again , and [we]1123-we only got [our]1123-we thousand g lden back .

" But [you]0-edgeways see , [you]0-edgeways see , "[1794-the old lady] whispered [the old lady]1794-the old lady . " [We]1123-we have now recovered almost all that [we]1123-we staked . Try zero again . Let [us]1123-we do so another ten times , and then leave off . "[1794-the old lady]

By the fifth round , however , [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother was weary of the scheme .

" To the devil with that zero ! "[396-the grandmother] [she]396-the grandmother exclaimed . " Stake four thousand g lden upon the red . "[396-the grandmother]

" But , [Madame]106-madame , that will be so much to venture ! "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways remonstrated . " Suppose the red should not turn up ? "[396-the grandmother] [The Grandmother]396-the grandmother almost struck [me]0-edgeways in [her]396-the grandmother excitement . [Her]396-the grandmother agitation was rapidly making [her]396-the grandmother quarrelsome . Consequently , there was nothing for it but to stake the whole four thousand g lden as [she]396-the grandmother had directed .

The wheel revolved while [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother sat as bolt upright , and with as proud and quiet [a mien]1131-a mien , as though [she]396-the grandmother had not the least doubt of winning .

" [Zero]114-zero ! "[329-the croupier] cried [the croupier]329-the croupier .

At first [the old lady]1794-the old lady failed to understand the situation ; but , as soon as [she]1794-the old lady saw the croupier raking in [her]1794-the old lady four thousand g lden , together with everything else that happened to be lying on the table , and recognised that the zero which had been so long turning up , and on which [we]1134-we had lost nearly two hundred ten - g lden pieces , had at length , as though of set purpose , made a sudden reappearance why , [the poor old lady]1135-the poor old lady fell to cursing it , and to throwing [herself]1135-the poor old lady about , and wailing and gesticulating at the company at large . Indeed , [some people in [our]1134-we vicinity]1136-some people in our vicinity actually burst out laughing .

" Here [we]758-the rest are , [Madame]2252-madame , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways announced . " Here is [the moneychanger s office]2478-the moneychanger s office . "[0-edgeways]

The process of changing involved complicated calculations which soon necessitated [my]0-edgeways return to [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother for instructions .

" [The thieves]2479-the thieves ! "[64-the grandmother] [she]64-the grandmother exclaimed as [she]64-the grandmother clapped [her]64-the grandmother hands together . " Never mind , though . " Pray recollect [yourself]1165-the clerk ! "[1794-the old lady] cried [the old lady]1794-the old lady . " And may [my]1794-the old lady money choke [you]1165-the clerk ! " [The clerk]1165-the clerk says that [others]497-others will give [you]1165-the clerk even less than [he]87-alexis ivanovitch . "[1169-the grave - faced official]

Of what the ultimate calculations consisted [I]0-edgeways do not exactly remember , but at all events they were alarming . Receiving twelve thousand florins in gold , [I]0-edgeways took also the statement of accounts , and carried it out to [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother .

" Well , well , "[64-the grandmother] [she]64-the grandmother said , " [I]64-the grandmother am [no accountant]2490-no accountant . Let [us]2491-us hurry away , hurry away . "[64-the grandmother] And [she]64-the grandmother waved the paper aside .

" Neither upon that accursed zero , however , nor upon that equally accursed red do [I]0-edgeways mean to stake a cent , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways muttered to [myself]0-edgeways as [I]0-edgeways entered [the Casino]170-the casino .

This time [I]0-edgeways did all [I]0-edgeways could to persuade [the old lady]1794-the old lady to stake as little as possible saying that a turn would come in the chances when [she]1794-the old lady would be at liberty to stake more . But [she]64-the grandmother was so impatient that , though at first [she]64-the grandmother agreed to do as [I]0-edgeways suggested , nothing could stop [her]64-the grandmother when once [she]64-the grandmother had begun . By way of prelude [she]64-the grandmother won stakes of a hundred and two hundred g lden .

" There [you]0-edgeways are ! "[64-the grandmother] [she]64-the grandmother said as [she]64-the grandmother nudged [me]0-edgeways . " See what [we]2492-we have won ! Surely it would be worth [our]2492-we while to stake four thousand instead of a hundred , for [we]2492-we might win another four thousand , and then ! Oh , it was [YOUR]0-edgeways fault before all [your]0-edgeways fault ! "[64-the grandmother]

[I]0-edgeways felt greatly put out as [I]0-edgeways watched [her]64-the grandmother play , but [I]0-edgeways decided to hold [my]0-edgeways tongue , and to give [her]64-the grandmother no more advice .

Suddenly [De Griers]73-de griers appeared on the scene . It seemed that all this while [he]73-de griers and [[his]73-de griers companions]1175-his companions had been standing beside [us]1176-us though [I]0-edgeways noticed that [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle had withdrawn a little from the rest , and was engaged in flirting with [the Prince]2145-the prince . Clearly [the General]150-the general was greatly put out at this . Indeed , [he]150-the general was in a perfect agony of vexation . But [Mlle]50-mlle . was careful never to look [his]150-the general way , though [he]150-the general did [his]150-the general best to attract [her]50-mlle notice . [Poor General]115-poor general ! By turns [his]150-the general face blanched and reddened , and [he]150-the general was trembling to such an extent that [he]150-the general could scarcely follow [the old lady]1794-the old lady s play . At length [Mlle]50-mlle . and [the Prince]2145-the prince took [their]1181-their departure , and [the General]150-the general followed [them]1181-their .

" [Madame]2252-madame , [Madame]2252-madame , "[73-de griers] sounded the honeyed accents of [De Griers]73-de griers as [he]73-de griers leant over to whisper in [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s ear . " That stake will never win . No , no , it is impossible , "[73-de griers] [he]73-de griers added in Russian with a writhe . " No , no ! "[73-de griers]

" But why not ? "[396-the grandmother] asked [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother , turning round . " Show [me]396-the grandmother what [I]396-the grandmother ought to do . "[396-the grandmother]

Instantly [De Griers]73-de griers burst into a babble of French as [he]73-de griers advised , jumped about , declared that such and such chances ought to be waited for , and started to make calculations of figures . All this [he]73-de griers addressed to [me]0-edgeways in [my]0-edgeways capacity as translator tapping the table the while with [his]73-de griers finger , and pointing hither and thither . At length [he]73-de griers seized a pencil , and began to reckon sums on paper until [he]73-de griers had exhausted [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s patience .

" Away with [you]73-de griers ! "[396-the grandmother] [she]396-the grandmother interrupted . " [You]73-de griers talk sheer nonsense , for , though [you]73-de griers keep on saying [Madame]106-madame , [Madame]2252-madame , [you]73-de griers haven t the least notion what ought to be done . " [Mais]116-mais , [Madame]2252-madame , "[73-de griers] cooed [De Griers]73-de griers and straightway started afresh with [his]73-de griers fussy instructions .

" [Stake]2497-stake just _ once _ , as [he]73-de griers advises , "[396-the grandmother] [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother said to [me]0-edgeways , " and then [we]2498-we shall see what [we]2498-we _ shall _ see . Of course , [his]73-de griers stake _ might _ win . "[396-the grandmother]

As a matter of fact , [De Grier]117-de grier s one object was to distract [the old lady]1794-the old lady from staking large sums ; wherefore , [he]117-de grier now suggested to [her]1794-the old lady that [she]1794-the old lady should stake upon certain numbers , singly and in groups . Consequently , in accordance with [his]117-de grier instructions , [I]0-edgeways staked a ten - g lden piece upon several odd numbers in the first twenty , and five ten - g lden pieces upon certain groups of numbers - groups of from twelve to eighteen , and from eighteen to twenty - four . The total staked amounted to 160 g lden .

The wheel revolved . " Zero ! "[329-the croupier] cried [the croupier]329-the croupier .

[We]1189-we had lost it all !

" [The fool]2077-the fool ! "[1794-the old lady] cried [the old lady]1794-the old lady as [she]1794-the old lady turned upon [De Griers]73-de griers . Deeply offended , [De Griers]73-de griers shrugged [his]73-de griers shoulders , favoured [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother with a look of contempt , and departed . For some time past [he]73-de griers had been feeling ashamed of being seen in such company , and this had proved the last straw .

An hour later [we]1189-we had lost everything in hand .

" [Home]173-home ! "[396-the grandmother] cried [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother .

And who is to repay [De Griers]73-de griers ? Clearly [Mlle]50-mlle . [I]0-edgeways ascended to [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room , and lay down upon the bed . A whole hour [I]0-edgeways must have lain thus , with [my]0-edgeways head resting upon [my]0-edgeways hand . " With [your]2252-madame leave , [Madame]106-madame , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said , " [I]0-edgeways will not go with [you]2252-madame . "[0-edgeways]

"[0-edgeways]

Laying the money upon a little table which [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s chair happened to be passing , [I]0-edgeways bowed and withdrew .

" What folly ! "[396-the grandmother] [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother shouted after [me]0-edgeways . " Very well , then . Do not come , and [I]396-the grandmother will find [my]396-the grandmother way alone . [Potapitch]2560-potapitch , [you]2560-potapitch must come with [me]396-the grandmother . Lift up the chair , and carry [me]396-the grandmother along . "[396-the grandmother]

[I]0-edgeways failed to find [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , and returned [home]173-home . It was now growing late it was past midnight , but [I]0-edgeways subsequently learnt from [Potapitch]103-potapitch how [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s day had ended . [She]396-the grandmother had lost all the money which , earlier in the day , [I]0-edgeways had got for [her]396-the grandmother paper securities a sum amounting to about ten thousand roubles . This [she]396-the grandmother did under the direction of [the Pole whom]1232-the pole whom , that afternoon , [she]396-the grandmother had dowered with two ten - g lden pieces . But before [his]1232-the pole whom arrival on the scene , [she]396-the grandmother had commanded [Potapitch]103-potapitch to stake for [her]396-the grandmother ; until at length [she]396-the grandmother had told [him]1232-the pole whom also to go about [his]1232-the pole whom business . Upon that [the Pole]1233-the pole had leapt into the breach . Not only did it happen that [he]1232-the pole whom knew the Russian language , but also [he]1232-the pole whom could speak a mixture of three different dialects , so that [the pair]1806-the pair were able to understand [one another]435-one another . Yet [the old lady]1794-the old lady never ceased to abuse [him]1232-the pole whom , despite [his]1232-the pole whom deferential manner , and to compare [him]1232-the pole whom unfavourably with [myself]0-edgeways ( so , at all events , [Potapitch]103-potapitch declared ) . " _ [You]0-edgeways _ , "[1237-the old chamberlain] [the old chamberlain]1237-the old chamberlain said to [me]0-edgeways , " treated [her]396-the grandmother as [a gentleman]290-a gentleman should , but [he]1232-the pole whom [he]1232-the pole whom robbed [her]396-the grandmother right and left , as [I]1237-the old chamberlain could see with [my]1237-the old chamberlain own eyes . Twice [she]396-the grandmother caught [him]1232-the pole whom at it , and rated [him]1232-the pole whom soundly . On one occasion [she]396-the grandmother even pulled [his]1232-the pole whom hair , so that [the bystanders]496-the bystanders burst out laughing . Yet [she]396-the grandmother lost everything , sir that is to say , [she]396-the grandmother lost all that [you]0-edgeways had changed for [her]396-the grandmother . Then [we]2563-we brought [her]396-the grandmother [home]173-home , and , after asking for some water and saying [her]396-the grandmother prayers , [she]396-the grandmother went to bed . So worn out was [she]396-the grandmother that [she]396-the grandmother fell asleep at once . May [God]82-god send [her]396-the grandmother dreams of angels ! And _ this _ is all that foreign travel has done for [us]2563-we ! Oh , [[my]1237-the old chamberlain own [Moscow]8-moscow]2565-my own moscow ! For what have [we]2563-we not at [home]173-home [there]317-there , in [Moscow]8-moscow ? Such [a garden]2568-a garden and flowers as [you]2569-you could never see here , and fresh air and apple - trees coming into blossom , and a beautiful view to look upon . Ah , but what must [she]2570-she do but go travelling abroad ? Alack , alack ! "[1237-the old chamberlain]

[XIII]122-xiii

Almost a month has passed since [I]0-edgeways last touched these notes notes which [I]0-edgeways began under the influence of impressions at once poignant and disordered . The crisis which [I]0-edgeways then felt to be approaching has now arrived , but in a form a hundred times more extensive and unexpected than [I]0-edgeways had looked for . To [me]0-edgeways it all seems strange , uncouth , and tragic . Certain occurrences have befallen [me]0-edgeways which border upon the marvellous . At all events , that is how [I]0-edgeways view them . [I]0-edgeways view them so in one regard at least . [I]0-edgeways refer to the whirlpool of events in which , at the time , [I]0-edgeways was revolving . But the most curious feature of all is [my]0-edgeways relation to those events , for hitherto [I]0-edgeways had never clearly understood [myself]0-edgeways . Yet now the actual crisis has passed away like a dream . Even [my]0-edgeways passion for [Polina]47-polina is dead . _ Was _ it ever so strong and genuine as [I]0-edgeways thought ? If so , what has become of it now ? At times [I]0-edgeways fancy that [I]0-edgeways must be mad ; that somewhere [I]0-edgeways am sitting in [a madhouse]1238-a madhouse ; that these events have merely _ seemed _ to happen ; that still they merely _ seem _ to be happening .

[I]0-edgeways have been arranging and re - perusing [my]0-edgeways notes ( perhaps for the purpose of convincing [myself]0-edgeways that [I]0-edgeways am not in [a madhouse]1238-a madhouse ) . At present [I]0-edgeways am lonely and alone . Autumn is coming already it is mellowing the leaves ; and , as [I]0-edgeways sit brooding in [this melancholy little town]1240-this melancholy little town ( and how melancholy [the little towns of]1241-the little towns of [Germany]16-germany can be ! ) , [I]0-edgeways find [myself]0-edgeways taking no thought for the future , but living under the influence of passing moods , and of [my]0-edgeways recollections of the tempest which recently drew [me]0-edgeways into its vortex , and then cast [me]0-edgeways out again . At times [I]0-edgeways seem still to be caught within that vortex . At times , the tempest seems once more to be gathering , and , as it passes overhead , to be wrapping [me]0-edgeways in its folds , until [I]0-edgeways have lost [my]0-edgeways sense of order and reality , and continue whirling and whirling and whirling around .

Yet , it may be that [I]0-edgeways shall be able to stop [myself]0-edgeways from revolving if once [I]0-edgeways can succeed in rendering [myself]0-edgeways an exact account of what has happened within the month just past . Somehow [I]0-edgeways feel drawn towards the pen ; on many and many an evening [I]0-edgeways have had nothing else in [the world]263-the world to do . But , curiously enough , of late [I]0-edgeways have taken to amusing [myself]0-edgeways with the works of [M. Paul de Kock]123-m. paul de kock , which [I]0-edgeways read in German translations obtained from [a wretched local library]1243-a wretched local library . These works [I]0-edgeways can not abide , yet [I]0-edgeways read them , and find [myself]0-edgeways marvelling that [I]0-edgeways should be doing so . Somehow [I]0-edgeways seem to be afraid of any _ serious _ book afraid of permitting any _ serious _ preoccupation to break the spell of the passing moment . So dear to [me]0-edgeways is the formless dream of which [I]0-edgeways have spoken , so dear to [me]0-edgeways are the impressions which it has left behind it , that [I]0-edgeways fear to touch the vision with anything new , lest it should dissolve in smoke . But is it so dear to [me]0-edgeways ? Yes , it _ is _ dear to [me]0-edgeways , and will ever be fresh in [my]0-edgeways recollections even forty years hence ....

So let [me]0-edgeways write of it , but only partially , and in a more abridged form than [my]0-edgeways full impressions might warrant .

First of all , let [me]0-edgeways conclude the history of [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother . Next day [she]396-the grandmother lost every g lden that [she]396-the grandmother possessed . Things were bound to happen so , for [persons of [her]396-the grandmother type who have once entered upon [that road]1246-that road]1245-persons of her type who have once entered upon that road descend it with ever - increasing rapidity , even as a sledge descends a toboggan - slide . All day until eight o clock that evening did [she]396-the grandmother play ; and , though [I]0-edgeways personally did not witness [her]396-the grandmother exploits , [I]0-edgeways learnt of them later through report .

All that day [Potapitch]103-potapitch remained in attendance upon [her]396-the grandmother ; but the Poles who directed [her]396-the grandmother play [she]396-the grandmother changed more than once . As a beginning [she]396-the grandmother dismissed [her]396-the grandmother Pole of the previous day the Pole whose hair [she]396-the grandmother had pulled and took to [herself]396-the grandmother another one ; but [the latter]196-the latter proved worse even than the former , and incurred dismissal in favour of [the first Pole]1248-the first pole , who , during the time of [his]1248-the first pole unemployment , had nevertheless hovered around [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s chair , and from time to time obtruded [his]1248-the first pole head over [her]396-the grandmother shoulder . At length [the old lady]1794-the old lady became desperate , for [the second Pole]1251-the second pole , when dismissed , imitated [[his]1251-the second pole predecessor]1252-his predecessor by declining to go away ; with the result that [one Pole]1253-one pole remained standing on the right of [the victim]1860-the victim , and the other on [her]396-the grandmother left ; from which vantage points [the pair]1806-the pair quarrelled , abused [each other]1256-each other concerning the stakes and rounds , and exchanged the epithet " laidak"[4[1256-each other] ] and other Polish terms of endearment . Finally , [they]1806-the pair effected a mutual reconciliation , and , tossing the money about anyhow , played simply at random . Once more quarrelling , [each of [them]1806-the pair]1257-each of them staked money on [his]1257-each of them own side of [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s chair ( for instance , [the one Pole]1259-the one pole staked upon the red , and the other one upon the black ) , until [they]1806-the pair had so confused and browbeaten [the old lady]1794-the old lady that , nearly weeping , [she]1794-the old lady was forced to appeal to [the head croupier]1261-the head croupier for protection , and to have [the two Poles]1262-the two poles expelled . No time was lost in this being done , despite the rascals cries and protestations that [the old lady]1794-the old lady was in [their]1806-the pair debt , that [she]1794-the old lady had cheated [them]1806-the pair , and that [her]1794-the old lady general behaviour had been mean and dishonourable . The same evening [the unfortunate Potapitch]103-potapitch related the story to [me]0-edgeways with tears complaining that [the two men]1264-the two men had filled [their]1264-the two men pockets with money ( [he]1257-each of them [himself]1257-each of them had seen [them]1264-the two men do it ) which had been shamelessly pilfered from [[his]1257-each of them mistress]1265-his mistress . For instance , [one Pole]1253-one pole demanded of [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother fifty g lden for [his]1253-one pole trouble , and then staked the money by the side of [her]396-the grandmother stake . [She]396-the grandmother happened to win ; whereupon [he]1257-each of them cried out that the winning stake was [his]1257-each of them , and [hers]396-the grandmother [the loser]1268-the loser . As soon as [the two Poles]1262-the two poles had been expelled , [Potapitch]103-potapitch left [the room]415-the room , and reported to [the authorities]536-the authorities that [the men]1272-the men s pockets were full of gold ; and , on [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother also requesting [the head croupier]1261-the head croupier to look into the affair , [the police]1274-the police made [their]1274-the police appearance , and , despite the protests of [the Poles]55-the poles ( who , indeed , had been caught redhanded ) , [their]55-the poles pockets were turned inside out , and the contents handed over to [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother . In fact , in , view of the circumstance that [she]64-the grandmother lost all day , [the croupiers]910-the croupiers and [other authorities of [the Casino]170-the casino]1276-other authorities of the casino showed [her]64-the grandmother every attention ; and on [her]64-the grandmother fame spreading through [the town]352-the town , [visitors of every nationality even the most knowing of [them]55-the poles]1279-visitors of every nationality even the most knowing of them , [the most distinguished crowded]1280-the most distinguished crowded to get a glimpse of " la vieille comtesse russe , tomb e en enfance , "[55-the poles] who had lost " so many millions . "[55-the poles]

[ 4 ] [Rascal]1281-rascal

Yet with the money which [the authorities]536-the authorities restored to [her]64-the grandmother from the pockets of [the Poles]55-the poles [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother effected very , very little , for there soon arrived to take [[his]1283-his countrymen]1284-his countrymen s place , [a third Pole]1285-a third pole a man who could speak Russian fluently , was dressed like [a gentleman ( albeit in lacqueyish fashion ) , and sported a huge moustache]1286-a gentleman ( albeit in lacqueyish fashion ) , and sported a huge moustache . Though polite enough to [the old lady]1794-the old lady , [he]1285-a third pole took a high hand with [the bystanders]496-the bystanders . In short , [he]1285-a third pole offered [himself]1285-a third pole less as [a servant]1289-a servant than as [an _ entertainer _]1290-an _ entertainer _ . After each round [he]1285-a third pole would turn to [the old lady]1794-the old lady , and swear terrible oaths to the effect that [he]1285-a third pole was [a " Polish gentleman of honour]2571-a " polish gentleman of honour "[1285-a third pole] who would scorn to take a kopeck of [her]1794-the old lady money ; and , though [he]1285-a third pole repeated these oaths so often that at length [she]1794-the old lady grew alarmed , [he]1285-a third pole had [her]1794-the old lady play in hand , and began to win on [her]1794-the old lady behalf ; wherefore , [she]1794-the old lady felt that [she]1794-the old lady could not well get rid of [him]1285-a third pole . An hour later [the two Poles who , earlier in the day]1292-the two poles who , earlier in the day , had been expelled from [the Casino]170-the casino , made a reappearance behind [the old lady]1794-the old lady s chair , and renewed [their]1292-the two poles who , earlier in the day offers of service even if it were only to be sent on messages ; but from [Potapitch]103-potapitch [I]0-edgeways subsequently had it that between [these rascals]1295-these rascals and [the said " gentleman of honour "]2572-the said " gentleman of honour "[2572-the said " gentleman of honour "] there passed a wink , as well as that [the latter]196-the latter put something into [their]1292-the two poles who , earlier in the day hands . Next , since [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had not yet lunched [she]396-the grandmother had scarcely for a moment left [her]396-the grandmother chair one of [the two Poles]1262-the two poles ran to [the restaurant of [the Casino]170-the casino]1299-the restaurant of the casino , and brought [her]396-the grandmother thence a cup of soup , and afterwards some tea . In fact , _ both _ [the Poles]55-the poles hastened to perform [this office]1301-this office . Finally , towards the close of the day , when it was clear that [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother was about to play [her]396-the grandmother last bank - note , there could be seen standing behind [her]396-the grandmother chair no fewer than six natives of [Poland persons who , as yet , had been neither audible nor visible]1303-poland persons who , as yet , had been neither audible nor visible ; and as soon as ever [the old lady]1794-the old lady played the note in question , [they]1292-the two poles who , earlier in the day took no further notice of [her]396-the grandmother , but pushed [their]1292-the two poles who , earlier in the day way past [her]396-the grandmother chair to the table ; seized the money , and staked it shouting and disputing the while , and arguing with [the " gentleman of honour]2573-the " gentleman of honour "[2573-the " gentleman of honour] ( who also had forgotten [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother s existence ) , as though [he]1305-he were [[their]1292-the two poles who , earlier in the day equal]1306-their equal . Even when [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had lost [her]396-the grandmother all , and was returning ( about eight o clock ) to [the hotel]157-the hotel , [some three or four Poles]1309-some three or four poles could not bring [themselves]1309-some three or four poles to leave [her]396-the grandmother , but went on running beside [her]396-the grandmother chair and volubly protesting that [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had cheated [them]1309-some three or four poles , and that [she]396-the grandmother ought to be made to surrender what was not [her]396-the grandmother own . Thus [the party]186-the party arrived at [the hotel]157-the hotel ; whence , presently , [the gang of rascals]1313-the gang of rascals was ejected neck and crop .

According to [Potapitch]103-potapitch s calculations , [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother lost , that day , a total of ninety thousand roubles , in addition to the money which [she]396-the grandmother had lost the day before . Every paper security which [she]396-the grandmother had brought with [her]396-the grandmother five percent bonds , internal loan scrip , and what not [she]396-the grandmother had changed into cash . Also , [I]0-edgeways could not but marvel at the way in which , for seven or eight hours at a stretch , [she]396-the grandmother sat in that chair of [hers]396-the grandmother , almost never leaving the table . Again , [Potapitch]103-potapitch told [me]0-edgeways that there were three occasions on which [she]396-the grandmother really began to win ; but that , led on by false hopes , [she]396-the grandmother was unable to tear [herself]396-the grandmother away at the right moment . [Every gambler]1315-every gambler knows how [a person]1898-a person may sit a day and a night at cards without ever casting a glance to right or to left .

Meanwhile , that day some other very important events were passing in [[our]1317-our hotel]190-our hotel . As early as eleven o clock that is to say , before [the Grandmother]64-the grandmother had quitted [[her]64-the grandmother rooms]1106-her rooms [the General]150-the general and [De Griers]73-de griers decided upon [their]1321-their last stroke . In other words , on learning that [the old lady]1794-the old lady had changed [her]1794-the old lady mind about departing , and was bent on setting out for [the Casino]170-the casino again , [the whole of [[our]1317-our gang]1325-our gang]1324-the whole of our gang ( [Polina]47-polina only excepted ) proceeded en masse to [[her]1794-the old lady rooms]1106-her rooms , for the purpose of finally and frankly treating with [her]1794-the old lady . But [the General]150-the general , quaking and greatly apprehensive as to [his]150-the general possible future , overdid things . After half an hour s prayers and entreaties , coupled with a full confession of [his]150-the general debts , and even of [his]150-the general passion for [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle ( yes , [he]150-the general had quite lost [his]150-the general head ) , [he]150-the general suddenly adopted a tone of menace , and started to rage at [the old lady]1794-the old lady exclaiming that [she]1794-the old lady was sullying [the family]1329-the family honour , that [she]1794-the old lady was making a public scandal of [herself]1794-the old lady , and that [she]1794-the old lady was smirching the fair name of [Russia]2-russia . The upshot was that [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother turned [him]150-the general out of [the room]415-the room with [her]396-the grandmother stick ( it was a real stick , too ! ) . Later in the morning [he]150-the general held several consultations with [De Griers]73-de griers the question which occupied [him]150-the general being : Is it in any way possible to make use of [the police]1274-the police to tell [them]1274-the police that " [this respected , but unfortunate , old lady]2574-this respected , but unfortunate , old lady has gone out of [her]1794-the old lady mind , and is squandering [her]1794-the old lady last kopeck , "[1274-the police] or something of the kind ? In short , is it in any way possible to engineer a species of supervision over , or of restraint upon , [the old lady]1794-the old lady ? [De Griers]73-de griers , however , shrugged [his]73-de griers shoulders at this , and laughed in [the General]150-the general s face , while [the old warrior]1335-the old warrior went on chattering volubly , and running up and down [[his]1335-the old warrior study]1081-his study . Finally [De Griers]73-de griers waved [his]73-de griers hand , and disappeared from view ; and by evening it became known that [he]150-the general had left [the hotel]157-the hotel , after holding a very secret and important conference with [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle . As for [the latter]196-the latter , from early morning [she]50-mlle had taken decisive measures , by completely excluding [the General]150-the general from [her]50-mlle presence , and bestowing upon [him]150-the general not a glance . Indeed , even when [the General]150-the general pursued [her]50-mlle to [the Casino]170-the casino , and met [her]50-mlle walking arm in arm with [the Prince]2145-the prince , [he]150-the general ( [the General]150-the general ) received from [her]50-mlle and [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother not the slightest recognition . Nor did [the Prince]2145-the prince [himself]2145-the prince bow . The rest of the day [Mlle]50-mlle . spent in probing [the Prince]2145-the prince , and trying to make [him]2145-the prince declare [himself]2145-the prince ; but in this [she]50-mlle made a woeful mistake . The little incident occurred in the evening . Suddenly [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle realised that [the Prince]2145-the prince had not even a copper to [his]2145-the prince name , but , on the contrary , was minded to borrow of [her]50-mlle money wherewith to play at roulette . In high displeasure [she]50-mlle drove [him]2145-the prince from [her]50-mlle presence , and shut [herself]50-mlle up in [[her]50-mlle room]1348-her room .

The same morning [I]0-edgeways went to see or , rather , to look for [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , but was unsuccessful in [my]0-edgeways quest . Neither in [[his]2145-the prince rooms]1349-his rooms nor in [the Casino]170-the casino nor in [the Park]171-the park was [he]2145-the prince to be found ; nor did [he]2145-the prince , that day , lunch at [[his]2145-the prince hotel]1068-his hotel as usual . However , at about five o clock [I]0-edgeways caught sight of [him]2145-the prince walking from [the railway station]1353-the railway station to [the H tel d Angleterre]1354-the h tel d angleterre . [He]2145-the prince seemed to be in a great hurry and much preoccupied , though in [his]2145-the prince face [I]0-edgeways could discern no actual traces of worry or perturbation . [He]2145-the prince held out to [me]0-edgeways a friendly hand , with [his]2145-the prince usual ejaculation of " Ah ! "[2145-the prince] but did not check [his]2145-the prince stride . [I]0-edgeways turned and walked beside [him]2145-the prince , but found , somehow , that [his]2145-the prince answers forbade any putting of definite questions . Moreover , [I]0-edgeways felt reluctant to speak to [him]2145-the prince of [Polina]47-polina ; nor , for [his]2145-the prince part , did [he]2145-the prince ask [me]0-edgeways any questions concerning [her]47-polina , although , on [my]0-edgeways telling [him]2145-the prince of [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s exploits , [he]2145-the prince listened attentively and gravely , and then shrugged [his]2145-the prince shoulders .

" [She]47-polina is gambling away everything that [she]47-polina has , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways remarked .

" Indeed ? [She]47-polina arrived at [the Casino]170-the casino even before [I]2145-the prince had taken [my]2145-the prince departure by [train]2203-train , so [I]2145-the prince knew [she]47-polina had been playing . If [I]2145-the prince should have time [I]2145-the prince will go to [the Casino]170-the casino to - night , and take a look at [her]47-polina . The thing interests [me]2145-the prince . "[2145-the prince]

" Where have [you]2145-the prince been today ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways asked surprised at [myself]0-edgeways for having , as yet , omitted to put to [him]2145-the prince that question .

" To [Frankfort]32-frankfort . "[2145-the prince]

" On business ? "[2145-the prince]

" On business . "[2145-the prince]

What more was there to be asked after that ? [I]0-edgeways accompanied [him]2145-the prince until , as [we]1356-we drew level with [the Hotel des Quatre Saisons]1357-the hotel des quatre saisons , [he]2145-the prince suddenly nodded to [me]0-edgeways and disappeared . For [myself]0-edgeways , [I]0-edgeways returned [home]173-home , and came to the conclusion that , even had [I]0-edgeways met [him]2145-the prince at two o clock in the afternoon , [I]0-edgeways should have learnt no more from [him]2145-the prince than [I]0-edgeways had done at five o clock , for the reason that [I]0-edgeways had no definite question to ask . It was bound to have been so . For [me]0-edgeways to formulate the query which [I]0-edgeways really wished to put was a simple impossibility .

[Polina]47-polina spent the whole of that day either in walking about [the park]171-the park with [the nurse]1360-the nurse and [children]1361-children or in sitting in [[her]47-polina own room]1212-her own room . For a long while past [she]47-polina had avoided [the General]150-the general and had scarcely had a word to say to [him]150-the general ( scarcely a word , [I]0-edgeways mean , on any _ serious _ topic ) . Yes , that [I]0-edgeways had noticed . Still , even though [I]0-edgeways was aware of the position in which [the General]150-the general was placed , it had never occurred to [me]0-edgeways that [he]150-the general would have any reason to avoid _ [her]47-polina _ , or to trouble [her]47-polina with family explanations . Indeed , when [I]0-edgeways was returning to [the hotel]157-the hotel after [my]0-edgeways conversation with [Astley]54-mr. astley , and chanced to meet [Polina]47-polina and [the children]168-the children , [I]0-edgeways could see that [her]47-polina face was as calm as though [the family disturbances]1367-the family disturbances had never touched [her]47-polina . To [my]0-edgeways salute [she]47-polina responded with a slight bow , and [I]0-edgeways retired to [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room in a very bad humour .

Of course , since the affair with [the Burmergelms]125-the burmergelms [I]0-edgeways had exchanged not a word with [Polina]47-polina , nor had with [her]47-polina any kind of intercourse . Yet [I]0-edgeways had been at [my]0-edgeways wits end , for , as time went on , there was arising in [me]0-edgeways an ever - seething dissatisfaction . Even if [she]47-polina did not love [me]0-edgeways [she]47-polina ought not to have trampled upon [my]0-edgeways feelings , nor to have accepted [my]0-edgeways confessions with such contempt , seeing that [she]47-polina must have been aware that [I]0-edgeways loved [her]47-polina ( of [her]47-polina own accord [she]47-polina had allowed [me]0-edgeways to tell [her]47-polina as much ) . Of course the situation between [us]1369-us had arisen in a curious manner . About two months ago , [I]0-edgeways had noticed that [she]47-polina had a desire to make [me]0-edgeways [[her]47-polina friend]1370-her friend , [[her]47-polina confidant]1075-her confidant that [she]47-polina was making trial of [me]0-edgeways for the purpose ; but , for some reason or another , the desired result had never come about , and [we]1369-us had fallen into the present strange relations , which had led [me]0-edgeways to address [her]47-polina as [I]0-edgeways had done . At the same time , if [my]0-edgeways love was distasteful to [her]47-polina , why had [she]47-polina not _ forbidden _ [me]0-edgeways to speak of it to [her]47-polina ?

But [she]47-polina had not so forbidden [me]0-edgeways . On the contrary , there had been occasions when [she]47-polina had even _ invited _ [me]0-edgeways to speak . Of course , this might have been done out of sheer wantonness , for [I]0-edgeways well knew [I]0-edgeways had remarked it only too often that , after listening to what [I]0-edgeways had to say , and angering [me]0-edgeways almost beyond endurance , [she]47-polina loved suddenly to torture [me]0-edgeways with some fresh outburst of contempt and aloofness ! Yet [she]47-polina must have known that [I]0-edgeways could not live without [her]47-polina . Three days had elapsed since the affair with [the Baron]1935-the baron , and [I]0-edgeways could bear the severance no longer . When , that afternoon , [I]0-edgeways met [her]47-polina near [the Casino]170-the casino , [my]0-edgeways heart almost made [me]0-edgeways faint , it beat so violently . [She]47-polina too could not live without [me]0-edgeways , for had [she]47-polina not said that [she]47-polina had _ need _ of [me]0-edgeways ? Or had that too been spoken in jest ?

That [she]47-polina had a secret of some kind there could be no doubt . What [she]47-polina had said to [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had stabbed [me]0-edgeways to the heart . On a thousand occasions [I]0-edgeways had challenged [her]47-polina to be open with [me]0-edgeways , nor could [she]47-polina have been ignorant that [I]0-edgeways was ready to give [my]0-edgeways very life for [her]47-polina . Yet always [she]47-polina had kept [me]0-edgeways at a distance with that contemptuous air of [hers]47-polina ; or else [she]47-polina had demanded of [me]0-edgeways , in lieu of the life which [I]0-edgeways offered to lay at [her]47-polina feet , such escapades as [I]0-edgeways had perpetrated with [the Baron]1935-the baron . Ah , was it not torture to [me]0-edgeways , all this ? For could it be that [her]47-polina whole world was bound up with [the Frenchman]180-the frenchman ? What , too , about [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley ? The affair was inexplicable throughout . [My]0-edgeways God , what distress it caused [me]0-edgeways !

Arrived [home]173-home , [I]0-edgeways , in a fit of frenzy , indited the following :

" [Polina Alexandrovna]47-polina , [I]0-edgeways can see that there is approaching [us]2578-us an exposure which will involve [you]47-polina too . For the last time [I]0-edgeways ask of [you]47-polina have [you]47-polina , or have [you]47-polina not , any need of [my]0-edgeways life ? If [you]47-polina have , then make such dispositions as [you]47-polina wish , and [I]0-edgeways shall always be discoverable in [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room if required . If [you]47-polina have need of [my]0-edgeways life , write or send for [me]0-edgeways . "[0-edgeways]

[I]0-edgeways sealed the letter , and dispatched it by the hand of [a corridor lacquey]1378-a corridor lacquey , with orders to hand it to [the addressee in person]1379-the addressee in person . Though [I]0-edgeways expected no answer , scarcely three minutes had elapsed before the lacquey returned with " the compliments of [a certain person]2076-a certain person . "[1378-a corridor lacquey]

Next , about seven o clock , [I]0-edgeways was sent for by [the General]150-the general . [I]0-edgeways found [him]150-the general in [[his]150-the general study]1081-his study , apparently preparing to go out again , for [his]150-the general hat and stick were lying on the sofa . When [I]0-edgeways entered [he]150-the general was standing in the middle of [the room]415-the room [his]150-the general feet wide apart , and [his]150-the general head bent down . Also , [he]150-the general appeared to be talking to [himself]150-the general . But as soon as ever [he]150-the general saw [me]0-edgeways at the door [he]150-the general came towards [me]0-edgeways in such a curious manner that involuntarily [I]0-edgeways retreated a step , and was for leaving [the room]415-the room ; whereupon [he]150-the general seized [me]0-edgeways by both hands , and , drawing [me]0-edgeways towards the sofa , and seating [himself]150-the general thereon , [he]150-the general forced [me]0-edgeways to sit down on a chair opposite [him]150-the general . Then , without letting go of [my]0-edgeways hands , [he]150-the general exclaimed with quivering lips and a sparkle of tears on [his]150-the general eyelashes :

" Oh , [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch ! Save [me]150-the general , save [me]150-the general ! Have some mercy upon [me]150-the general ! "[150-the general]

For a long time [I]0-edgeways could not make out what [he]150-the general meant , although [he]150-the general kept talking and talking , and constantly repeating to [himself]150-the general , " Have mercy , mercy ! "[150-the general] At length , however , [I]0-edgeways divined that [he]150-the general was expecting [me]0-edgeways to give [him]150-the general something in the nature of advice or , rather , that , deserted by [every one]212-every one , and overwhelmed with grief and apprehension , [he]150-the general had bethought [himself]150-the general of [my]0-edgeways existence , and sent for [me]0-edgeways to relieve [his]150-the general feelings by talking and talking and talking .

In fact , [he]150-the general was in such a confused and despondent state of mind that , clasping [his]150-the general hands together , [he]150-the general actually went down upon [his]150-the general knees and begged [me]0-edgeways to go to [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle , and beseech and advise [her]50-mlle to return to [him]150-the general , and to accept [him]150-the general in marriage .

" But , [General]1842-general , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways exclaimed , " possibly [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle has scarcely even remarked [my]0-edgeways existence ? What could [_]2582-_ [I]0-edgeways _ do with [her]396-the grandmother ? "[0-edgeways]

It was in vain that [I]0-edgeways protested , for [he]150-the general could understand nothing that was said to [him]150-the general , Next [he]150-the general started talking about [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother , but always in a disconnected sort of fashion [his]150-the general one thought being to send for [the police]1274-the police .

" In [Russia]2-russia , "[150-the general] said [he]150-the general , suddenly boiling over with indignation , " or in [any well - ordered State where there exists [a government]2584-a government]2583-any well - ordered state where there exists a government , [old women]2585-old women like [[my]150-the general mother]1845-my mother are placed under proper guardianship . Yes , [[my]150-the general good sir]1942-my good sir , "[150-the general] [he]150-the general went on , relapsing into a scolding tone as [he]150-the general leapt to [his]150-the general feet and started to pace [the room]415-the room , " do [you]1942-my good sir not know this "[150-the general] ( [he]150-the general seemed to be addressing [some imaginary auditor in the corner]1388-some imaginary auditor in the corner ) " do [you]1942-my good sir not know this , that in [[Russia]2-russia [old women]2585-old women like [her]396-the grandmother]2588-russia old women like her are subjected to restraint , [the devil]2177-the devil take [them]2585-old women ? "[150-the general] Again [he]150-the general threw [himself]150-the general down upon the sofa .

A minute later , though sobbing and almost breathless , [he]150-the general managed to gasp out that [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle had refused to marry [him]150-the general , for the reason that [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had turned up in place of a telegram , and it was therefore clear that [he]150-the general had no inheritance to look for . Evidently , [he]150-the general supposed that [I]0-edgeways had hitherto been in entire ignorance of all this . Again , when [I]0-edgeways referred to [De Griers]73-de griers , [the General]150-the general made a gesture of despair . " [He]73-de griers has gone away , "[150-the general] [he]150-the general said , " and everything which [I]150-the general possess is mortgaged to [him]73-de griers . [I]150-the general stand stripped to [my]150-the general skin . Even of the money which [you]0-edgeways brought [me]150-the general from [Paris]9-paris , [I]150-the general know not if seven hundred francs be left . Of course that sum will do to go on with , but , as regards the future , [I]150-the general know nothing , [I]150-the general know nothing . "[150-the general]

" Then how will [you]150-the general pay [your]150-the general hotel bill ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways cried in consternation . " And what shall [you]150-the general do afterwards ? "[0-edgeways]

[He]150-the general looked at [me]0-edgeways vaguely , but it was clear that [he]150-the general had not understood perhaps had not even heard [my]0-edgeways questions . Then [I]0-edgeways tried to get [him]150-the general to speak of [Polina]47-polina and [the children]168-the children , but [he]150-the general only returned brief answers of " Yes , yes , "[150-the general] and again started to maunder about [the Prince]2145-the prince , and the likelihood of [the latter]196-the latter marrying [Mlle . Blanche]50-mlle . " What on earth am [I]150-the general to do ? "[150-the general] [he]150-the general concluded . " What on earth am [I]150-the general to do ? Is this not ingratitude ? Is it not sheer ingratitude ? "[150-the general] And [he]150-the general burst into tears .

Nothing could be done with [such a man]1394-such a man . Yet to leave [him]150-the general alone was dangerous , for something might happen to [him]150-the general . [I]0-edgeways withdrew from [[his]150-the general rooms]1349-his rooms for a little while , but warned [the nursemaid]738-the nursemaid to keep an eye upon [him]150-the general , as well as exchanged a word with the corridor lacquey ( [a very talkative fellow ) , who likewise promised to remain on the look - out]1397-a very talkative fellow ) , who likewise promised to remain on the look - out .

Hardly had [I]0-edgeways left [the General]150-the general , when [Potapitch]103-potapitch approached [me]0-edgeways with a summons from [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother . It was now eight o clock , and [she]396-the grandmother had returned from [the Casino]170-the casino after finally losing all that [she]396-the grandmother possessed . [I]0-edgeways found [her]396-the grandmother sitting in [her]396-the grandmother chair much distressed and evidently fatigued . [Presently Martha]103-potapitch brought [her]396-the grandmother up a cup of tea and forced [her]396-the grandmother to drink it ; yet , even then [I]0-edgeways could detect in [the old lady]1794-the old lady s tone and manner a great change .

" Good evening , [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch , "[396-the grandmother] [she]396-the grandmother said slowly , with [her]396-the grandmother head drooping . " Pardon [me]396-the grandmother for disturbing [you]87-alexis ivanovitch again . Yes , [you]87-alexis ivanovitch must pardon [an old , old woman like [myself]396-the grandmother]2591-an old , old woman like myself , for [I]396-the grandmother have left behind [me]396-the grandmother all that [I]396-the grandmother possess nearly a hundred thousand roubles ! [You]87-alexis ivanovitch did quite right in declining to come with [me]396-the grandmother this evening . Now [I]396-the grandmother am without money without a single groat . But [I]396-the grandmother must not delay a moment ; [I]396-the grandmother must leave by [the 9:30 train]2592-the 9:30 train . [I]396-the grandmother have sent for [that English friend of yours]2593-that english friend of yours , and am going to beg of [him]2593-that english friend of yours three thousand francs for a week . Please try and persuade [him]2593-that english friend of yours to think nothing of it , nor yet to refuse [me]396-the grandmother , for [I]396-the grandmother am still [a rich woman who possesses [three villages]2595-three villages and [a couple of mansions]2596-a couple of mansions]2594-a rich woman who possesses three villages and a couple of mansions . Yes , the money shall be found , for [I]396-the grandmother have not yet squandered _ everything _ . [I]396-the grandmother tell [you]2597-you this in order that [he]2593-that english friend of yours may have no doubts about Ah , but here [he]2593-that english friend of yours is ! Clearly [he]2593-that english friend of yours is [a good fellow]2094-a good fellow . "[396-the grandmother]

True enough , [Astley]54-mr. astley had come hot - foot on receiving [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother s appeal . Scarcely stopping even to reflect , and with scarcely a word , [he]54-mr. astley counted out the three thousand francs under a note of hand which [she]396-the grandmother duly signed . Then , [his]54-mr. astley business done , [he]54-mr. astley bowed , and lost no time in taking [his]54-mr. astley departure .

" [You]2597-you too leave [me]396-the grandmother , [Alexis Ivanovitch]87-alexis ivanovitch , "[396-the grandmother] said [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother . " All [my]396-the grandmother bones are aching , and [I]396-the grandmother still have an hour in which to rest . Do not be hard upon [me]396-the grandmother , [old fool]2599-old fool that [I]396-the grandmother am . Never again shall [I]396-the grandmother blame [young people]2600-young people for being frivolous . [I]396-the grandmother should think it wrong even to blame [that unhappy General of [yours]2597-you]2601-that unhappy general of yours . Nevertheless , [I]396-the grandmother do not mean to let [him]2601-that unhappy general of yours have any of [my]396-the grandmother money ( which is all that [he]2601-that unhappy general of yours desires ) , for the reason that [I]396-the grandmother look upon [him]2601-that unhappy general of yours as [a perfect blockhead]2602-a perfect blockhead , and consider [myself]396-the grandmother , simpleton though [I]396-the grandmother be , at least wiser than _ [he]2601-that unhappy general of yours _ is . How surely does [God]82-god visit old age , and punish [it]2603-it for its presumption ! Well , good - bye . [Martha]103-potapitch , come and lift [me]396-the grandmother up . "[396-the grandmother]

However , [I]0-edgeways had a mind to see [the old lady]1794-the old lady off ; and , moreover , [I]0-edgeways was in an expectant frame of mind somehow [I]0-edgeways kept thinking that _ something _ was going to happen ; wherefore , [I]0-edgeways could not rest quietly in [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room , but stepped out into [the corridor]1227-the corridor , and then into [the Chestnut Avenue]29-the chestnut avenue for a few minutes stroll . [My]0-edgeways letter to [Polina]47-polina had been clear and firm , and in the present crisis , [I]0-edgeways felt sure , would prove final . [I]0-edgeways had heard of [De Griers]73-de griers departure , and , however much [Polina]47-polina might reject [me]0-edgeways as [a _ friend]1407-a _ friend _ , [she]47-polina might not reject [me]0-edgeways altogether as [a _ servant _]1408-a _ servant _ . [She]47-polina would need [me]0-edgeways to fetch and carry for [her]47-polina , and [I]0-edgeways was ready to do so . How could it have been otherwise ?

Towards the hour of [the train]251-the train s departure [I]0-edgeways hastened to [the station]1410-the station , and put [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother into [[her]396-the grandmother compartment]1412-her compartment [she]396-the grandmother and [[her]396-the grandmother party]1413-her party occupying [a reserved family saloon]1414-a reserved family saloon .

"[396-the grandmother]

Then [I]0-edgeways returned [home]173-home . " There is nothing new to report , [sir]1968-sir , "[738-the nursemaid] [she]738-the nursemaid replied quietly . Nevertheless [I]0-edgeways decided to enter , and was just doing so when [I]0-edgeways halted thunderstruck on the threshold . For before [me]0-edgeways [I]0-edgeways beheld [the General]150-the general and [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle laughing gaily at [one another]435-one another ! while beside [them]1422-them , on the sofa , there was seated [[her]50-mlle mother]187-her mother . Clearly [the General]150-the general was almost out of [his]150-the general mind with joy , for [he]150-the general was talking all sorts of nonsense , and bubbling over with a long - drawn , nervous laugh a laugh which twisted [his]150-the general face into innumerable wrinkles , and caused [his]150-the general eyes almost to disappear .

Afterwards [I]0-edgeways learnt from [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]1425-blanche [herself]1425-blanche that , after dismissing [the Prince]2145-the prince and hearing of [the General]150-the general s tears , [she]1425-blanche bethought [her]1425-blanche of going to comfort [the old man]1891-the old man , and had just arrived for the purpose when [I]0-edgeways entered . Fortunately , [the poor General]377-the poor general did not know that [his]377-the poor general fate had been decided that [Mlle]50-mlle . had long ago packed [her]50-mlle trunks in readiness for [the first morning train]1430-the first morning train to [Paris]9-paris !

Hesitating a moment on the threshold [I]0-edgeways changed [my]0-edgeways mind as to entering , and departed unnoticed . Ascending to [[my]0-edgeways own room]335-my own room , and opening the door , [I]0-edgeways perceived in the semi - darkness a figure seated on a chair in the corner by the window . [The figure]1432-the figure did not rise when [I]0-edgeways entered , so [I]0-edgeways approached [it]1432-the figure swiftly , peered at [it]1432-the figure closely , and felt [my]0-edgeways heart almost stop beating . [The figure]1432-the figure was [Polina]47-polina !

[XIV]126-xiv

The shock made [me]0-edgeways utter an exclamation .

" What is the matter ? What is the matter ? "[1432-the figure] [she]1432-the figure asked in a strange voice . [She]1432-the figure was looking pale , and [her]1432-the figure eyes were dim .

" What is the matter ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways re - echoed . " Why , the fact that [you]0-edgeways are _ here ! _ "[0-edgeways]

" If [I]1432-the figure am here , [I]1432-the figure have come with all that [I]1432-the figure have to bring , "[1432-the figure] [she]1432-the figure said . " Such has always been [my]1432-the figure way , as [you]0-edgeways shall presently see . Please light a candle . "[1432-the figure]

[I]0-edgeways did so ; whereupon [she]1432-the figure rose , approached the table , and laid upon it an open letter .

" Read it , "[1432-the figure] [she]1432-the figure added .

" It is [De Griers]73-de griers handwriting ! "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways cried as [I]0-edgeways seized the document . [My]0-edgeways hands were so tremulous that the lines on the pages danced before [my]0-edgeways eyes . Although , at this distance of time , [I]0-edgeways have forgotten the exact phraseology of the missive , [I]0-edgeways append , if not the precise words , at all events the general sense .

" [Mademoiselle]68-mademoiselle , "[1434-i] the document ran , " certain untoward circumstances compel [me]1434-i to depart in haste . Of course , [you]0-edgeways have of [yourself]0-edgeways remarked that hitherto [I]1434-i have always refrained from having any final explanation with [you]0-edgeways , for the reason that [I]1434-i could not well state the whole circumstances ; and now to [my]1434-i difficulties the advent of [the aged Grandmother]2605-the aged grandmother , coupled with [her]2605-the aged grandmother subsequent proceedings , has put the final touch . Also , the involved state of [my]1434-i affairs forbids [me]1434-i to write with any finality concerning those hopes of ultimate bliss upon which , for a long while past , [I]1434-i have permitted [myself]1434-i to feed . [I]1434-i regret the past , but at the same time hope that in [my]1434-i conduct [you]0-edgeways have never been able to detect anything that was unworthy of [a gentleman]290-a gentleman and [a man of honour]1805-a man of honour . Having lost , however , almost the whole of [my]1434-i money in debts incurred by [[your]0-edgeways stepfather]2608-your stepfather , [I]1434-i find [myself]1434-i driven to the necessity of saving the remainder ; wherefore , [I]1434-i have instructed [certain friends of [mine]1434-i in [St. Petersburg]14-st. petersburg]2609-certain friends of mine in st. petersburg to arrange for the sale of all the property which has been mortgaged to [myself]1434-i . At the same time , knowing that , in addition , [[your]0-edgeways frivolous stepfather]2610-your frivolous stepfather has squandered money which is exclusively [yours]0-edgeways , [I]1434-i have decided to absolve [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather from a certain moiety of the mortgages on [[his]2610-your frivolous stepfather property]1885-his property , in order that [you]0-edgeways may be in a position to recover of [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather what [you]0-edgeways have lost , by suing [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather in legal fashion . [I]1434-i trust , therefore , that , as matters now stand , this action of [mine]1434-i may bring [you]0-edgeways some advantage . [I]1434-i trust also that this same action leaves [me]1434-i in the position of having fulfilled every obligation which is incumbent upon [a man of honour and refinement]2612-a man of honour and refinement . Rest assured that [your]0-edgeways memory will for ever remain graven in [my]1434-i heart . "[1434-i]

" All this is clear enough , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways commented . " Surely [you]1434-i did not expect aught else from [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather ? "[0-edgeways] Somehow [I]0-edgeways was feeling annoyed .

" [I]1434-i expected nothing at all from [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather , "[1434-i] [she]1434-i replied quietly enough , to all outward seeming , yet with a note of irritation in [her]1434-i tone . " Long ago [I]1434-i made up [my]1434-i mind on the subject , for [I]1434-i could read [his]2610-your frivolous stepfather thoughts , and knew what [he]2610-your frivolous stepfather was thinking . [He]2610-your frivolous stepfather thought that possibly [I]1434-i should sue [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather that one day [I]1434-i might become [a nuisance]2613-a nuisance . "[1434-i] [Here Polina]47-polina halted for a moment , and stood biting [her]1434-i lips . " So of set purpose [I]47-polina redoubled [my]47-polina contemptuous treatment of [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather , and waited to see what [he]2610-your frivolous stepfather would do . If a telegram to say that [we]2614-we had become [legatees]2615-legatees had arrived from , [St. Petersburg]14-st. petersburg , [I]47-polina should have flung at [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather a quittance for [my]47-polina foolish stepfather s debts , and then dismissed [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather . For a long time [I]47-polina have hated [him]2610-your frivolous stepfather . Even in earlier days [he]2610-your frivolous stepfather was not [a man]259-a man ; and now ! Oh , how gladly [I]47-polina could throw those fifty thousand roubles in [his]2610-your frivolous stepfather face , and spit in it , and then rub the spittle in ! "[47-polina]

" But the document returning the fifty - thousand rouble mortgage has [the General]150-the general got it ? If so , possess [yourself]0-edgeways of it , and send it to [De Griers]73-de griers . "[0-edgeways]

" No , no ; [the General]150-the general has not got it . "[47-polina]

" Just as [I]0-edgeways expected ! Well , what is [the General]150-the general going to do ? "[0-edgeways] Then an idea suddenly occurred to [me]0-edgeways . " What about [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways asked .

[Polina]47-polina looked at [me]0-edgeways with impatience and bewilderment .

" What makes [you]0-edgeways speak of _ [her]396-the grandmother ? _ "[47-polina] was [her]47-polina irritable inquiry . " [I]47-polina can not go and live with [her]396-the grandmother . " Why should [you]47-polina ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways cried . " Yet to think that [you]47-polina should have loved [De Griers]73-de griers !
