" [In [Frankfort]32-frankfort , where [he]73-de griers will be staying for the next three days]2623-in frankfort , where he will be staying for the next three days . "[47-polina]

" Well , bid [me]0-edgeways do so , and [I]0-edgeways will go to [him]73-de griers by [the first train]2624-the first train tomorrow , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways exclaimed with enthusiasm .

[She]47-polina smiled .

" If [you]0-edgeways were to do that , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina said , " [he]73-de griers would merely tell [you]0-edgeways to be so good as first to return [him]73-de griers the fifty thousand francs . What , then , would be the use of having a quarrel with [him]73-de griers ? [You]0-edgeways talk sheer nonsense . "[47-polina]

[I]0-edgeways ground [my]0-edgeways teeth .

" The question , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways went on , " is how to raise the fifty thousand francs . [We]2625-we can not expect to find them lying about on the floor . Listen . What of [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley ? "[0-edgeways] Even as [I]0-edgeways spoke a new and strange idea formed itself in [my]0-edgeways brain .

[Her]47-polina eyes flashed fire .

" What ? _ [you]0-edgeways [yourself]0-edgeways _ wish [me]47-polina to leave [you]0-edgeways for [him]54-mr. astley ? "[47-polina] [she]47-polina cried with a scornful look and a proud smile . Never before had [she]47-polina addressed [me]0-edgeways thus .

Then [her]47-polina head must have turned dizzy with emotion , for suddenly [she]47-polina seated [herself]47-polina upon the sofa , as though [she]47-polina were powerless any longer to stand .

A flash of lightning seemed to strike [me]0-edgeways as [I]0-edgeways stood there . [I]0-edgeways could scarcely believe [my]0-edgeways eyes or [my]0-edgeways ears . [She]47-polina _ did _ love [me]0-edgeways , then ! It _ was _ to [me]0-edgeways , and not to [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , that [she]47-polina had turned ! Although [she]47-polina , [an unprotected girl]1435-an unprotected girl , had come to [me]0-edgeways in [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room in [an hotel room]1437-an hotel room and had probably compromised [herself]47-polina thereby , [I]0-edgeways had not understood !

Then a second mad idea flashed into [my]0-edgeways brain .

" [Polina]47-polina , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said , " give [me]0-edgeways but an hour . Wait [here]1772-here just one hour until [I]0-edgeways return . Yes , [you]47-polina MUST do so . Do [you]47-polina not see what [I]0-edgeways mean ? Just stay [here]1772-here for that time . "[0-edgeways]

And [I]0-edgeways rushed from [the room]415-the room without so much as answering [her]47-polina look of inquiry . [She]47-polina called something after [me]0-edgeways , but [I]0-edgeways did not return .

Sometimes it happens that the most insane thought , the most impossible conception , will become so fixed in one s head that at length [one]1733-one believes the thought or the conception to be reality . Moreover , if with the thought or the conception there is combined a strong , a passionate , desire , one will come to look upon the said thought or conception as something fated , inevitable , and foreordained something bound to happen . Whether by this there is connoted something in the nature of a combination of presentiments , or a great effort of will , or a self - annulment of one s true expectations , and so on , [I]0-edgeways do not know ; but , at all events that night saw happen to [me]0-edgeways ( a night which [I]0-edgeways shall never forget ) something in the nature of the miraculous . Although the occurrence can easily be explained by arithmetic , [I]0-edgeways still believe it to have been a miracle . Yet why did this conviction take such a hold upon [me]0-edgeways at the time , and remain with [me]0-edgeways ever since ? Previously , [I]0-edgeways had thought of the idea , not as an occurrence which was ever likely to come about , but as something which _ never _ could come about .

The time was a quarter past eleven o clock when [I]0-edgeways entered [the Casino]170-the casino in such a state of hope ( though , at the same time , of agitation ) as [I]0-edgeways had never before experienced . In [the gaming - rooms]273-the gaming - rooms there were still [a large number of people]1442-a large number of people , but [not half as many as had been present in the morning]1443-not half as many as had been present in the morning .

At eleven o clock there usually remained behind only [the real]1444-the real , [the desperate gamblers persons for whom , at spas , there existed nothing beyond roulette , and who went thither for that alone]1445-the desperate gamblers persons for whom , at spas , there existed nothing beyond roulette , and who went thither for that alone . [These gamesters]1446-these gamesters took little note of what was going on around [them]1446-these gamesters , and were interested in none of the appurtenances of the season , but played from morning till night , and would have been ready to play through the night until dawn had that been possible . As it was , [they]1446-these gamesters used to disperse unwillingly when , at midnight , roulette came to an end . Likewise , as soon as ever roulette was drawing to a close and [the head croupier]1261-the head croupier had called " [Les trois derniers coups]2628-les trois derniers coups , "[1261-the head croupier] [most of [them]1446-these gamesters]1448-most of them were ready to stake on the last three rounds all that [they]1446-these gamesters had in [their]1446-these gamesters pockets and , for the most part , lost it . For [my]0-edgeways own part [I]0-edgeways proceeded towards the table at which [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother had lately sat ; and , since the crowd around [it]1450-it was not very large , [I]0-edgeways soon obtained standing room among [the ring of [gamblers]439-gamblers]1451-the ring of gamblers , while directly in front of [me]0-edgeways , on the green cloth , [I]0-edgeways saw marked the word " Passe . "[0-edgeways]

" Passe "[0-edgeways] was a row of numbers from 19 to 36 inclusive ; while a row of numbers from 1 to 18 inclusive was known as " Manque . "[0-edgeways] But what had that to do with [me]0-edgeways ? [I]0-edgeways had not noticed [I]0-edgeways had not so much as heard the numbers upon which the previous coup had fallen , and so took no bearings when [I]0-edgeways began to play , as , in [my]0-edgeways place , [any _ systematic _ gambler]1453-any _ systematic _ gambler would have done . No , [I]0-edgeways merely extended [my]0-edgeways stock of twenty ten - g lden pieces , and threw them down upon the space " Passe "[329-the croupier] which happened to be confronting [me]0-edgeways .

" Vingt - deux ! "[329-the croupier] called [the croupier]329-the croupier .

[I]0-edgeways had won ! [I]0-edgeways staked upon the same again both [my]0-edgeways original stake and [my]0-edgeways winnings .

" Trente - et - un ! "[329-the croupier] called [the croupier]329-the croupier .

Again [I]0-edgeways had won , and was now in possession of eighty ten - g lden pieces . Next , [I]0-edgeways moved the whole eighty on to twelve middle numbers ( a stake which , if successful , would bring [me]0-edgeways in a triple profit , but also involved a risk of two chances to one ) . The wheel revolved , and stopped at twenty - four . Upon this [I]0-edgeways was paid out notes and gold until [I]0-edgeways had by [my]0-edgeways side a total sum of two thousand g lden .

It was as in a fever that [I]0-edgeways moved the pile , en bloc , on to the red . Then suddenly [I]0-edgeways came to [myself]0-edgeways ( though that was the only time during the evening s play when fear cast its cold spell over [me]0-edgeways , and showed itself in a trembling of the hands and knees ) . For with horror [I]0-edgeways had realised that [I]0-edgeways _ must _ win , and that upon that stake there depended all [my]0-edgeways life .

" [Rouge]127-rouge ! "[329-the croupier] called [the croupier]329-the croupier . [I]0-edgeways drew a long breath , and hot shivers went coursing over [my]0-edgeways body . [I]0-edgeways was paid out [my]0-edgeways winnings in bank - notes amounting , of course , to a total of four thousand florins , eight hundred g lden ( [I]0-edgeways could still calculate the amounts ) .

After that , [I]0-edgeways remember , [I]0-edgeways again staked two thousand florins upon twelve middle numbers , and lost . Again [I]0-edgeways staked the whole of [my]0-edgeways gold , with eight hundred g lden , in notes , and lost . Then madness seemed to come upon [me]0-edgeways , and seizing [my]0-edgeways last two thousand florins , [I]0-edgeways staked them upon twelve of the first numbers wholly by chance , and at random , and without any sort of reckoning . Upon [my]0-edgeways doing so there followed a moment of suspense only comparable to that which [Madame Blanchard]128-madame blanchard must have experienced when , in [Paris]9-paris , [she]128-madame blanchard was descending earthwards from a balloon .

" Quatre ! "[329-the croupier] called [the croupier]329-the croupier .

Once more , with the addition of [my]0-edgeways original stake , [I]0-edgeways was in possession of six thousand florins ! Once more [I]0-edgeways looked around [me]0-edgeways like [a conqueror]1458-a conqueror once more [I]0-edgeways feared nothing as [I]0-edgeways threw down four thousand of these florins upon the black . [The croupiers]910-the croupiers glanced around [them]910-the croupiers , and exchanged a few words ; [the bystanders]496-the bystanders murmured expectantly .

The black turned up . After that [I]0-edgeways do not exactly remember either [my]0-edgeways calculations or the order of [my]0-edgeways stakings . [I]0-edgeways only remember that , as in a dream , [I]0-edgeways won in one round sixteen thousand florins ; that in the three following rounds , [I]0-edgeways lost twelve thousand ; that [I]0-edgeways moved the remainder ( four thousand ) on to " Passe "[0-edgeways] ( though quite unconscious of what [I]0-edgeways was doing [I]0-edgeways was merely waiting , as it were , mechanically , and without reflection , for something ) and won ; and that , finally , four times in succession [I]0-edgeways lost . Yes , [I]0-edgeways can remember raking in money by thousands but most frequently on the twelve , middle numbers , to which [I]0-edgeways constantly adhered , and which kept appearing in a sort of regular order first , three or four times running , and then , after an interval of a couple of rounds , in another break of three or four appearances . Sometimes , this astonishing regularity manifested itself in patches ; a thing to upset all the calculations of note taking [gamblers who play with a pencil and a memorandum]1461-gamblers who play with a pencil and a memorandum - book in [their]1461-gamblers who play with a pencil and a memorandum hands [Fortune]129-fortune perpetrates some terrible jests at roulette !

Since [my]0-edgeways entry not more than half an hour could have elapsed . Suddenly [a croupier]1462-a croupier informed [me]0-edgeways that [I]0-edgeways had , won thirty thousand florins , as well as that , since the latter was the limit for which , at any one time , [the bank]294-the bank could make itself responsible , roulette at that table must close for the night . Accordingly , [I]0-edgeways caught up [my]0-edgeways pile of gold , stuffed it into [my]0-edgeways pocket , and , grasping [my]0-edgeways sheaf of bank - notes , moved to the table in [an adjoining salon]1464-an adjoining salon where a second game of roulette was in progress . [The crowd]274-the crowd followed [me]0-edgeways in a body , and cleared a place for [me]0-edgeways at the table ; after which , [I]0-edgeways proceeded to stake as before that is to say , at random and without calculating . What saved [me]0-edgeways from ruin [I]0-edgeways do not know .

Of course there were times when fragmentary reckonings _ did _ come flashing into [my]0-edgeways brain . For instance , there were times when [I]0-edgeways attached [myself]0-edgeways for a while to certain figures and coups though always leaving [them]1466-them , again before long , without knowing what [I]0-edgeways was doing .

In fact , [I]0-edgeways can not have been in possession of all [my]0-edgeways faculties , for [I]0-edgeways can remember [the croupiers]910-the croupiers correcting [my]0-edgeways play more than once , owing to [my]0-edgeways having made mistakes of the gravest order . [My]0-edgeways brows were damp with sweat , and [my]0-edgeways hands were shaking . Also , [Poles]55-the poles came around [me]0-edgeways to proffer [their]55-the poles services , but [I]0-edgeways heeded none of them . Nor did [my]0-edgeways luck fail [me]0-edgeways now . Suddenly , there arose around [me]0-edgeways a loud din of talking and laughter . " Bravo , bravo ! "[150-the general] was [the general]150-the general shout , and [some people]1469-some people even clapped [their]1469-some people hands . [I]0-edgeways had raked in thirty thousand florins , and again [the bank]294-the bank had had to close for the night !

" Go away now , go away now , "[1471-the person who had spoken to me] a voice whispered to [me]0-edgeways on [my]0-edgeways right . [The person who had spoken to [me]0-edgeways]1471-the person who had spoken to me was [a certain Jew of Frankfurt [a man who had been standing beside [me]0-edgeways the whole while , and occasionally helping [me]0-edgeways in [my]0-edgeways play]1473-a man who had been standing beside me the whole while , and occasionally helping me in my play]1472-a certain jew of frankfurt a man who had been standing beside me the whole while , and occasionally helping me in my play .

" Yes , for God s sake go , "[1474-the second voice] whispered a second voice in [my]0-edgeways left ear . Glancing around , [I]0-edgeways perceived that [the second voice]1474-the second voice had come from [a modestly , plainly dressed lady of rather less than thirty a woman whose face , though pale and sickly - looking , bore also very evident traces of former beauty]1475-a modestly , plainly dressed lady of rather less than thirty a woman whose face , though pale and sickly - looking , bore also very evident traces of former beauty . At the moment , [I]0-edgeways was stuffing the crumpled bank - notes into [my]0-edgeways pockets and collecting all the gold that was left on the table . Seizing up [my]0-edgeways last note for five hundred g lden , [I]0-edgeways contrived to insinuate it , unperceived , into the hand of [the pale lady]1476-the pale lady . An overpowering impulse had made [me]0-edgeways do so , and [I]0-edgeways remember how [her]1476-the pale lady thin little fingers pressed [mine]0-edgeways in token of [her]1476-the pale lady lively gratitude . The whole affair was the work of a moment .

Then , collecting [my]0-edgeways belongings , [I]0-edgeways crossed to where trente et quarante was being played a game which could boast of [a more aristocratic public]1477-a more aristocratic public , and was played with cards instead of with a wheel . At this diversion [the bank]294-the bank made itself responsible for a hundred thousand thalers as the limit , but the highest stake allowable was , as in roulette , four thousand florins . Although [I]0-edgeways knew nothing of the game and [I]0-edgeways scarcely knew the stakes , except those on black and red [I]0-edgeways joined the ring of [players]1119-players , while the rest of [the crowd]274-the crowd massed itself around [me]0-edgeways . At this distance of time [I]0-edgeways can not remember whether [I]0-edgeways ever gave a thought to [Polina]47-polina ; [I]0-edgeways seemed only to be conscious of a vague pleasure in seizing and raking in the bank - notes which kept massing themselves in a pile before [me]0-edgeways .

But , as ever , fortune seemed to be at [my]0-edgeways back . As though of set purpose , there came to [my]0-edgeways aid a circumstance which not infrequently repeats itself in gaming . The circumstance is that not infrequently luck attaches itself to , say , the red , and does not leave it for a space of say , ten , or even fifteen , rounds in succession . Three days ago [I]0-edgeways had heard that , during the previous week there had been a run of twenty - two coups on the red an occurrence never before known at roulette so that [men]281-men spoke of it with astonishment . Naturally enough , [many]1482-many deserted the red after a dozen rounds , and practically [no one]2107-no one could now be found to stake upon it . Yet upon the black also the antithesis of the red [no experienced gambler]1484-no experienced gambler would stake anything , for the reason that [every practised player]1485-every practised player knows the meaning of " capricious fortune . "[1485-every practised player] That is to say , after the sixteenth ( or so ) success of the red , one would think that the seventeenth coup would inevitably fall upon the black ; wherefore , [novices]1486-novices would be apt to back the latter in the seventeenth round , and even to double or treble [their]1486-novices stakes upon it only , in the end , to lose .

Yet some whim or other led [me]0-edgeways , on remarking that the red had come up consecutively for seven times , to attach [myself]0-edgeways to that colour . Probably this was mostly due to self - conceit , for [I]0-edgeways wanted to astonish [the bystanders]496-the bystanders with the riskiness of [my]0-edgeways play . Also , [I]0-edgeways remember that oh , strange sensation ! [I]0-edgeways suddenly , and without any challenge from [my]0-edgeways own presumption , became obsessed with a _ desire _ to take risks . If the spirit has passed through a great many sensations , possibly it can no longer be sated with them , but grows more excited , and demands more sensations , and stronger and stronger ones , until at length it falls exhausted . Certainly , if the rules of the game had permitted even of [my]0-edgeways staking fifty thousand florins at a time , [I]0-edgeways should have staked them . All of a sudden [I]0-edgeways heard exclamations arising that the whole thing was a marvel , since the red was turning up for the fourteenth time !

" Monsieur a gagn cent mille florins , "[0-edgeways] a voice exclaimed beside [me]0-edgeways .

[I]0-edgeways awoke to [my]0-edgeways senses . What ? [I]0-edgeways had won a hundred thousand florins ? If so , what more did [I]0-edgeways need to win ? [I]0-edgeways grasped the banknotes , stuffed them into [my]0-edgeways pockets , raked in the gold without counting it , and started to leave [the Casino]170-the casino . As [I]0-edgeways passed through [the salons]1489-the salons [people]531-people smiled to see [my]0-edgeways bulging pockets and unsteady gait , for the weight which [I]0-edgeways was carrying must have amounted to half a pood ! Several hands [I]0-edgeways saw stretched out in [my]0-edgeways direction , and as [I]0-edgeways passed [I]0-edgeways filled them with all the money that [I]0-edgeways could grasp in [my]0-edgeways own . At length [two Jews]1491-two jews stopped [me]0-edgeways near the exit .

" [You]0-edgeways are [a bold young fellow]2629-a bold young fellow , "[1733-one] [one]1733-one said , " but mind [you]0-edgeways depart early tomorrow as early as [you]0-edgeways can for if [you]0-edgeways do not [you]0-edgeways will lose everything that [you]0-edgeways have won . "[1733-one]

But [I]0-edgeways did not heed them . [The Avenue]864-the avenue was so dark that it was barely possible to distinguish one s hand before one s face , while the distance to [the hotel]157-the hotel was half a verst or so ; but [I]0-edgeways feared [neither pickpockets]1495-neither pickpockets nor [highwaymen]1496-highwaymen . Indeed , never since [my]0-edgeways boyhood have [I]0-edgeways done that . Also , [I]0-edgeways can not remember what [I]0-edgeways thought about on the way . [I]0-edgeways only felt a sort of fearful pleasure the pleasure of success , of conquest , of power ( how can [I]0-edgeways best express it ? ) . Likewise , before [me]0-edgeways there flitted the image of [Polina]47-polina ; and [I]0-edgeways kept remembering , and reminding [myself]0-edgeways , that it was to _ [her]47-polina _ [I]0-edgeways was going , that it was in _ [her]47-polina _ presence [I]0-edgeways should soon be standing , that it was _ [she]47-polina _ to whom [I]0-edgeways should soon be able to relate and show everything . Scarcely once did [I]0-edgeways recall what [she]47-polina had lately said to [me]0-edgeways , or the reason why [I]0-edgeways had left [her]47-polina , or all those varied sensations which [I]0-edgeways had been experiencing a bare hour and a half ago . No , those sensations seemed to be things of the past , to be things which had righted themselves and grown old , to be things concerning which [we]1497-we needed to trouble [ourselves]1497-we no longer , since , for [us]1497-we , life was about to begin anew . Yet [I]0-edgeways had just reached the end of [the Avenue]864-the avenue when there _ did _ come upon [me]0-edgeways a fear of being robbed or murdered . With each step the fear increased until , in [my]0-edgeways terror , [I]0-edgeways almost started to run . Suddenly , as [I]0-edgeways issued from [the Avenue]864-the avenue , there burst upon [me]0-edgeways the lights of [the hotel]157-the hotel , sparkling with a myriad lamps ! Yes , thanks be to [God]82-god , [I]0-edgeways had reached [home]173-home !

Running up to [[my]0-edgeways room]410-my room , [I]0-edgeways flung open the door of [it]410-my room . [Polina]47-polina was still on the sofa , with a lighted candle in front of [her]47-polina , and [her]47-polina hands clasped . As [I]0-edgeways entered [she]47-polina stared at [me]0-edgeways in astonishment ( for , at the moment , [I]0-edgeways must have presented a strange spectacle ) . All [I]0-edgeways did , however , was to halt before [her]47-polina , and fling upon the table [my]0-edgeways burden of wealth .

XV

[I]0-edgeways remember , too , how , without moving from [her]47-polina place , or changing [her]47-polina attitude , [she]47-polina gazed into [my]0-edgeways face .

" [I]0-edgeways have won two hundred thousand francs ! "[0-edgeways] cried [I]0-edgeways as [I]0-edgeways pulled out [my]0-edgeways last sheaf of bank - notes . The pile of paper currency occupied the whole table . [I]0-edgeways could not withdraw [my]0-edgeways eyes from it . Consequently , for a moment or two [Polina]47-polina escaped [my]0-edgeways mind . Then [I]0-edgeways set [myself]0-edgeways to arrange the pile in order , and to sort the notes , and to mass the gold in a separate heap . That done , [I]0-edgeways left everything where it lay , and proceeded to pace [the room]415-the room with rapid strides as [I]0-edgeways lost [myself]0-edgeways in thought . Then [I]0-edgeways darted to the table once more , and began to recount the money ; until all of a sudden , as though [I]0-edgeways had remembered something , [I]0-edgeways rushed to the door , and closed and double - locked it . Finally [I]0-edgeways came to a meditative halt before [my]0-edgeways little trunk .

" Shall [I]0-edgeways put the money there until tomorrow ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways asked , turning sharply round to [Polina]47-polina as the recollection of [her]47-polina returned to [me]0-edgeways .

[She]47-polina was still in [her]47-polina old place still making not a sound . Yet [her]47-polina eyes had followed every one of [my]0-edgeways movements . Somehow in [her]47-polina face there was a strange expression an expression which [I]0-edgeways did not like . [I]0-edgeways think that [I]0-edgeways shall not be wrong if [I]0-edgeways say that it indicated sheer hatred .

Impulsively [I]0-edgeways approached [her]47-polina .

" [Polina]47-polina , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said , " here are twenty - five thousand florins fifty thousand francs , or more . Take them , and tomorrow throw them in [De Griers]73-de griers face . "[0-edgeways]

[She]47-polina returned no answer .

" Or , if [you]47-polina should prefer , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways continued , " let [me]0-edgeways take [them]2630-them to [him]73-de griers [myself]0-edgeways tomorrow yes , early tomorrow morning . Shall [I]0-edgeways ? "[0-edgeways]

Then all at once [she]47-polina burst out laughing , and laughed for a long while . With astonishment and a feeling of offence [I]0-edgeways gazed at [her]47-polina . [Her]47-polina laughter was too like the derisive merriment which [she]47-polina had so often indulged in of late merriment which had broken forth always at the time of [my]0-edgeways most passionate explanations . At length [she]47-polina ceased , and frowned at [me]0-edgeways from under [her]47-polina eyebrows .

" [I]47-polina am _ not _ going to take [your]0-edgeways money , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina said contemptuously .

" Why not ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways cried . " Why not , [Polina]47-polina ? "[0-edgeways]

" Because [I]47-polina am not in the habit of receiving money for nothing . "[47-polina]

" But [I]0-edgeways am offering it to [you]0-edgeways as [a _ friend]1407-a _ friend _ . In the same way [I]0-edgeways would offer [you]0-edgeways [my]0-edgeways very life . "[0-edgeways]

Upon this [she]47-polina threw [me]0-edgeways a long , questioning glance , as though [she]47-polina were seeking to probe [me]0-edgeways to the depths .

" [You]0-edgeways are giving too much for [me]47-polina , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina remarked with a smile . " [The beloved of [De Griers]73-de griers]2632-the beloved of de griers is not worth fifty thousand francs . "[47-polina]

" Oh [Polina]47-polina , how can [you]47-polina speak so ? "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways exclaimed reproachfully . " Am _ [I]0-edgeways _ [De Griers]73-de griers ? "[0-edgeways]

" [You]0-edgeways ? "[47-polina] [she]47-polina cried with [her]47-polina eyes suddenly flashing . " Why , [I]47-polina _ hate _ [you]0-edgeways ! Yes , yes , [I]47-polina _ hate _ [you]0-edgeways ! [I]47-polina love [you]0-edgeways no more than [I]47-polina do [De Griers]73-de griers . "[47-polina]

Then [she]47-polina buried [her]47-polina face in [her]47-polina hands , and relapsed into hysterics . [I]0-edgeways darted to [her]47-polina side . Somehow [I]0-edgeways had an intuition of something having happened to [her]47-polina which had nothing to do with [myself]0-edgeways . [She]47-polina was like [a person temporarily insane]1504-a person temporarily insane .

" Buy [me]47-polina , would [you]0-edgeways , would [you]0-edgeways ? Would [you]0-edgeways buy [me]47-polina for fifty thousand francs as [De Griers]73-de griers did ? "[47-polina] [she]47-polina gasped between [her]47-polina convulsive sobs .

[I]0-edgeways clasped [her]47-polina in [my]0-edgeways arms , kissed [her]47-polina hands and feet , and fell upon [my]0-edgeways knees before [her]47-polina .

Presently [the hysterical fit]1505-the hysterical fit passed away , and , laying [her]47-polina hands upon [my]0-edgeways shoulders , [she]47-polina gazed for a while into [my]0-edgeways face , as though trying to read it something [I]0-edgeways said to [her]47-polina , but it was clear that [she]47-polina did not hear it . [Her]47-polina face looked so dark and despondent that [I]0-edgeways began to fear for [her]47-polina reason . At length [she]47-polina drew [me]0-edgeways towards [herself]47-polina a trustful smile playing over [her]47-polina features ; and then , as suddenly , [she]47-polina pushed [me]0-edgeways away again as [she]47-polina eyed [me]0-edgeways dimly .

Finally [she]47-polina threw [herself]47-polina upon [me]0-edgeways in an embrace .

" [You]0-edgeways love [me]47-polina ? "[47-polina] [she]47-polina said . " _ Do _ [you]0-edgeways ? [you]0-edgeways who were willing even to quarrel with [the Baron]1935-the baron at [my]47-polina bidding ? "[47-polina]

Then [she]47-polina laughed laughed as though something dear , but laughable , had recurred to [her]47-polina memory . Yes , [she]47-polina laughed and wept at the same time . What was [I]0-edgeways to do ? [I]0-edgeways was like [a man in a fever]250-a man in a fever . [I]0-edgeways remember that [she]47-polina began to say something to [me]0-edgeways though _ what _ [I]0-edgeways do not know , since [she]47-polina spoke with a feverish lisp , as though [she]47-polina were trying to tell [me]0-edgeways something very quickly . At intervals , too , [she]47-polina would break off into the smile which [I]0-edgeways was beginning to dread . " No , no ! "[47-polina] [she]47-polina kept repeating . " _ [You]0-edgeways _ are [[my]47-polina dear one]2634-my dear one ; _ [you]0-edgeways _ are [the man [I]47-polina trust]2635-the man i trust . "[47-polina] Again [she]47-polina laid [her]47-polina hands upon [my]0-edgeways shoulders , and again [she]47-polina gazed at [me]0-edgeways as [she]47-polina reiterated : " [You]0-edgeways love [me]47-polina , [you]0-edgeways love [me]47-polina ? Never before had [I]0-edgeways seen [her]47-polina in this mood of humility and affection . True , the mood was the outcome of hysteria ; but ! All of a sudden [she]47-polina noticed [my]0-edgeways ardent gaze , and smiled slightly . The next moment , for no apparent reason , [she]47-polina began to talk of [Astley]54-mr. astley .

[She]47-polina continued talking and talking about [him]54-mr. astley , but [I]0-edgeways could not make out all [she]47-polina said more particularly when [she]47-polina was endeavouring to tell [me]0-edgeways of something or other which had happened recently . " Yes , yes , [he]54-mr. astley is there , "[47-polina] [she]47-polina said . " Open the window , and see if [he]54-mr. astley is not . "[47-polina] [She]47-polina pushed [me]0-edgeways in that direction ; yet , no sooner did [I]0-edgeways make a movement to obey [her]47-polina behest than [she]47-polina burst into laughter , and [I]0-edgeways remained beside [her]47-polina , and [she]47-polina embraced [me]0-edgeways .

" Shall [we]2636-we go away tomorrow ? "[47-polina] presently [she]47-polina asked , as though some disturbing thought had recurred to [her]47-polina recollection . Then [she]47-polina kissed and embraced [me]0-edgeways again ; again [she]47-polina pressed [her]47-polina face to [mine]0-edgeways with tender passion . Yet [I]0-edgeways neither saw nor heard [her]47-polina , for [my]0-edgeways head was in a whirl ....

It must have been about seven o clock in the morning when [I]0-edgeways awoke . Daylight had come , and [Polina]47-polina was sitting by [my]0-edgeways side a strange expression on [her]47-polina face , as though [she]47-polina had seen a vision and was unable to collect [her]47-polina thoughts . [She]47-polina too had just awoken , and was now staring at the money on the table . [My]0-edgeways head ached ; it felt heavy . [I]0-edgeways attempted to take [Polina]47-polina s hand , but [she]47-polina pushed [me]0-edgeways from [her]47-polina , and leapt from the sofa . The dawn was full of mist , for rain had fallen , yet [she]47-polina moved to the window , opened it , and , leaning [her]47-polina elbows upon the window - sill , thrust out [her]47-polina head and shoulders to take the air . In this position did [she]47-polina remain for several minutes , without ever looking round at [me]0-edgeways , or listening to what [I]0-edgeways was saying . Into [my]0-edgeways head there came the uneasy thought : What is to happen now ? How is it all to end ? Suddenly [Polina]47-polina rose from the window , approached the table , and , looking at [me]0-edgeways with an expression of infinite aversion , said with lips which quivered with anger :

" Well ? Are [you]0-edgeways going to hand [me]0-edgeways over [my]0-edgeways fifty thousand francs ? "[0-edgeways]

" [Polina]47-polina , [you]47-polina say that _ again , again ? _ "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways exclaimed .

" [You]47-polina have changed [your]47-polina mind , then ? Ha , ha , ha ! [You]47-polina are sorry [you]47-polina ever promised [them]2644-them ? "[0-edgeways]

On the table where , the previous night , [I]0-edgeways had counted the money there still was lying the packet of twenty five thousand florins . [I]0-edgeways handed it to [her]47-polina .

" The francs are mine , then , are they ? [They]2644-them are [mine]47-polina ? "[47-polina] [she]47-polina inquired viciously as [she]47-polina balanced the money in [her]47-polina hands .

" Yes ; they have _ always _ been [yours]47-polina , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said .

" Then _ take _ [your]47-polina fifty thousand francs ! "[47-polina] and [she]47-polina hurled them full in [my]0-edgeways face . The packet burst as [she]47-polina did so , and the floor became strewed with bank - notes . The instant that the deed was done [she]47-polina rushed from [the room]415-the room .

At that moment [she]47-polina can not have been in [her]47-polina right mind ; yet , what was the cause of [her]47-polina temporary aberration [I]0-edgeways can not say . For a month past [she]47-polina had been unwell . Yet what had brought about this _ present _ condition of mind , above all things , this outburst ? Had it come of wounded pride ? Had it come of despair over [her]47-polina decision to come to [me]0-edgeways ? Had it come of the fact that , presuming too much on [my]0-edgeways good fortune , [I]0-edgeways had seemed to be intending to desert [her]47-polina ( even as [De Griers]73-de griers had done ) when once [I]0-edgeways had given [her]47-polina the fifty thousand francs ? But , on [my]0-edgeways honour , [I]0-edgeways had never cherished any such intention . What was at fault , [I]0-edgeways think , was [her]47-polina own pride , which kept urging [her]47-polina not to trust [me]0-edgeways , but , rather , to insult [me]0-edgeways even though [she]47-polina had not realised the fact . In [her]47-polina eyes [I]0-edgeways corresponded to [De Griers]73-de griers , and therefore had been condemned for a fault not wholly [my]0-edgeways own . [Her]47-polina mood of late had been a sort of delirium , a sort of light - headedness that [I]0-edgeways knew full well ; yet , never had [I]0-edgeways sufficiently taken it into consideration . Perhaps [she]47-polina would not pardon [me]0-edgeways now ? Ah , but this was _ the present _ . What about the future ? [Her]47-polina delirium and sickness were not likely to make [her]47-polina forget what [she]47-polina had done in bringing [me]0-edgeways [De Griers]73-de griers letter . No , [she]47-polina must have known what [she]47-polina was doing when [she]47-polina brought it .

Somehow [I]0-edgeways contrived to stuff the pile of notes and gold under the bed , to cover them over , and then to leave [the room]415-the room some ten minutes after [Polina]47-polina . [I]0-edgeways felt sure that [she]47-polina had returned to [[her]47-polina own room]1212-her own room ; wherefore , [I]0-edgeways intended quietly to follow [her]47-polina , and to ask [the nursemaid]738-the nursemaid aid who opened the door how [[her]47-polina mistress]1511-her mistress was . " [Mlle]50-mlle . left [me]0-edgeways but ten minutes ago , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways said . " What can have become of [her]50-mlle ? "[0-edgeways] [The nursemaid]738-the nursemaid looked at [me]0-edgeways reproachfully .

Already sundry rumours were flying about [the hotel]157-the hotel . " Eh bien , que feras - tu si je te prends avec moi ? First of all [I]1551-i must have fifty thousand francs , and [you]0-edgeways shall give them to [me]1551-i at [Frankfurt]36-frankfurt . "[1551-i]

" What ? [You]1551-i mean to say that [we]2669-we should spend the whole in two months ? "[1551-i]

[XVI

Of [Paris]9-paris]1561-xvi of paris what am [I]0-edgeways to say ? [The whole proceeding]1562-the whole proceeding was a delirium , a madness . [I]0-edgeways spent a little over three weeks there , and , during that time , saw [my]0-edgeways hundred thousand francs come to an end . [I]0-edgeways speak only of the _ one _ hundred thousand francs , for the other hundred thousand [I]0-edgeways gave to [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle in pure cash . That is to say , [I]0-edgeways handed [her]50-mlle fifty thousand francs at [Frankfurt]36-frankfurt , and , three days later ( in [Paris]9-paris ) , advanced [her]50-mlle another fifty thousand on note of hand . " Et les cent mille francs qui nous restent , "[50-mlle] [she]50-mlle added , " tu les mangeras avec moi , mon utchitel . "[50-mlle] Yes , [she]50-mlle always called [me]0-edgeways [her]50-mlle " utchitel . "[50-mlle] [A person]1898-a person more economical , grasping , and mean than [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche]50-mlle [one]1733-one could not imagine . But this was only as regards _ [her]50-mlle own _ money . _ [My]0-edgeways _ hundred thousand francs ( as [she]50-mlle explained to [me]0-edgeways later ) [she]50-mlle needed to set up [[her]50-mlle establishment in [Paris]9-paris]1565-her establishment in paris , " so that once and for all [I]50-mlle may be on a decent footing , and proof against any stones which may be thrown at [me]50-mlle at all events for a long time to come . "[50-mlle] Nevertheless , [I]0-edgeways saw nothing of those hundred thousand francs , for [my]0-edgeways own purse ( which [she]50-mlle inspected daily ) never managed to amass in it more than a hundred francs at a time ; and , generally the sum did not reach even that figure .

" What do _ [you]0-edgeways _ want with money ? "[50-mlle] [she]50-mlle would say to [me]0-edgeways with air of absolute simplicity ; and [I]0-edgeways never disputed the point . "[50-mlle] However , [her]50-mlle " wretchedness "[50-mlle] had cost fifty thousand francs , while with the remaining fifty thousand [she]50-mlle purchased [a carriage]2222-a carriage and horses .

Also , [we]1570-we gave a couple of balls evening parties attended by [Hortense]136-hortense and [Lisette]137-lisette and [Cl opatre]138-cl opatre , who were women remarkable both for the number of [their]1571-their liaisons and ( though only in some cases ) for [their]1571-their good looks . [They]1577-they used to try to make fun of [me]0-edgeways , but [I]0-edgeways would console [myself]0-edgeways by drinking champagne and then lolling in [a retiring - room]1578-a retiring - room . Nevertheless , [I]0-edgeways found it deadly work . " C est un utchitel , "[50-mlle] [Blanche]50-mlle would say of [me]0-edgeways , " qui a gagn deux cent mille francs , and but for [me]50-mlle , would have had not a notion how to spend them . [I]0-edgeways had the more frequent recourse to champagne in that [I]0-edgeways constantly felt depressed and bored , owing to the fact that [I]0-edgeways was living in [the most bourgeois commercial milieu imaginable [a milieu wherein [every sou]1581-every sou was counted and grudged]1580-a milieu wherein every sou was counted and grudged]1579-the most bourgeois commercial milieu imaginable a milieu wherein every sou was counted and grudged . Indeed , two weeks had not elapsed before [I]0-edgeways perceived that [Blanche]50-mlle had no real affection for [me]0-edgeways , even though [she]50-mlle dressed [me]0-edgeways in elegant clothes , and [herself]50-mlle tied [my]0-edgeways tie each day . In short , [she]50-mlle utterly despised [me]0-edgeways . But that caused [me]0-edgeways no concern . [Blas]139-blas and inert , [I]0-edgeways spent [my]0-edgeways evenings generally at [the Ch teau des Fleurs]1582-the ch teau des fleurs , where [I]0-edgeways would get fuddled and then dance the cancan ( which , in that establishment , was a very indecent performance ) with clat . At length , the time came when [Blanche]50-mlle had drained [my]0-edgeways purse dry . [She]50-mlle had conceived an idea that , during the term of [our]1583-our residence together , it would be well if [I]0-edgeways were always to walk behind [her]50-mlle with a paper and pencil , in order to jot down exactly what [she]50-mlle spent , what [she]50-mlle had saved , what [she]50-mlle was paying out , and what [she]50-mlle was laying by . Well , of course [I]0-edgeways could not fail to be aware that this would entail a battle over every ten francs ; so , although for every possible objection that [I]0-edgeways might make [she]50-mlle had prepared a suitable answer , [she]50-mlle soon saw that [I]0-edgeways made no objections , and therefore , had to start disputes [herself]50-mlle . That is to say , [she]50-mlle would burst out into tirades which were met only with silence as [I]0-edgeways lolled on a sofa and stared fixedly at the ceiling . This greatly surprised [her]50-mlle . At first [she]50-mlle imagined that it was due merely to the fact that [I]0-edgeways was [a fool]1895-a fool , " un utchitel "[1895-a fool] ; wherefore [she]50-mlle would break off [her]50-mlle harangue in the belief that , being too stupid to understand , [I]0-edgeways was a hopeless case . Then [she]50-mlle would leave [the room]415-the room , but return ten minutes later to resume the contest . This continued throughout [her]50-mlle squandering of [my]0-edgeways money a squandering altogether out of proportion to [our]1586-our means . An example is the way in which [she]50-mlle changed [her]50-mlle first pair of horses for a pair which cost sixteen thousand francs .

" [Bibi]140-bibi , "[50-mlle] [she]50-mlle said on the latter occasion as [she]50-mlle approached [me]0-edgeways , " surely [you]140-bibi are not angry ? "[50-mlle]

" Then [you]140-bibi are not angry ? "[50-mlle]

True enough , from that time onward [she]1587-she seemed to attach [herself]1587-she only to [me]0-edgeways , and in this manner [we]1588-our spent [our]1588-our last ten days together . The promised " toiles "[1587-she] [I]0-edgeways did not see , but in other respects [she]1587-she , to a certain extent , kept [her]1587-she word . But [I]0-edgeways need not enlarge further , for to do so would require a story to itself , and entail a colouring which [I]0-edgeways am loth to impart to the present narrative . The point is that with all [my]0-edgeways faculties [I]0-edgeways desired the episode to come to an end as speedily as possible . Unfortunately , [our]1588-our hundred thousand francs lasted [us]1588-our , as [I]0-edgeways have said , for very nearly a month which greatly surprised [me]0-edgeways . At all events , [Blanche]50-mlle bought [herself]50-mlle articles to the tune of eighty thousand francs , and the rest sufficed just to meet [our]1588-our expenses of living . Towards the close of the affair , [Blanche]50-mlle grew almost frank with [me]0-edgeways ( at least , [she]1587-she scarcely lied to [me]0-edgeways at all ) declaring , amongst other things , that none of the debts which [she]1587-she had been obliged to incur were going to fall upon [my]0-edgeways head . " [I]50-mlle have purposely refrained from making [you]0-edgeways responsible for [my]50-mlle bills or borrowings , "[50-mlle] [she]50-mlle said , " for the reason that [I]50-mlle am sorry for [you]0-edgeways . [Any other woman in [my]50-mlle place]2697-any other woman in my place would have done so , and have let [you]0-edgeways go to [prison]2698-prison . See , then , how much [I]50-mlle love [you]0-edgeways , and how good - hearted [I]50-mlle am ! Think , too , what this accursed marriage with [the General]150-the general is going to cost [me]50-mlle ! "[50-mlle]

True enough , the marriage took place . It did so at the close of [our]1590-our month together , and [I]0-edgeways am bound to suppose that it was upon the ceremony that the last remnants of [my]0-edgeways money were spent . With it the episode that is to say , [my]0-edgeways sojourn with [the Frenchwoman]2227-the frenchwoman came to an end , and [I]0-edgeways formally retired from the scene .

It happened thus : A week after [we]1590-our had taken up [[our]1590-our abode in [Paris]9-paris]1592-our abode in paris there arrived [thither]1593-thither [the General]150-the general . [He]150-the general came straight to see [us]1590-our , and thenceforward lived with [us]1590-our practically as [[our]1590-our guest]1595-our guest , though [he]150-the general had [a flat of [his]150-the general own]1596-a flat of his own as well . [Blanche]50-mlle met [him]150-the general with merry badinage and laughter , and even threw [her]50-mlle arms around [him]150-the general . In fact , [she]50-mlle managed it so that [he]150-the general had to follow everywhere in [her]50-mlle train whether when promenading on [the Boulevards]1597-the boulevards , or when driving , or when going to [the theatre]1598-the theatre , or when paying calls ; and this use which [she]50-mlle made of [him]150-the general quite satisfied [the General]150-the general . Still of imposing appearance and presence , as well as of fair height , [he]150-the general had a dyed moustache and whiskers ( [he]150-the general had formerly been in [the cuirassiers]1600-the cuirassiers ) , and a handsome , though a somewhat wrinkled , face . Also , [his]150-the general manners were excellent , and [he]150-the general could carry a frockcoat well the more so since , in [Paris]9-paris , [he]150-the general took to wearing [his]150-the general orders . To promenade [the Boulevards]1597-the boulevards with [such a man]1394-such a man was not only a thing possible , but also , so to speak , a thing advisable , and with this programme [the good but foolish General]1603-the good but foolish general had not a fault to find . The truth is that [he]150-the general had never counted upon this programme when [he]150-the general came to [Paris]9-paris to seek [us]1604-us out . On that occasion [he]150-the general had made [his]150-the general appearance nearly shaking with terror , for [he]150-the general had supposed that [Blanche]50-mlle would at once raise an outcry , and have [him]150-the general put from the door ; wherefore , [he]150-the general was the more enraptured at the turn that things had taken , and spent the month in a state of senseless ecstasy . Already [I]0-edgeways had learnt that , after [our]1604-us unexpected departure from [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg , [he]150-the general had had a sort of a fit that [he]150-the general had fallen into a swoon , and spent a week in a species of garrulous delirium . [Doctors]1961-doctors had been summoned to [him]150-the general , but [he]150-the general had broken away from [them]1961-doctors , and suddenly taken [a train]1606-a train to [Paris]9-paris . Of course [Blanche]50-mlle s reception of [him]150-the general had acted as the best of all possible cures , but for long enough [he]150-the general carried the marks of [his]150-the general affliction , despite [his]150-the general present condition of rapture and delight . To think clearly , or even to engage in any serious conversation , had now become impossible for [him]150-the general ; [he]150-the general could only ejaculate after each word " Hm ! "[150-the general] and then nod [his]150-the general head in confirmation . Sometimes , also , [he]150-the general would laugh , but only in a nervous , hysterical sort of a fashion ; while at other times [he]150-the general would sit for hours looking as black as night , with [his]150-the general heavy eyebrows knitted . Of much that went on [he]150-the general remained wholly oblivious , for [he]150-the general grew extremely absent - minded , and took to talking to [himself]150-the general . Only [Blanche]50-mlle could awake [him]150-the general to any semblance of life . [His]150-the general fits of depression and moodiness in [corners]1607-corners always meant either that [he]150-the general had not seen [her]50-mlle for some while , or that [she]50-mlle had gone out without taking [him]150-the general with [her]50-mlle , or that [she]50-mlle had omitted to caress [him]150-the general before departing . When in this condition , [he]150-the general would refuse to say what [he]150-the general wanted nor had [he]150-the general the least idea that [he]150-the general was thus sulking and moping . Next , after remaining in this condition for an hour or two ( this [I]0-edgeways remarked on two occasions when [Blanche]50-mlle had gone out for the day probably to see [Albert]141-albert ) , [he]150-the general would begin to look about [him]150-the general , and to grow uneasy , and to hurry about with an air as though [he]150-the general had suddenly remembered something , and must try and find it ; after which , not perceiving the object of [his]150-the general search , nor succeeding in recalling what that object had been , [he]150-the general would as suddenly relapse into oblivion , and continue so until the reappearance of [Blanche]50-mlle merry , wanton , half - dressed , and laughing [her]50-mlle strident laugh as [she]50-mlle approached to pet [him]150-the general , and even to kiss [him]150-the general ( though the latter reward [he]150-the general seldom received ) . Once , [he]150-the general was so overjoyed at [her]50-mlle doing so that [he]150-the general burst into tears . Even [I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways was surprised .

From the first moment of [his]150-the general arrival in [Paris]9-paris , [Blanche]50-mlle set [herself]50-mlle to plead with [me]0-edgeways on [his]150-the general behalf ; and at such times [she]50-mlle even rose to heights of eloquence saying that it was for _ [me]0-edgeways _ [she]50-mlle had abandoned [him]150-the general , though [she]50-mlle had almost become [[his]150-the general betrothed]1608-his betrothed and promised to become so ; that it was for _ [her]50-mlle _ sake [he]150-the general had deserted [[his]150-the general family]1732-his family ; that , having been in [his]150-the general service , [I]0-edgeways ought to remember the fact , and to feel ashamed . To all this [I]0-edgeways would say nothing , however much [she]50-mlle chattered on ; until at length [I]0-edgeways would burst out laughing , and the incident would come to an end ( at first , as [I]0-edgeways have said , [she]50-mlle had thought [me]0-edgeways [a fool]1895-a fool , but since [she]50-mlle had come to deem [me]0-edgeways [a man of sense and sensibility]1611-a man of sense and sensibility ) . In short , [I]0-edgeways had the happiness of calling [her]50-mlle better nature into play ; for though , at first , [I]0-edgeways had not deemed [her]50-mlle so , [she]50-mlle was , in reality , [a kind - hearted woman after [her]50-mlle own fashion]1612-a kind - hearted woman after her own fashion . " [You]0-edgeways are good and clever , "[50-mlle] [she]50-mlle said to [me]0-edgeways towards the finish , " and [my]50-mlle one regret is that [you]0-edgeways are also so wrong - headed . [You]0-edgeways will _ [her]50-mlle _ be [a rich man]2700-a rich man ! "[50-mlle]

" [Un vrai Russe un Kalmuk]2701-un vrai russe un kalmuk "[50-mlle] [she]50-mlle usually called [me]0-edgeways .

Several times [she]50-mlle sent [me]0-edgeways to give [the General]150-the general an airing in [the streets]1614-the streets , even as [she]50-mlle might have done with a lacquey and [her]50-mlle spaniel ; but , [I]0-edgeways preferred to take [him]150-the general to [the theatre]1598-the theatre , to [the Bal Mabille]1616-the bal mabille , and to [restaurants]1617-restaurants . For this purpose [she]50-mlle usually allowed [me]0-edgeways some money , though [the General]150-the general had a little of [his]150-the general own , and enjoyed taking out [his]150-the general purse before [strangers]1980-strangers . Once [I]0-edgeways had to use actual force to prevent [him]150-the general from buying a phaeton at a price of seven hundred francs , after [a vehicle]1620-a vehicle had caught [his]150-the general fancy in [the Palais Royal]1621-the palais royal as seeming to be a desirable present for [Blanche]50-mlle . What could _ [she]50-mlle _ have done with a seven - hundred - franc phaeton ? and [the General]150-the general possessed in [the world]263-the world but a thousand francs ! The origin even of those francs [I]0-edgeways could never determine , but imagined them to have emanated from [Mr.]1624-mr. Astley the more so since [the latter]196-the latter had paid [the family]1329-the family s hotel bill . As for what view [the General]150-the general took of [myself]0-edgeways , [I]0-edgeways think that [he]150-the general never divined the footing on which [I]0-edgeways stood with [Blanche]50-mlle . True , [he]150-the general had heard , in a dim sort of way , that [I]0-edgeways had won a good deal of money ; but more probably [he]150-the general supposed [me]0-edgeways to be acting as [secretary]1628-secretary or even as [a kind of servant to [[his]150-the general inamorata]1630-his inamorata]1629-a kind of servant to his inamorata . At all events , [he]150-the general continued to address [me]0-edgeways , in [his]150-the general old haughty style , as [[my]0-edgeways superior]1631-my superior . At times [he]150-the general even took it upon [himself]150-the general to scold [me]0-edgeways . One morning in particular , [he]150-the general started to sneer at [me]0-edgeways over [our]1632-our matutinal coffee . Though not [a man prone to take offence]1633-a man prone to take offence , [he]150-the general suddenly , and for some reason of which to this day [I]0-edgeways am ignorant , fell out with [me]0-edgeways . Of course even [he]150-the general [himself]150-the general did not know the reason . To put things shortly , [he]150-the general began a speech which had neither beginning nor ending , and cried out , b tons rompus , that [I]0-edgeways was [a boy whom [he]150-the general would soon put to rights and so forth , and so forth]1634-a boy whom he would soon put to rights and so forth , and so forth . Yet [no one]2107-no one could understand what [he]150-the general was saying , and at length [Blanche]50-mlle exploded in a burst of laughter . Finally something appeased [him]150-the general , and [he]150-the general was taken out for [his]150-the general walk . More than once , however , [I]0-edgeways noticed that [his]150-the general depression was growing upon [him]150-the general ; that [he]150-the general seemed to be feeling the want of [somebody]1636-somebody or something ; that , despite [Blanche]50-mlle s presence , [he]150-the general was missing [some person in particular]1637-some person in particular . Twice , on these occasions , did [he]150-the general plunge into a conversation with [me]0-edgeways , though [he]150-the general could not make [himself]150-the general intelligible , and only went on rambling about the service , [[his]150-the general late wife]1638-his late wife , [[his]150-the general home]1639-his home , and [[his]150-the general property]1885-his property . Every now and then , also , some particular word would please [him]150-the general ; whereupon [he]150-the general would repeat it a hundred times in the day even though the word happened to express neither [his]150-the general thoughts nor [his]150-the general feelings . Again , [I]0-edgeways would try to get [him]150-the general to talk about [[his]150-the general children]379-his children , but always [he]150-the general cut [me]0-edgeways short in [his]150-the general old snappish way , and passed to another subject . " Yes , yes [[my]150-the general children]2452-my children , "[150-the general] was all that [I]0-edgeways could extract from [him]150-the general . " Yes , [you]150-the general are right in what [you]150-the general have said about [them]2452-my children . "[150-the general] Only once did [he]150-the general disclose [his]150-the general real feelings . That was when [we]1642-we were taking [him]150-the general to [the theatre]1598-the theatre , and suddenly [he]150-the general exclaimed : " [[My]150-the general unfortunate children]2703-my unfortunate children ! Yes , [sir]1968-sir , [they]2703-my unfortunate children _ are _ [unfortunate children]2705-unfortunate children . "[150-the general] Once , too , when [I]0-edgeways chanced to mention [Polina]47-polina , [he]150-the general grew quite bitter against [her]47-polina . " [She]47-polina is [an ungrateful woman]2706-an ungrateful woman ! "[150-the general] [he]150-the general exclaimed . " [She]47-polina is [a bad and ungrateful woman]2707-a bad and ungrateful woman ! [She]47-polina has broken up [a family]2664-a family . If there were laws [here]1772-here , [I]150-the general would have [her]47-polina impaled . Yes , [I]150-the general would . "[150-the general] As for [De Griers]73-de griers , [the General]150-the general would not have [his]73-de griers name mentioned . " [He]73-de griers has ruined [me]150-the general , "[150-the general] [he]150-the general would say . " [He]73-de griers has robbed [me]150-the general , and cut [my]150-the general throat . For two years [he]73-de griers was a perfect nightmare to [me]150-the general . For months at a time [he]73-de griers never left [me]150-the general in [my]150-the general dreams . Do not speak of [him]73-de griers again . "[150-the general]

It was now clear to [me]0-edgeways that [Blanche]50-mlle and [he]150-the general were on the point of coming to terms ; yet , true to [my]0-edgeways usual custom , [I]0-edgeways said nothing . At length , [Blanche]50-mlle took the initiative in explaining matters . [She]50-mlle did so a week before [we]1645-we parted .

" Il a de la chance , "[50-mlle] [she]50-mlle prattled , " for [the Grandmother]396-the grandmother is now _ really _ ill , and therefore , bound to die . [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley has just sent a telegram to say so , and [you]0-edgeways will agree with [me]50-mlle that [the General]150-the general is likely to be [[her]396-the grandmother heir]2712-her heir . Even if [he]150-the general should not be so , [he]150-the general will not come amiss , since , in the first place , [he]150-the general has [his]150-the general pension , and , in the second place , [he]150-the general will be content to live in [a back room]2713-a back room ; whereas _ [I]50-mlle _ shall be [Madame General]100-madame general , and get into [a good circle of society]2714-a good circle of society "[50-mlle] ( [she]50-mlle was always thinking of this ) " and become a [Russian ch telaine]2715-russian ch telaine . Yes , [I]50-mlle shall have [a mansion of [my]50-mlle own]2716-a mansion of my own , and [peasants]2717-peasants , and a million of money at [my]50-mlle back . "[50-mlle]

" But , suppose [he]150-the general should prove jealous ? [He]150-the general might demand all sorts of things , [you]50-mlle know . Do [you]50-mlle follow [me]1646-she ? "[1646-she]

" Oh , dear no ! How ridiculous that would be of [him]150-the general ! Besides , [I]50-mlle have taken measures to prevent it . [You]50-mlle need not be alarmed . That is to say , [I]50-mlle have induced [him]150-the general to sign notes of hand in [Albert]141-albert s name . Consequently , at any time [I]50-mlle could get [him]150-the general punished . Isn t [he]150-the general ridiculous ? "[50-mlle]

" Very well , then . Marry [him]150-the general . "[1646-she]

And , in truth , [she]1646-she did so though the marriage was a family one only , and involved no pomp or ceremony . In fact , [she]1646-she invited to the nuptials none but [Albert]141-albert and [a few other friends]1647-a few other friends . [Hortense]136-hortense , [Cl opatre]138-cl opatre , and the rest [she]1646-she kept firmly at a distance . As for [the bridegroom]1648-the bridegroom , [he]1648-the bridegroom took a great interest in [his]1648-the bridegroom new position . [Blanche]50-mlle [herself]50-mlle tied [his]1648-the bridegroom tie , and [Blanche]50-mlle [herself]50-mlle pomaded [him]1648-the bridegroom with the result that , in [his]1648-the bridegroom frockcoat and white waistcoat , [he]1648-the bridegroom looked quite comme il faut .

" Il est , pourtant , _ tr s _ comme il faut , "[50-mlle] [Blanche]50-mlle remarked when [she]50-mlle issued from [[his]1648-the bridegroom room]1079-his room , as though the idea that [he]1648-the bridegroom was " _ tr s _ comme il faut "[50-mlle] had impressed even [her]50-mlle . For [myself]0-edgeways , [I]0-edgeways had so little knowledge of the minor details of the affair , and took part in it so much as [a supine spectator]1650-a supine spectator , that [I]0-edgeways have forgotten most of what passed on this occasion . [I]0-edgeways only remember that [Blanche]50-mlle and [the Widow]1651-the widow figured at it , not as " [de Cominges]96-de cominges , "[1651-the widow] but as " [du Placet]142-du placet . "[1652-they] Why [they]1652-they had hitherto been " [de Cominges]96-de cominges "[1652-they] [I]0-edgeways do not know [I]0-edgeways only know that this entirely satisfied [the General]150-the general , that [he]150-the general liked the name " [du Placet]142-du placet "[150-the general] even better than [he]150-the general had liked the name " [de Cominges]96-de cominges . "[150-the general] On the morning of the wedding , [he]1648-the bridegroom paced [the salon]471-the salon in [his]1648-the bridegroom gala attire and kept repeating to [himself]1648-the bridegroom with an air of great gravity and importance : " [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche du Placet]142-du placet ! [Mlle]50-mlle . [Blanche du Placet]142-du placet , [du Placet]142-du placet ! "[1648-the bridegroom] [He]1648-the bridegroom beamed with satisfaction as [he]1648-the bridegroom did so . Both in [the church]1655-the church and at the wedding breakfast [he]1648-the bridegroom remained not only pleased and contented , but even proud . [She]1656-she too underwent a change , for now [she]1656-she assumed an air of added dignity .

" [I]1656-she must behave altogether differently , "[1656-she] [she]1656-she confided to [me]0-edgeways with a serious air . " Yet , mark [you]0-edgeways , there is a tiresome circumstance of which [I]1656-she had never before thought which is , how best to pronounce [my]1656-she new family name . [Zagorianski]143-zagorianski , [Zagozianski]38-zagozianski , Madame la G n rale de Sago , Madame la G n rale de Fourteen Consonants oh these infernal Russian names ! The _ last _ of [them]2718-them would be the best to use , don t [you]0-edgeways think ? "[1656-she]

At length the time had come for [us]1657-us to part , and [Blanche]50-mlle , [the egregious Blanche]50-mlle , shed real tears as [she]1656-she took [her]1656-she leave of [me]0-edgeways . " Tu tais bon enfant "[1656-she] [she]1656-she said with a sob . " Je te croyais b te et tu en avais l air , but it suited [you]0-edgeways . "[1656-she] Then , having given [me]0-edgeways a final handshake , [she]1656-she exclaimed , " [Attends]144-attends ! "[1656-she] ; whereafter , running into [her]1656-she boudoir , [she]1656-she brought [me]0-edgeways thence two thousand - franc notes . [I]0-edgeways could scarcely believe [my]0-edgeways eyes ! " They may come in handy for [you]0-edgeways , "[1656-she] [she]1656-she explained , " for , though [you]0-edgeways are [a very learned tutor]2719-a very learned tutor , [you]0-edgeways are [a very stupid man]2720-a very stupid man . More than two thousand francs , however , [I]1656-she am not going to give [you]0-edgeways , for the reason that , if [I]1656-she did so , [you]0-edgeways would gamble them all away . Now good - bye . Nous serons toujours bons amis , and if [you]0-edgeways win again , do not fail to come to [me]1656-she , et tu seras heureux . "[1656-she]

[I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways had still five hundred francs left , as well as a watch worth a thousand francs , a few diamond studs , and so on . Consequently , [I]0-edgeways could subsist for quite a length of time without particularly bestirring [myself]0-edgeways . Purposely [I]0-edgeways have taken up [[my]0-edgeways abode]1658-my abode where [I]0-edgeways am now partly to pull [myself]0-edgeways together , and partly to wait for [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley , who , [I]0-edgeways have learnt , will soon be [here]1772-here for a day or so on business . Yes , [I]0-edgeways know that , and then and then [I]0-edgeways shall go to [Homburg]37-homburg . But to [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg [I]0-edgeways shall not go until next year , for [they]1660-they say it is bad to try one s luck twice in succession at a table . Moreover , [Homburg]37-homburg is where the best play is carried on .

XVII

It is a year and eight months since [I]0-edgeways last looked at these notes of [mine]0-edgeways . [I]0-edgeways do so now only because , being overwhelmed with depression , [I]0-edgeways wish to distract [my]0-edgeways mind by reading them through at random . [I]0-edgeways left them off at the point where [I]0-edgeways was just going to [Homburg]37-homburg . [[My]0-edgeways God]2506-my god , with what a light heart ( comparatively speaking ) did [I]0-edgeways write the concluding lines ! though it may be not so much with a light heart , as with a measure of self - confidence and unquenchable hope . At that time had [I]0-edgeways any doubts of [myself]0-edgeways ? Yet behold [me]0-edgeways now . Scarcely a year and a half have passed , yet [I]0-edgeways am in a worse position than [the meanest beggar]1662-the meanest beggar . But what is [a beggar]2416-a beggar ? A fig for [beggary]1664-beggary ! [I]0-edgeways have ruined [myself]0-edgeways that is all . Nor is there anything with which [I]0-edgeways can compare [myself]0-edgeways ; there is no moral which it would be of any use for [you]1665-you to read to [me]0-edgeways . At the present moment nothing could well be more incongruous than a moral . Oh , [[you]1665-you self - satisfied persons who , in [your]1665-you unctuous pride , are forever ready to mouth [your]1665-you maxims if only [you]1665-you knew how fully [I]0-edgeways [myself]0-edgeways comprehend the sordidness of [my]0-edgeways present state]1666-you self - satisfied persons who , in your unctuous pride , are forever ready to mouth your maxims if only you knew how fully i myself comprehend the sordidness of my present state , [you]1665-you would not trouble to wag [your]1665-you tongues at [me]0-edgeways ! What could [you]1665-you say to [me]0-edgeways that [I]0-edgeways do not already know ? Well , wherein lies [my]0-edgeways difficulty ? It lies in the fact that by a single turn of a roulette wheel everything for [me]0-edgeways , has become changed . Yet , had things befallen otherwise , [these moralists]1667-these moralists would have been among the first ( yes , [I]0-edgeways feel persuaded of it ) to approach [me]0-edgeways with friendly jests and congratulations . Yes , [they]1667-these moralists would never have turned from [me]0-edgeways as [they]1667-these moralists are doing now ! A fig for all of [them]1667-these moralists ! What am [I]0-edgeways ? [I]0-edgeways am zero nothing . What shall [I]0-edgeways be tomorrow ? [I]0-edgeways may be risen from the dead , and have begun life anew . For still , [I]0-edgeways may discover [the man]2421-the man in [myself]0-edgeways , if only [my]0-edgeways manhood has not become utterly shattered .

[I]0-edgeways went , [I]0-edgeways say , to [Homburg]37-homburg , but afterwards went also to [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg , as well as to [Spa]22-spa and [Baden]40-baden ; in which [latter place]1669-latter place , for a time , [I]0-edgeways acted as [valet to a certain rascal of [a Privy Councillor]1671-a privy councillor , by name Heintze , who until lately was also [[my]0-edgeways master]1672-my master here]1670-valet to a certain rascal of a privy councillor , by name heintze , who until lately was also my master here . Yes , for five months [I]0-edgeways lived [my]0-edgeways life with lacqueys ! That was just after [I]0-edgeways had come out of [Roulettenberg prison]1673-roulettenberg prison , where [I]0-edgeways had lain for a small debt which [I]0-edgeways owed . Out of [that prison]1674-that prison [I]0-edgeways was bailed by by whom ? By [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley ? By [Polina]47-polina ? [I]0-edgeways do not know . At all events , the debt was paid to the tune of two hundred thalers , and [I]0-edgeways sallied forth [a free man]1675-a free man . But what was [I]0-edgeways to do with [myself]0-edgeways ? In [my]0-edgeways dilemma [I]0-edgeways had recourse to [this Heintze]1676-this heintze , who was [a young scapegrace]1677-a young scapegrace , and [the sort of man who could speak and write three languages]1678-the sort of man who could speak and write three languages . At first [I]0-edgeways acted as [[his]1676-this heintze secretary]1679-his secretary , at a salary of thirty g lden a month , but afterwards [I]0-edgeways became [[his]1676-this heintze lacquey]1680-his lacquey , for the reason that [he]1676-this heintze could not afford to keep [a secretary]1681-a secretary only [an unpaid servant]1682-an unpaid servant . [I]0-edgeways had nothing else to turn to , so [I]0-edgeways remained with [him]1676-this heintze , and allowed [myself]0-edgeways to become [[his]1676-this heintze flunkey]1683-his flunkey . But by stinting [myself]0-edgeways in meat and drink [I]0-edgeways saved , during [my]0-edgeways five months of service , some seventy g lden ; and one evening , when [we]1684-we were at [Baden]40-baden , [I]0-edgeways told [him]1676-this heintze that [I]0-edgeways wished to resign [my]0-edgeways post , and then hastened to betake [myself]0-edgeways to roulette .

Oh , how [my]0-edgeways heart beat as [I]0-edgeways did so ! No , it was not the money that [I]0-edgeways valued what [I]0-edgeways wanted was to make all this mob of [Heintzes]1685-heintzes , [hotel proprietors]1686-hotel proprietors , and [fine ladies of [Baden]40-baden]1687-fine ladies of baden talk about [me]0-edgeways , recount [my]0-edgeways story , wonder at [me]0-edgeways , extol [my]0-edgeways doings , and worship [my]0-edgeways winnings . True , these were childish fancies and aspirations , but who knows but that [I]0-edgeways might meet [Polina]47-polina , and be able to tell [her]47-polina everything , and see [her]47-polina look of surprise at the fact that [I]0-edgeways had overcome so many adverse strokes of fortune . No , [I]0-edgeways had no desire for money for [its]1688-its own sake , for [I]0-edgeways was perfectly well aware that [I]0-edgeways should only squander it upon [some new Blanche]1689-some new blanche , and spend another three weeks in [Paris]9-paris after buying a pair of horses which had cost sixteen thousand francs . No , [I]0-edgeways never believed [myself]0-edgeways to be [a hoarder]1690-a hoarder ; in fact , [I]0-edgeways knew only too well that [I]0-edgeways was a spendthrift . And already , with a sort of fear , a sort of sinking in [my]0-edgeways heart , [I]0-edgeways could hear the cries of [the croupiers]910-the croupiers " Trente et un , rouge , impair et passe , "[910-the croupiers] " Quarte , noir , pair et manque . "[910-the croupiers] How greedily [I]0-edgeways gazed upon the gaming - table , with its scattered louis d or , ten - g lden pieces , and thalers ; upon the streams of gold as they issued from the croupier s hands , and piled themselves up into heaps of gold scintillating as fire ; upon the ell long rolls of silver lying around the croupier . Even at a distance of [two rooms]512-two rooms [I]0-edgeways could hear the chink of that money so much so that [I]0-edgeways nearly fell into convulsions .

Ah , the evening when [I]0-edgeways took those seventy g lden to the gaming table was a memorable one for [me]0-edgeways . [I]0-edgeways began by staking ten g lden upon passe . For passe [I]0-edgeways had always had a sort of predilection , yet [I]0-edgeways lost [my]0-edgeways stake upon it . This left [me]0-edgeways with sixty g lden in silver . After a moment s thought [I]0-edgeways selected zero beginning by staking five g lden at a time . Twice [I]0-edgeways lost , but the third round suddenly brought up the desired coup . [I]0-edgeways could almost have died with joy as [I]0-edgeways received [my]0-edgeways one hundred and seventy - five g lden . Indeed , [I]0-edgeways have been less pleased when , in former times , [I]0-edgeways have won a hundred thousand g lden . Losing no time , [I]0-edgeways staked another hundred g lden upon the red , and won ; two hundred upon the red , and won ; four hundred upon the black , and won ; eight hundred upon manque , and won . Thus , with the addition of the remainder of [my]0-edgeways original capital , [I]0-edgeways found [myself]0-edgeways possessed , within five minutes , of seventeen hundred g lden . Ah , at such moments one forgets both [oneself]1693-oneself and one s former failures ! This [I]0-edgeways had gained by risking [my]0-edgeways very life . [I]0-edgeways had dared so to risk , and behold , again [I]0-edgeways was [a member of [mankind]297-mankind]1694-a member of mankind !

[I]0-edgeways went and hired [a room]1696-a room , [I]0-edgeways shut [myself]0-edgeways up in [it]1696-a room , and sat counting [my]0-edgeways money until three o clock in the morning . To think that when [I]0-edgeways awoke on the morrow , [I]0-edgeways was no lacquey ! [I]0-edgeways decided to leave at once for [Homburg]37-homburg . [There]317-there [I]0-edgeways should neither have to serve as [a footman]1698-a footman nor to lie in [prison]2698-prison . Half an hour before starting , [I]0-edgeways went and ventured a couple of stakes no more ; with the result that , in all , [I]0-edgeways lost fifteen hundred florins . Nevertheless , [I]0-edgeways proceeded to [Homburg]37-homburg , and have now been [there]317-there for a month .

Of course , [I]0-edgeways am living in constant trepidation , playing for the smallest of stakes , and always looking out for something calculating , standing whole days by the gaming - tables to watch the play even seeing that play in [my]0-edgeways dreams yet seeming , the while , to be in some way stiffening , to be growing caked , as it were , in mire . But [I]0-edgeways must conclude [my]0-edgeways notes , which [I]0-edgeways finish under the impression of a recent encounter with [Mr. Astley]54-mr. astley . [I]0-edgeways had not seen [him]54-mr. astley since [we]1701-we parted at [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg , and now [we]1701-we met quite by accident . At the time [I]0-edgeways was walking in [the public gardens]2368-the public gardens , and meditating upon the fact that not only had [I]0-edgeways still some fifty g lden in [my]0-edgeways possession , but also [I]0-edgeways had fully paid up [my]0-edgeways hotel bill three days ago . Consequently , [I]0-edgeways was in a position to try [my]0-edgeways luck again at roulette ; and if [I]0-edgeways won anything [I]0-edgeways should be able to continue [my]0-edgeways play , whereas , if [I]0-edgeways lost what [I]0-edgeways now possessed , [I]0-edgeways should once more have to accept a lacquey s place , provided that , in the alternative , [I]0-edgeways failed to discover [a Russian family which stood in need of a tutor]1703-a russian family which stood in need of a tutor . Plunged in these reflections , [I]0-edgeways started on [my]0-edgeways daily walk through [the Park]171-the park and [forest]1705-forest towards [a neighbouring principality]503-a neighbouring principality . Sometimes , on such occasions , [I]0-edgeways spent four hours on the way , and would return to [Homburg]37-homburg tired and hungry ; but , on this particular occasion , [I]0-edgeways had scarcely left [the gardens]1707-the gardens for [the Park]171-the park when [I]0-edgeways caught sight of [Astley]54-mr. astley seated on a bench . But [he]1713-i was wrong . Of [myself]0-edgeways [I]0-edgeways say nothing . Yet yet words are only words . [I]0-edgeways need to _ act _ . Above all things [I]0-edgeways need to think of [Switzerland]5-switzerland . Tomorrow , tomorrow Ah , but if only [I]0-edgeways could set things right tomorrow , and be born again , and rise again from the dead ! But no [I]0-edgeways can not . [I]0-edgeways have only to remember what happened to [me]0-edgeways some months ago at [Roulettenberg]1-roulettenberg , before [my]0-edgeways final ruin . " Perhaps [I]0-edgeways shall need it for a meal , "[0-edgeways] [I]0-edgeways thought to [myself]0-edgeways ; but a hundred paces further on , [I]0-edgeways changed [my]0-edgeways mind , and returned . That g lden [I]0-edgeways staked upon manque and there _ is _ something in the feeling that , though [one]1733-one is alone , and in [a foreign land]1720-a foreign land , and far from [one s own home]1721-one s own home and [friends]2114-friends , and ignorant of whence one s next meal is to come , [one]1733-one is nevertheless staking one s very last coin ! No ; tomorrow all shall be ended !
